Pink sauce isn't on the menu but they said they would do it for us.  It was pretty average.  I've definitely had better.  We also ordered sausage and peppers and the bf loved that.  From the looks of everyone elses orders it was a wide variety of selections and I didnt hear any complaints and there were alot of clean plates.

I've been here several times and we definitely don't come for the food...it is pretty average...mainly for the the ambiance and the one of a kind experience.  Gordie, the accordion player, is such a pleasant addition to the experience as he gifts us with his music and witty songs.  It is a good place to celebrate special days with a group or even for date night.

The place is a Las Vegas staple amongst the locals and vacationers.
It is all about the simple things:  Gordie, the decor/ambiance, the menu on the wall, the complimentary wine, even the door to the restaurant that looks kinda like a barrel when you come through the front door.  Sometime simple is best. ;)

Great place to visit, delicious food. There is always a wait but worth it. Traditional type Italian menu and presentation that includes wine with your meal. Very family friendly. Definitely would return.

Awesome Italian food! Meals include wine, garlic bread ( amazing), minestrone or salad, entree and cappuccino. Great deal for Las Vegas! I had the shrimp scampi which included a very big portion of jumbo sized shrimps. WELL done! Reservations are highly suggested as it gets busy.

I do not know what all the hoopla is about this place. It is average and a little expensive if you ask me. Typical Italian restaurant. The food is OK not exceptional. the shrimp scampi was a little disappointing to me. Nothing to get excited about.

This place does not disappoint! You get salad or soup with your meal, and an entire kraft of wine! You also get a cappuccino that's amazing!!! The food portions are large! This was recommended by the cab driver and he did not disappoint. Pricing starts around $22

Some places are good if you're with your buddies, other places are good if you're with your wife. This place fits any bill! It's dark and romantic, yet fun. It's not the cheapest place in town (Meals start at about $20) and it's absolutely no good if you don't like cheap wine. But, if you can afford it, and you like cheap wine... This is it! There's even a strolling accordion player named Gordy to serenade you during your meal. You get your choice of standard Italian entrees (My favorites are the Lasagna and the Veal Parmigiana) and meals include, salad, great garlic bread, your entree, hot chocolate (they call it a cappuccino, but it's hot chocolate) AND, oh my god, are you sitting down for this? ALL THE CHEAP WINE YOU CAN DRINK!!! They'll ask you if you like white or red. If you're smart, one person at the table will say "red" and someone else will say "white", that way they'll bring two carafes right off the bat... then they just keep bringing them! Oh, you'll feel so sick in the morning!

I'm not one to write a bad review, I usually just don't go back. But I've lived in vegas for 5 years, being from New Jersey I've eaten the best in Jersey and All the 5 boroughs in New York. And believe me between Vegas and Henderson there are some really excellent italian restaurants....I'm 100% italian and in the food business. So I know what food should taste, look, smell like....First off I've passed this joint 100 times...always said one day I'll give it a shot...so the other night I did....my foodie partner and I walk in...first I think wow this joint is gonna be great...just by the ambiance of kinda vintage ol' school Vegas...so I give it and 8 for appearance....not clean or organized at all but that doesn't mean it's gonna be a bad joint...now we sit down and we are given Red wine on the house with little tasting glasses which I loved...thought man this joint is going on my list...ok skip ahead to the menu on the wall...yeah u read that right....there's a huge ass menu on the wall with the normal shit on it...MEATBALLS, SPAGHETTI, CHICKEN PARM, EGGPLANT PARM, u get the idea....ok no big deal this is what this guy offers, ok so be it. Now for the prices? And I ain't cheap by any means, this place is a joke...but we order anyway thinking small menu, high prices he has to use top of the line products...yeah not so much...I order eggplant Parm with a side of Meatballs...my buddy ordered chicken rio, ok so now the garlic bread comes along with my complimentary salad and his soup, he said the soup was average and my salad was good, crispy romaine sliced Mozzarella not fresh but restaurant depot or Sysco crap...ok no big deal...now 7 min after ordering our food comes out...yes i time the order to the time I'm served....RED Flag...right away...no way that's cooked to order...it came out my gravy tasted like pure sugar and dark...which means he uses a shit tomato and that gravy has been cooking all day down to a thick transmission fluid like state...and full of oil..the Meatballs were hard as rocks, means he only uses a shit beef in them and then bakes them off which is ok if u use the right mix...they where dead to me not soft and firm like a good Meatball should be and tasteless no garlic or fresh Grated Parm Regg in them just BLAH...my eggplant itself was ok...but the gravy ruined the taste for me...my buddies chicken rio was dry and bland and fell apart which means it was made earlier in the day and sat in a cold drawer and just put in a pan with that cream sauce over rottini macaroni.....awful to serve that shit....take pride in your food...
Now we decided to order a slice of taramisu ok store bought shit or made last Monday it was sour and smelt like what ever fridge it was in....and the complimentary "cappuccino " was that Swiss miss hot chocolate and cappuccino mix...with a shit load of whip cream on it..actually best part of the meal....this joint sucks...this ain't italian food....save yourself the trip....will I be back....only against my will....sorry guys if u read this...take some pride in your food and taste it before it leaves the kitchen.

I love this place and eat here every time I come to Vegas.  The Chicken Parmesan is so good.   The first time I ate here, we had to wait an hour to get a table.  Now I make a reservation through Yelp and I don't have to wait.  The food is very good and there is a lot of it!  .  
And Gordy the accordion player!  He is a gem, so fun to hear him him play and people singing along.

Love this place! Old school at its best..The food is great! Now I have had better...but the atmosphere and the all you can drink wine are the best! Better check it out ..before its demolished for a fancy hotel/casino!
Awesome in every way!!! Great authentic Italian food. Great service. And awesome atmosphere. 5 stars all the way!!!

Great food, fun atmosphere for an awesome price.

It's great for a birthday, anniversary or date night. 

And to top it off they have the cutest accordion player.

All I can say is WOW!!! The Veal Marsala was the best I have ever had. Complimentary red and white wine. Wife had Chicken Parmasean, she said it was very good. Bread was very oily and garlic but was good. It soaked up a days worth of drinks. Definitely  recommend this "Hole in the Wall" when coming to Las Vegas.
A hidden gem that looks like a hole in the wall, unlimited wine, need I say more?? Ok ok the meals are a little pricey but they are very good, the chicken parm is a favorite!

My friends and I got lost on a Thursday night and literally stumbled into this "hole in the wall" at 10pm (they close at 10:30) but everyone from the hostess to waiter was so accommodating, letting us know we weren't rushed. 

Even though I'm not a big wine person, I still thought I got my moneys worth from the experience alone. For $25 you get all you can drink red and white wine, a salad, pasta, garlic bread, and a dessert  cappuccino (amazing by the way). Anywhere else on the strip you can spend that on a burger, and a glass of water.

I recommend the fettuccine Alfredo, their sauce is amazing and they even give a bowl of it on the side.

I love this place.

This place was great, the bartender Jane was in training and she had a great personality and always made sure we had nice and cold drinks..The customers that are regulars their were really friendly..We actually left and ended up coming back later LOL..Make sure you visit Jane during graveyard you will not be disappointed
Had the chopped clams over linguine white. Very good, lots of clans and very tasty.  Would go back.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G-! The price is fair enough... All dinners include: garlic bread (deliciouuuuus *-*), soup or salad and all wine u can drink... Plus the coffee (that we couldnt drink, since we were too satisfied). The minestrone soup is perfect (as the garlic bread). And also the whole dinner... The place is beautiful, the decoration rocks!!! And the people who works there also!!! I wish we could stay more in Vegas to eat there again. *-*

Amazing place! I had the chicken parm and I have every intention of going back. All you can drink wine, soup/salad, garlic bread, food and a cappuccino is amazing. It's expensive but worth it for the amount you get. I'm pretty picky when it comes to food and I know what the good food is. This place is A+. Four stars given because the accordion player played for like 3 seconds before expecting tips then leaving.

Let's start with the positives.  I like the atmosphere.  The little guy playing the accordion is cool.  OK, I'm done.

The wine is served in large quantities, but it is not good.  Stay away from the white wine.  It's bad.  Don't drink the white wine, man.

The food is not good.  I would say the food tasted like ass, but that would be mean.

There are better Italian restaurants in your home town.  Frequent a nice, independent Italian restaurant when you get back home.

Food is bland and severely lacks in taste and seasoning. Sure the never ending wine is great but the food tastes like it is straight off the airplane. The decor is nice but that's all that is worth writing about at this joint.
went on a sat nite due to a Friends recommendation. atmosphere great food not so much. veal tasted stale  & steak Caruso was very bland.endless table wine a plus

This place is a piece of Las Vegas history.  You could spend hours looking at all the photos plastered all over the wall of famous and semi-famous people that ate there throughout the years.  The atmosphere is sort of romantic and casual depending on where they seat you.  The menu is on every wall and is all inclusive.  So what ever meal you order ($21-$45) it includes soup or salad, garlic bread, entree, cappuccino and all the free wine you can drink (red/white).  One word of caution on the wine if you love and know good wines, this stuff is not that.  It is the cheapest stuff you'll ever choke down.  I've have the veal in the past and the spaghetti with sausage which are ok at best.  I've spent a lot less and had much better food at other places like The Olive Garden. The only reason I've been here several times is because my wife loves it.  If it wasn't for her I would not be back!

What a blast! This place was recommended by someone from home (Boston, MA) to our traveling group of 8 and we figured why the hell not.

They pack you in there, but that was half the fun-- there was even a rehearsal dinner while we were there and the whole room stopped to hear the toast of thanks from the bride to be. Very cozy. The accordion player is a real delight as well.

Overall-- fantastic! My lasagna was to die for and soup or salad, red and white wine and cappuccino are all included in the meals, priced about $20-30.

I really do love the glitz and glamour of Vegas, but this was a nice respite, and so close by, for one meal.
Great italian food. Like homemade

This is a fantastic find off The Strip!  Battista's is the complete package: a mom-and-pop Italian restaurant that's been unchanged for decades, complete with a plastic grape and Chianti bottle motif adorning walls and ceiling. Lots of photos of stars who have visited.  Start with minestrone or salad with house Italian dressing and garlic bread (all OK but noting fantastic).  Best of all, all you can drink red or white table wine which is pretty good and a great deal.  Followed by a tastey and generously portioned main course.  Lucky the acordian player will delight you with a song.  I'll be back.
I've never had a bad experience here. All you can each bread and wine. The entree's are very good for the price and the old man playing the accordian even knew my college fight song. I will be back.

The ambiance was true Italian, but I'm not sure the little man playing his instrument for money was. The cioppino was not what I recalled. Probably won't go back. I was planning this visit for 7 months. Disappointed.

I just moved to Vegas & stumbled upon Battista's Hole In The Wall, which has truly become my #1 favorite Italian Restaurant in all of Vegas!!!

I absolutely love their food........you cannot go wrong, no matter what you order.    The employees are really friendly and helpful.
Carey, who was the server helping me the first time I dined there, made my dining experience really great and she is a great part of the reason I go back.

Every time I go to Vegas I have to stop in at Batista's
I have been coming here for more than 20 years. Now that I'm older my kids like it too. It's dark, its old, its garlicy and it has history.
Let's not forget the little guy that plays the accordion....been here forever. It's not fancy but its good food especially with a large group.
The cappuccino at the end is a little weird and tastes like powdered coffee.

I love the little man with the accordion, but that's about it. Service is slow, although we were seated quickly, as they try to serve a few tables at once, like an assembly line. The sauce tasted raw, although the pasta was al dente. You can do better than this, guys. This place has definitely seen it's heyday. Anyone that knows what Italian food is supposed to taste like will not like this place. We didn't even finish our food, which is unusual for us.

This was our second visit.  Went last year and it was good.  This year, everything was bad.  The white wine was warm.  The salad was pre-made and wilted.  Last year the cheese in the salad was real mozzarella but this year it was cheap crinkle cut white cheese.  UGG!    My ravioli was hot but had no flavor.  I tried using salt and the grated cheese to give it some kind of flavor but it was no good.  We were given a booth in a corner and told to sit there.  No one helped pull out the table so we could get behind the table.  We were able to avoid the accordion player but heard others who were not so lucky.  The cappuccino was not even warm.  Heard the people next to us say that even Ragu spaghetti sauce tastes better and we agreed.  We were so looking forward to eating here, but after last week, we will never go back.  I know times are hard,  but where you cut corners by serving inferior food, you are killing your business.

Pretty bad that we had to go out to dinner at another place right after paying the hole in the wall for their "dinner".

I don't usually give 5 stars, but when I do, it involves home made food and drink with a wandering accordion player.

This was an incredible meal and even being with 15+ people, the speed we got our food was impressive and the overall service was excellent. Cannot go wrong with any of the specials either, make it a point to get here.

One of my favorites for old school Italian! I always visit when I'm in Vegas.

Bautista's has been in the same location, I'm guessing for 40 years or so. Complimentary house wine, cappuccino garlic bread with every meal. All you can drink wine? YES! 

The food is awesome! Service awesome! Lots if old memorabilia and pictures fill the charming restaurant. It gets packed so bring your patience, have a cocktail and enjoy the experience!

I ordered the ziti with meat sauce. I had to ask them to take the dish back. No flavor whatsoever. The sauce tasted as if it came from a can and the meat had no flavor. Not worth $20+ on its best day. My minestrone soup was cold when it was brought to the table. I had to ask the manager to remove my $12 cover charge for the soup that I had and a taste of the wine. The service was awful and the food not worth a second try.

We visit Las Vegas three times a year for Bowling Tournaments for years.  Every year we have visited Battista's with group of 8 or 10 people.  It is always fun to see all the memorabilia and greet the friendly Staff.  We especially enjoy the sweet little man that visits your table and sing something special.  Our visit in July 2016 was probably our last.  The food had no taste.  We all had different selections.  The restaurant feels old and not welcoming.  The person who sat us at our table was rushing ys and unfriendly.  They had just opened so they were not busy.  Our waiter was nice and helpful.

Warning: After living in Italy for 3 yrs and having an Italian Mother in law, I am an Italian food snob. Better to have high standards than none!

Honestly- this place is way over priced and the food not so good. Only good thing going was the decor and the ambiance.

Here's the breakdown:
1. Food way over priced. Yes, you get salad or soup, garlic bread and free red & white wine. But when you're paying min. $21, the main entree better taste good. And it didn't. Granted the portions are HUGE but still not worth if if the food is bad.
2. I ordered the linguini seafood- the seafood part was good but the sauce was bland and tasted too much like tomato paste. The pasta itself was way too al dente. 
3. My sister ordered the cheese ravioli- the sauce was also way too bland and there was too much sauce on the dish. 
4. For dessert, we sampled the cheesecake- tasted like a frozen cheesecake from a local grocery store. 
5. The "cappucino" is really not cappucino. It's more like hot chocolate. Also, as an Italian restaurant, the owners should know better- in Italy, cappucino is a breakfast drink. In the evenings, one drinks espresso with or without liquor in it. 
6. Nothing special about the salad or the wines. I can definintely say I have had better wines.
7. The guy with the accordion was a little creepy.

I would never recommend this place to anyone other than to walk past it.
Good for the ambiance and experience.  Food just fine, but certainly not great.  Not a wine guy, so the included wine carafes were irrelevant.
Best Italian in Vegas... The garlic bread is to die for. You are full when u leave. Unlimited house wine and choice of soup or salad! Great ending with perfect cappuccino

If you want to find a little piece of heaven just go to Battistas Hole in the wall.  When you first arrive you will most likely notice the decorations. It reminded us of almost an Old Italian mob scene. It was all so interesting to look at and entertaining! I have never been to a restaurant that I found it entertaining just to look at the walls and ceiling. Old black and white pictures covered the walls and they hung pots, pans, and baskets to the ceiling, which I felt gave it a very Italian feeling. 

Now the food; AMAZING. Seriously, I don't think I can ever, I mean ever, eat at another Italian restaurant again. First we were offered breadsticks, salad, and soup. The garlic breadstick, to die for! I have never tasted bread that has tasted so delicious; I practically filled up on those before I could even order. For the main course I ordered cheese raviolis. Those where also the best I have ever had. The cheese literally melted in your mouth like butter. I couldn't stop my self from eating! My boyfriend got the eggplant Parmesan. Now that is some good food. I highly recommend that. It is now my favorite dish out of all the restaurants we go too. Its that kind of amazingly perfect good taste that can't be described.

After we ate we thought we would go out for desert. That didn't happen though! They brought out delicious cappuccinos. (They are apart of the dinner course so you are not charged for them) They were better then any hot chocolate/coffee/cappuccino I have ever had from anywhere else. It was the perfect amount of sweet and even though I was stuffed I drank the whole cup! (Which is a decent size)

Now I am really ready to go, but wait! It was my birthday and my boyfriend had surprised them and told them when he called for the reservations. They brought out a small piece of cake. AMAZING, AGAIN! It blows my mind that every course of this meal was spot on. It seemed like it was a moist sponge cake with delicious cream on top. I could have eaten like 10 of those.

The environment was also wonderful. I forget that on the strip people just want to have a good time. So even though we felt like the guests sat to close it was actually worth it. We joked with them and had such a good time. Our waitress was so sweet. I really felt like she took excellent care of us.


Now there are two reasons way I did not give this a 5 star. The location is the first. I would have never even known it was there. It is literally a hole in the wall. The area isn't the nicest but I am always paranoid about that.

The second reason was the "lives music". This man would walk table to table and plan a small 2-second snip of a song (of his choosing) and then ask YOU for a tip. I thought it was rude because we didn't ask him to come over so being forced to tip after was a little uncomfortable. I couldn't hear him sing over his accordion so I didn't get to enjoy it anyway. We only had a five so when my boyfriend asked for change back he acted like he didn't hear him and walked away. When he made his second round he made sure not to stop at our table (even though 5 dollars was probably his best tip of the night)

Over all I say GO! We defiantly will be!

Battista's may not be considered "fine dining," but it earns a 5-star rating from me! I love bringing visitors here, and here's why:

  * Ambiance: This is old-school Vegas. There aren't many places like this anymore, with big red booths, dark secluded rooms, and celebrity photos on the walls. 
  * Service: From the hostess to our waitress and busser, everyone was friendly and professional. Too bad we missed the accordion player on the night we visited.
  * Price: Meals range from $23 to $41 per person. A steal, when you consider they offer tons of food and all-you-can-drink wine!

And, most of all ...

 * Food: Great cheesy garlic bread. Great salad (more like an antipasto than a traditional house salad). A tasty cappuccino after dinner. And Italian classics like chicken parm ($31) and veal marsala ($34), plus faves like spaghetti and meatballs, linguine and clams, lasagna, and ravioli. Although the underseasoned entrees are the weak links in the lineup, they are still pretty tasty. And did I mention ALL-YOU-CAN-DRINK WINE?! And they aren't stingy with it, either. Ask for red, white, or both, and they will bring you a carafe or two--or more. (Just don't be a lush and spoil it for the rest of us!)

This may be just a "hole in the wall," but as the landscape around it changes, I wholly hope Battista's is here to stay!

What a great find. Interesting place with great ambiance and delicious food. Includes house wine, garlic bread and cappacino!!  Plus the old man with the accordion was Great! Go if you can because it's worth it.

I truly loved my experience here! We heard that there was an hour wait, so we went to the bar and ordered drinks while we were waiting. I enjoyed a Fat Tire Ale *love* and the bartender was sassy and a lot of fun. We had a good time chatting with the people who were waiting at the bar as well. I really liked the decor and we had calamari as an appetizer, which came out really quickly and was super. 

The meal was delicious and the house wine was good, even though I shouldn't drink wine due to a sensitive stomach; my half glass was good! We all got the feeling that the server didn't really like us, for whatever reason, be it our behavior (we were actually pretty well behaved at this point in the trip) or his night not going so well. 

Keep in mind the portions are very large and the minimum charge per person isn't so bad, even if you share a dish between two and have to tag on the extra $, because you will leave full and satisfied. 

All in all, the food was tasty and we had a great time!

While this may not be the best Italian food I've ever had, its certainly the best Italian restaurant that I've ever been to.. The ambiance is fantastic.  Complete with the old man with an accordion.  

The Garlic Bread is delicious, complete with garlic cloves!  Free Red or White Wine with the meal is also a bonus, and I've never had a better Cappuccino 

Parking is surprisingly ample too.

All and all I really enjoyed my experience at Battista's

So disappointed in how awful this Vegas "gem" has become. The gangsters who made this town are turning in their graves! 
PARKING - forget it !!
RESERVATIONS - yes you need them but why bother ?? We had reservations for 4 at 8:30 pm and didn't get seated until 9:10 pm. 
HOSTESSES - hope you like to be treated like a first grader. Told the girl our whole party was present and she proceeded to say let me know when your whole party arrives !! What ?? 
FOOD - I'm either a food snob, enjoy my own cooking or know why I don't frequent Olive Garden either. This food is below sub par. Truthfully. We sent 2 of the 4 dinners back. Linguine with canned clam sauce ?? We were told they ran out of whole clams ! And you decided that canned clams were acceptable rather than having us make a different food choice ?? Ok ... What about the steak pizzaole ?? Is the steak suppose to be tough (NO !) and is the marinara sauce suppose to be tasteless ?? NO !!! Send it back !!
CAPPUCCINO - really ?? Powdered cappuccino with whipped cream ?? Who puts whipped cream in cappuccino ??? Probably those first graders I referred to earlier. 

If you want a great authentic Italian meal (yes I'm Italian and yes my son is a chef) ... SKIP THIS RESTAURANT !!!!!! Awful

Taking an alternate route from the strip, we came upon this place. They weren't open yet, but the kind hostess gave me a menu to check out. Whoa! For $25-$40 you get a salad, amazing garlic bread, your entree, a cappuccino (best I've ever had) and if you're a wine drinker, free wine. Gordy greeted our table with an accordion and a smile to light up any room! The staff were all friendly and prompt. He atmosphere is fantastic. I guess that's why they've been around for over 45 years! Our server was on year 31 when I asked. We will definitely be back!

Do not go here unless you want to be kicked out by the wait staff because they want to close early.. Food is decent. Being asked to leave because they are closing a section completely ruined our experience.

Hole in the Wall?  I think Sh!t hole is more appropriate.  While the server was pleasant and professional, they served my daughter sour, curdled milk.  How does that happen?  The garlic bread was stale, the wine was horrible, neither of my girls could stomach their meatballs and the salad was limp.  It was like stepping back in time... and not a good time.

This place is way over priced, even with a Groupon it's NOT WORTH IT.    30.00 a dish,  then a 13.00 plate sharing charge.    What a rip off.   43.00 for a veal parm dish for 2 people, the dish came with two tiny banana split type plates of pasta.... It was really sad.    Oh sorry you also get 2 bottles of wine, one red and one white..BOTH sucked. 
Try  Buca di Beppo instead of this HOLE IN THE WALL.   This place sucks.

Sad to report that I was disappointed when going back.  We brought some friends over here after raving about how great of a deal it was and were sadly disappointed.  I didn't remember how expensive it was!  For some reason, I thought it was a lot cheaper... :(

Everyone's food was alright.  Nothing great or out of this world.  But one of our friends got the ziti w/ meatsauce and it tasted like soap!  The server took it back and brought out a new one, but it tasted the same.  We realized it was just a LOT of herbs that they used, but still... majority of the people at the table thought it tasted soapy.  Boo.

Decided to check out Battista's after a friend recommended it and we had a great date night here. It is your standard Italian fare and the food was good, I would put it on par with Maggiano's or Bucca. The restaurant is dark - great for a date night - and there is an adorable old man who comes around with his accordion and sings (for tips of course). The wine is included with your meal - your choice of red or white - and the biggest point being it is unlimited which I think may be their claim to fame? Our service was good and overall we had a nice time here - I think it is definitely one of those places you just have to try at least once if you are in Vegas.
I really enjoyed the salmon it was cooked perfectly,my friends had chicken Alfredo and a steak and cleaned their plates.

Amazing atmosphere with so much character.  Dinners are large portions, accompanied with wine and dessert cappuccinos included that are in the $25 - $35 price range.  We have eaten here twice now and highly recommend it.  If you get there near 4:30pm when they open, you can get right in.  Check out the full size Clint Eastwood in the women's bathroom.

I always see this place but never stop in. I finally did and was very pleased. The menu is pretty straight forward and posted all over the walls. Despite what you order you're getting a carafe of wine (red or white), salad or soup, garlic bread, and pasta with marinara, and finish the meal off with a cappuccino. I ordered Steak Pizzaiola. It was a huge sirloin (big enough for 2) covered with a tomato and vegetable sauce. The meat was tender and I left feeling nice and stuffed. I will certainly be back.

Sorry,I don't know how any of you can even put "good" and "food" in the same sentence,when referring to this place. I mean,no offense,but I've had better hospital food than what you'd get at this restaurant! The meals,wine and desert are pre-plated. Yes you get the 'house' wine,but it tastes like piss. Not to mention,the service is inexcusable...takes forever to order and forever to get your bill. I only came once a few years ago and walked out,after taking one bite of the food. For $40 (for 2),I could've had a better meal at Paradise Cantina (which is my favorite hole in the wall)down the street.


Would never, ever,recommend this place.  


But,that's just me. I like food to taste good :)

Stumbled into here after a long day of drinking at Wet Republic. Really. Somehow we wandered out of the MGM Grand and walked our way over to here while trying to find a cab. 

The garlic bread is delicious and I filled up on it before our main courses even arrived! We ordered the calamari and fried raviolis as our appetizers, which were pretty good. Unfortunately, our main dishes fell short and were at best, mediocre. My least favorite was the baked cannelloni...too meaty and just lacking in flavor. The shrimp scampi came with a generous amount of shrimp. And the chicken parmigiana was just so-so. On the plus side, everything comes in a huge portion.

Came here with a large group of family on the advice of a Vegas regular.  It's in a tiny strip mall behind the casinos near Bally's.  From the front, you wouldn't think anything of the place, but the food is great!  If you want an old-school Italian restaurant experience, make the short walk over and check it out.

We have been living in Las Vegas for years and always seen the sign, but never thought of going there to eat. 
Friends of the family came to visit from out of state, and they were looking for a place to eat, I suggested the Italian restaurant across the street from where they were staying. 
We made reservations,  and they held our table till the party was together ( they were late).  
The waitress came immediately to the table, introduced herself, then a young waiter came over to the table and brought 2 bottles of wine,  asked us what did want for appetizer,  that was brought out quick, soon after the waitress took our orders, that also came out quick. 
Everyone ordered something different, and my daughter is not a meat eater and the food was to made exactly as she ordered it. 
The food was delicious, very tasty, fresh, and very well seasoned. Afterwards everyone was full. 
A lot of food for your money, and I would recommend this restaurant to all who are looking for a good place to eat, with friends or families. 
They can accommodate small group and large groups.
We had an enjoyable night.

Maybe not the most fabulous Italian food I have ever had but the entire experience is excellent.  They make the dinner easy: soup or salad, bread, and wine come automatically, there is a broad selection of choices, large portions, the ambiance is wonderful, excellent wait staff, and the (tiny) accordion player is a great touch.  It's well worth a visit if you are after something a bit lower key and not RIGHT on the Strip.
This is an Italian restaurant for tourists on a budget. Simply awful!  Gloppy sauce, limited menu, and the rubbery meatballs tasted like horse meat. Cluttered, dusty decor.Skip this!

Cool spot to visit while in Vegas. It is a much cooler bucca di beppo. Meals run about $25/person and comes with house wine. Friendly service. Very dark inside. The area itself is kinda shady but nothing a yelper can't handle. 

I enjoyed my meal. Cheese ravioli with white sauce was easy to handle and not too heavy for the night of drinking that followed. Also, you may need to wait a bit for your table. While you're waiting go next door to the Stage Door Casino where it is cash only at the bar and the drinks are dirt cheap. 

Have a great time!

I will always have good memories of this place.  I really think you should try to venture a little bit off the strip and come here.  You will not regret it.  Good food, great house wines, and perfect for large groups on a budget.

At first bar like entrance...If your looking for Italian food, you found it! Right to the point (hence the writing is on the wall), food is cookie cutter right to order, no personalization of anything in there, have all the house white and red wine you want....It actually makes the food taste better...Choose #'s 1-18 and the last 6 are $32 and higher...You sit right on top of others next too you, however, there conversations are very interesting...

My sorority uses this place for some small events. It's nothing special. When I think of "hole in the wall" i think of a small place that no one knows that is awesome! This place isnt it. The food is so-so. Service is actually pretty good. The place is cramped. It's nto a place that I would go out of my way for... except for sorority events. 

But I suppose this place is good for a drunken time on the strip for a decent price.

I have been eating since 1984 and i have always loved this place. This place has slipped to posibly the worst restaurant in Vegas. Atmosphere is great service is great however the food is absolutely horribly. Took my whole family here for dinner tonight and now they are all mad at me.

Not sure about the negative reviews. This place is an old school mom n pa smell the gravy when u walk in kind of place. If those are your expectations that's what you get. Standard American Italian non fancy dishes. Vat of house wine, lasagna n garlic bread. No big deal just standard hearty Italian.

Visited on 7/11/2011 for my friend Tim Young's 37th birthday.

This place rocks, (Thank you Phil Browning!)

PROS: 

OVERALL FEEL.. This place is THE authentic Italian joint! Everything from the Over sized (bullet proof?) door, to the personally signed photo of Elvis Presley (The King) and all other photos, this place overwhelmingly reminded me of an Italian restaurant out of the movie CASINO.  (WITH ALL DUE RESPECT  :)   ) I think this place is where Bucca di Beppo got its inspiration with with real food that doesn't come from a bag...

THE BREAD: FUGHETABBOUT IT.....  Just remember, ask for the oil & vinegar. Delish!

THE WINE: ALL YOU CAN DRINK HOUSE WINE. Enough said.

THE FOOD: I had the spaghetti w/ Sausage Cacciatore.  Really, really good!

THE SERVICE: Our waiter patiently explained all the ins and outs of each dish giving a well scripted definition of the dish which set the expectation of the guest. 

CONS: Be prepared to pay around $30 per person, but hell it's Vegas and every trip should have at least one solid meal.

OVERALL:

Great conversation, Great food, Great environment.

And as always friends and neighbors, when it comes to Food, Drink or Overall Value........Always trust a FAT MAN! :).

Pat Walters
Anaheim, CA
Excellent food, there was so much we had some to take home. Great service. Calling for a reservation was a very good idea.

Thankfully a co-worker clued me in on this little gem.  What a great find!  Our cab driver even said it's the best place near the strip, the best bang for your buck.  The food is basic Italian, but in a good way, nothing fancy but full of flavor.  Faves from the table were the sausage cacciatore and shrimp with a tasty alfredo sauce.  But the real draw is the all you can drink house wine (both red and white) that they provide for the table.  There's a little man that goes around playing the accordion and the environment is lively and friendly.  The wait staff was fabulous as well.

Battista's is great. Simply great. And there it is... simple.

It's often said of restaurants by restauranteurs is that simple is best, and we've found it here. And right in the middle of the strip no less! What a find!

Old Las Vegas adorns the walls, wine casks abound, a dark, busy and welcoming interior, matched by a staff that's used to managing and shepherding packed packed crowds day in and day out.

You can eat in the bar area, wait for a table with drinks, or stand around and read the short menu until your reservation comes around. Either way, there's lots to see and take in.

The menu is simple, and contains simple Italian food. And yes, everything comes with bread, wine, and soup or salad. What a treat!

For $30, Sarah and I stuffed ourselves by splitting the Lasagna, the salad, basket of bread, and three carafes of wine. Including tip! What a steal, as I said, in the middle of the strip! All the menu says is that there's a $10 minimum per person, so why not split all that yummy simple Italian food!

This was one of our favorite meals from our last trip. The energy, the location. It was a truly old school Vegas experience. Imagine what it was like when Battista's was just one of a few options along the strip of smaller hotel/gambling outlets.... oh yeah, it was just like this, busy, dark, and simple.
Great service, good food, and free wine. Not badly priced either. Not sure if it's an authentic place or a tourist attraction but it doesn't matter it feels real.

Outstanding !!
If you are looking for excellent Italian food in a convivial environment, this is the place. The service is wonderful. The menu is limited to a  20 to 30 excellent dishes all prepared perfectly. Wine is included as is cappuccino and for a little extra you can get some excellent Spinoni. This place is not only about dining, it's about having a great time with a wonderful staff. Great place to take your family or go out with your buddies for a night on the town.

What a great restaurant in Las Vegas. Great traditional Italian food with an all-time vibe. The menu is on the wall, red or white wine comes with all meals. All-around great time great food will be back.

MY BOYFRIEND AND I LOVEEEEEE THIS PLACE!!! every time WE GO TO vegas we eat here, no questions asked. The hours are the only bad part. The eggplant is sooooo good and I love the fact that there is UNLIMITED wine :) who wouldn't?! There is an old man who sings and he is quite funny, not the best singer but he def. puts a smile on your face. I also LOVEEEE the capachino they serve to you after you eat. Everything is amazing. It does not look like it would be that great from the looks on the outside but DON'T JUDGE IT till you eat there. YUMMY!!!!!

A friend of mine recommended this place. So we checked it out- very old school Italian. The menu is posted to the wall and meals come with a house wine. You can also order off a wine list. Excellent meal the marinara sauce was one of he best I've ever had. The cappuccino at the end of the meal was wonderful and the tiramisu was to die for! Definitely recommend.
Awesome good.  Great ambience.  Old school Vegas.  All inclusive menu - wine, salad, meal, cappuccino.  5 stars!!!!!

This "hole in the wall" has been around for many years, and is actually a pretty spacious and fun establishment conveniently located around the corner from the main Strip, just off the beaten path near The LinQ and Flamingo hotels. I recently went with a group of 12 for dinner. The service was good and the noise level was a bit boisterous. Let's not forget about the old-school Italian ambiance. The food was good, not great, but the portions were generous, very reasonably priced and included a lot - in addition to the main dish each meal came with a side of salad, pasta , a cappuccino (although it was actually hot chocolate), and unlimited red and white house wine. It's definitely a must-visit, especially if you're coming in a group - bring your appetites!

The lasagna was one of the best I have ever had.   Amazing.   Salad was fresh and crisp. Service was top notch.   

Definitely a do over.
A hidden gem! Skip the buffets and go here:) the food is great and the atmosphere is even better! Large servings too!

This bizarre and unique spot is the kind of thing you can only find in Vegas. Honesty, I only want to find it in Vegas because what happens here, stays here. 

From the one price for everything including all you can drink cheap wine, to the large portions, and the accordion player from the planet Klepto, there is clearly no other place like it. It never changes. Whether you've visited 20 years ago like I have, or more recently like I have, not one single solitary thing has been altered. You still enter through a weird barrel, the bar is still crazily decorated, and the restaurant itself crams in potentially 100's of people to gorge on Italian American food, wine, and the finest hilarious accordion music in the Western Hemisphere. 

No review can do it justice. Try it once. I dare you.

I like this place :) I lived in Vegas back in 2002 and would take visitors here before going to the strip. The food is good, the wine is free (not top of the line, but what do you really expect for free?) and the service has always been good. 

I just moved back and I thought it was just as I remembered. Great place to have a date :) I got the eggplant parm, which I thought was good. Eggplant can go badly and this one definitely did not!

I still think it's a fun place to eat and will continue to bring my friends here for a meal when they come to visit.

What a fun place to go! We took a group of 7 and made reservations. The table was ready when we arrived. The atmosphere was old time Vegas. 

The service was fast but we never felt like we were rushed. The cappuccino at the end was the perfect way to end the meal. 

Will definitely come back the next time we are in Vegas
This restaurant is a Vegas Icon, love this place, the ambiance is great, food is great, service is great

The menu is really limited. The prices are literally insane. Yes, there is free house wine, but that is not free when you have to pay $25 for a plate of spaghetti. Most of the meals were in the $35 range. Not an elegant place, but the atmosphere is a rustic place steeped in history.

We returned to Battista's Hole in the Wall for the first time in many years. We went for dinner mid-week, but did make a reservation just in case it was busy. We arrived and were seated right away - still love the ambiance of this restsurant right off the strip. All meals include fantastic garlic bread, unlimited wine, appetizer (soup or salad), and cappucino at the end. We had lasagna (fantastic), veal parmigiana, and canneloni. Alot of food - you'll have leftovers to take home - we did ! The strolling accordion player didn't really play anything - he just walked around talking. Comparing this visit with our last one - I think the food has slipped a notch . . . hoping this was just an off night and it hasn't gone downhill ! Still a great spot for Italian food in an authentic location !

I would've had a better evening if I stayed home and opened a can of SpaghettiOs. That is an insult to whoever makes SpaghettiOs. We had four different dishes, each one came with the same tasteless brown colored tomato sauce, unless you consider tin a flavor. Everything on the menu was overpriced they include house wine that tasted like vinegar, the soup was lukewarm, have no idea what the salad tasted like, the garlic bread was exactly that garlicky nothing else to it except grease. Plus it cost $13.00 to split a meal. Worst food ever.

Pretty awesome place next to the Linq!! The food is good and the place itself has a ton of old school charm !! You get house wine , awesome cheese bread , salad or soup and a great selection of Italian food .

The service was good and lighting is perfect ! Been here once before and had a chance to bring my wife and mom for dinner and walked out being stuffed !!

Battista's Hole In the Wall, was recommended to me for Italian meal. And I am very glad it was, this place is a throwback to the old Days building, decor and food. This is how Great Italian food is done, I will be coming here for a meal every time I'm in Las Vegas from now on. Excellent time, service was great as well as the food & drinks.

House Red and White wine is pretty good. The garlic bread and minestrone soup are very good for appetizers as well. Service was excellent, and interior decor was entertaining. I ordered the steak caruso...medium, came with cream spinach and a side of rigatoni...not bad. Definitely get your money's worth here ;)

This is without a doubt my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I travel to Vegas three times a year on business and always make sure we eat here. The service is always spot on and is undoubtedly the best Italian food I've had. The house wine is great but the after dinner cappuccino is the bomb!
It's definitely a must try!!!

I used to really like this place. It was a must everytime I was in Vegas since the 90's. I brought someone new and I was pretty disappointed this time. I made reservations on a Saturday night for 8:30 for a party of two. We ordered two drinks a sea breeze with Shcmirnoff vodka and a gin and tonic. It was $26 for the two I was pretty surprised how expensive they were. Then we had dinner I ordered sausage Cacciatore with ziti pasta. I was surprised how small the portion was for $26 and they charge a minimum of $13 for a split fee but there is not enough food to split it. Two regular  size bowls of pasta at $26 each is outrageous?? It also comes with a salad which is also a joke it has one slice of salami which is thin enough to almost see through a few olives and one block of mozzarella about an inch and a half long. Everything is in chunks so you have to cut everything up. The plates are small so you don't have much room... The sausage Cacciatore wasn't much better. They just throw in one uncut long sausage link. My ziti was overcooked and mushy and my friend thought so as well. He wanted the spaghetti and meatballs but we were told that it has cheese in it. He can't eat cheese. Who puts cheese in their meatballs? All they suggested is it you can get spaghetti with meat sauce. How boring I felt bad. He ordered his with spaghetti and it was spot-on not overcooked it all. I was completely disappointed in my ziti pasta. I told them I wanted the the spaghetti instead since the ziti was overcooked and mushy. I could tell our waitress was not happy. No apology just brought me the tiniest little plate of spaghetti plain and then hardly saw her much after that. A different person served us cappuccinos for dessert. What they call Cappuccino is a complete joke for being an Italian restaurant. It doesn't taste anything like cappuccino it tasted more like instant hot chocolate that had way too much sugar in it. I don't know if I will ever come back again which is sad because I'm always really like this place. I was hoping to show my friend the accordion player but I was told that he was already gone for the night which was a bummer because he's been there forever... sad to say that was the worst experience I've had at Bautista's and I've probably eaten there at least a half-dozen times....

What is it about drinking and partying in Vegas that makes you crave carbs?

After a couple days of punishing my liver, we saw this place and as soon as I saw the sign, I craved spaghetti for the next 2 days.

Food- Like my tip said, unlimited red AND white wine at your dinner. Challenge accepted [insert meme]. The food was really good, not great but definitely good. The meal also came with a salad or soup which was good size. I didn't eat all my meal I think because I tried so hard to drink the wine. 

Service- Not bad, but not good either. About run of the mill. We called earlier in the day for a reservation and we still had to wait 10 minutes? This place on a Tuesday night wasn't even busy?

It's decorated like a buca di peppo and has celebrities on the wall. Anyway, I felt that because of the wine and the value/size of the meal it deserved 5 stars. Possibly 4.5 because the service wasn't so great, but anyhoo, lots of fun.

Come prepared to eat hearty food and drink cheap wine. This place is authentic. So much so that my mother said the accordion player looked "like he came with the place" and my Aunt Sheila said the red "tasted like communion wine."

Speaking of the accordion player, he looks like a shorter version of Sid Caesar and runs fast as hell when you tip him. He played literally one verse of a song, collected the tips we passed forward, and then bowed out and left. I doubt he knows more than one verse of anything.

"The menu's on the wall" threw off quite a few of us. After some of the older folks got their glasses on we figured out what we were eating. Everything comes with house wine, a salad or minestrone soup, the entree, plus cappuccino at the end. The salad was surprisingly delicious and I ate the entire thing. Entrees were pretty quick and I ate as much of the spaghetti and meat sauce that I could stomach. Boxes were plentiful, plus apparently refrigerators were not and I was the only one staying at Paris and got to take everything back to my room. Hopefully it will be equally delicious tomorrow,

Yelp ratings have almost always been on point but this place is the exception.  Most reviews raved about the huge portions, great value and awesome food.  Those reviews could not be farther from the truth.  Another dead giveaway that this place most likely didn't have great food is the "Free Wine."  I was in town for a bachelor party and this is one of the places they picked to check out.

I live in the suburbs of Philly and we are used to great Italian food due to the large Italian population in the tri state area along with fantastic Italian restaurants.  The only thing I can think is that most people don't get a chance to have Italian food often. 

First the portions were not huge or even big.  They were average at best.  The highlight of the entire meal was the salad.  I had the Chicken Parm and it wasn't terrible but I would not send anyone there to try it.  The chicken was bland and the sauce wasn't much better.

In regard to the value...  $30 for a small salad, chicken parm, watered down wine and what they called cappuccino is far from a value.  If it was $12.99 i might agree.

Free wine!  I'm not sure you could even call it wine.  It was more like water with a taste of wine.  

Cappuccino... it was closer to powered hot chocolate

The service was good so they earned two stars.

There are many other options in Vegas if you are looking for a deal that provide much better food and an atmosphere that doesn't resemble a cluttered basement.
My favorite stop in Las Vegas, gone there for many years. Food is great, prices are good, ambiance is very cool.

Went for a surprise birthday dinner for my wife. Host was great. But thats it. Server didn't get to use for 15 minutes, we asked for drinks and he responded"we will get to that what do you want to eat" after 30 minutes we got our drinks with our food.
Steaks were horrible- overcooked and cold imagine that.
Garlic bread is delicious though.
Bill was $700 and i would of been happier eating at a burger joint.

Great atmosphere! The food prices are a little off-putting, but it's definitely enough food to share with someone else (upcharge for sharing though). BUT, the atmosphere totally makes up for it with the unlimited wine and garlic bread, as well as Gordie's famous accordion playing (he played The Notre Dame fight song for us Irish fans). Got the Fettuccine Seafood Sauce and it was fantastic, and the after dinner cappuccinos hit the spot.

This place pretends it's a locals joint, and not a tourist trap.  Even the name "Hole in the Wall" suggests that.  Note that actual "hole in the wall" restaurants don't name themselves as such.  Similar to how girls named "HotChick6969" in AOL chat rooms were rarely actually hot, or even chicks, for that matter.

Anything a block from the strip is not geared towards locals.  If you really want a locals experience, you have to get far enough from the strip to where you can't walk back without your legs hurting.

The food is mediocre.  Not horrible, but if you're expecting a solid, surprisingly good meal from a hidden Italian locals joint, you're going to be disappointed.

I remember when I came in and found out about the free wine.  My heart sank when I heard that.  I knew the wine would be terrible if it was free.  Indeed, it wasn't good.  I didn't even order a second glass.  I felt weird NOT drinking it, because it was included in the price.

Look, if you just want to visit for the accordions and the funky photos on the wall, have at it.  But just remember, someone set this place up in order to draw in dumb tourists walking down Flamingo, who think they're finding some hidden gem off the beaten path.  It's just not what it portrays itself to be, and I think that's what bothers me the most.

This place is FREAKING AMAZING! Why it only has 3 1/2 stars, I don't know why! First off, they give 2 carafes of house wine. The meals are very big and filling! The Steak Pizzaiola! Holy crap! After dinner they give you a Cappuccino that is outstanding! I come to Vegas once a year and WILL COME HERE AGAIN!

Good, solid Italian food is what brings me back to Battista's when I'm in Vegas. The menu is posted on the wall and all meals include wine (your choice of red or white), salad and their amazing garlic bread. I recommend the egglpant parm which is baked with the right amounts of sauce and cheese. While the wine is nothing to write home about, its good enough and goes well with anything on the menu. If you're heading out for a night of drinking on the strip, Battista's is a good first stop for a hearty meal.

Ate there a couple of hours ago with 2 friends. Just vomited for the SECOND time. EVERYTHING was awful. We are all sick and only 1 of us managed to finish an entree. I've NEVER had worse food, of ANY kind, ANYWHERE. We didn't have high expectations, on account of the limitless, free wine, but the wine is cheap and awful. You couldn't drink enough to make up for the cost of the potentially lethal food. I guess their food is always terrible, because the waitstaff cleared our full plates, without question. I might have complained, if we hadn't all been so desperate to get out of there. P.S. Should you ever have the misfortune of being dragged there, don't bother staying for the "cappuccino". It is basically powdered hot chocolate made with water.

The food was mediocre but our server was great and very patient. We had a party of 13 and asked before we made the reservation if we could have separate checks. They told us yes but after we finished eating the server brought one check and informed us they couldn't split the $526.00 tab! The manager came to us and said she would not separate the check because she was busy and had a house to run. Frank, our server, went ahead and split the check. He was very nice and extremely patient. The manager was a witch! We will never eat there again! Honestly, for the hassle, the food is not worth it.

Food was ok nothing spectacular.  could use more flavor or seasoning.  Service was good, like the concept of free wine with dinner really cool and I'm not even a wine drinker.  Don't like the menu being on the walls tacky yet fun.  Thought prices could be a little lower but factor in the free wine its cool. $25-$35 per person however this is not upscale dinning

Your expectations going in will be important. Name of restaurant is the key. It is a hole in the wall so don't expect "four seasons" service. It's a crowded lil place and the servers do the best they can. Food is better than average and you get salad, bread, and wine with your meal. Bread was Awesome!!!!

Not good. Everything tastes canned and low quality. The minestone is absolutely gross and the pasta sauce just seems like tomato paste, water and a few cheap herbs. Nothing was really great at this place. The atmosphere could really work if this place had halfway decent food. It's very expensive for what you actually get. No one I was with finished their meal and it wasn't because they were full. Yuck!
Very expensive for the quality of food. $13 split charge for meal sharing, service was just OK. Soup is not very good. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

The food is excellent with large portions.  The ambiance is somewhere between a TGI Fridays & your corner mom and pop hole in the wall.  The service isn't the best but that's because they're swamped every night. The all you can drink red & white wine is awesome.

Made reservations for Tuesday night at 6:00 p.m.  Arrived just before and was seated right away. Was greeted by bus boy with water.  Waiter arrived 10 minutes after that and took our order.  Salad(good) and garlic bread arrived shortly thereafter with wine.  Wine was chilled and very good. Dinner took its time arriving. Chick Parm arrived with penne and the cream spinach. The portion was large and very good. Spouse had Linguini with white clam sauce. It too was a large portion and good. It was dark inside and had a presence of old Vegas.... Accordion player visited the table and entertained the room for a bit. Perfect! Overall a good place to eat in Vegas for a decent price. Located out the back of Bally's and just across the street.

Awesome atmosphere and great food. The cappuccino was actually hot cocoa with whip cream but other than that it was a fun experience. Very accomodating for our big group of 10. The wine was better than good too. Quick service, fast food. Overall, we were all happy with a good base before a night of drinking.

To my chagrin I went here for my wedding dinner. 

This is cafeteria food. Way overpriced cafeteria food. I wouldn't be so critical but the price warrants any and all criticism.

The free wine is garbage... Though some folks (the folks drinking to get drunk) may not mind. If you buy your vino in a box disregard that last statement.

They had a hack accordian player wandering the room for tips.

We try to go here evey time we go to vegas! It reminds me of an old school east coast italian spot...the menu is simple...you get free garlic bread with every order...and either a salad or soup! Plus another bonus is that you get free wine! They have all the italian classic dishes! But dont load up on the garlic bread or you wont be able to finish your meal! The staff is always great! THiS IS A MUST DO!

This place is like a little piece of Las Vegas history.  An older gentleman serenades you with the accordion and a song that is relevant to your table...he's adorable and talented.  You get FREE (really) house white wine and red wine with your meal, as well as a house salad or minestrone, and after your meal, you get "cappuccino" which is more like hot chocolate with whipped cream on top.  I didn't have very high expectations for this joint, as my father was born in Sicily, so I get the "real deal" at home.  But, I had the cannelloni - and it was pretty darn good!!  Came with a side of cheesy, creamed spinach.  My husband had Cioppino- which had half a lobster tail, chunks of salmon, mussels, and scallops - a big bowl of good seafood in a mildly spicy tomato broth.  And every table gets unlimited garlic cheese Italian bread.  Portions are huge- taste is good-service is spot on.  It's as close to the real deal for those prices as you will ever get!  And you are privileged to dine in a nostalgic place, where the west was once wild, albeit Italian.  That's Amore!!!

We've been coming here for years.  The last time in 2009.  So here we are, January 28, 2013 and decided to try our old haunt.  It hasn't changed a bit.  Busy as ever and the accordion player is still there - though his sets are much shorter!  The food is so-so but there is lots of it.  My husband had spaghetti and meatballs and I had the lasagna.  Huge portions for two people but we managed.  The free wine isn't as good as I remembered - but I had a less discriminating palette back then.  Who's to complain?  It comes with the meal!

Literally a hole in the wall. You enter and expect a little place and walk through the waiting area, and the restaurant opens up to a pretty big space. We were seated on a two seater tabel in the corner. It was of course crowded because it was a holiday. The tables were a little too close for my comfort, but the food was awesome. Dinner came with your choice of complimentary house red or white wine. I had the clam linguini with white wine sauce and my partner had the chicken alfredo. Both were delicious and I was full, but stuffed my face to finish it, I HAD TO! It was too good to take home for later....... plus we wer on our way to a concert that day. We finished up with a complimentary cappuccino and went on our way. Good value for quality of food and service.
This place used to be is all I can say. It is no more. Poor service and worse food. Sad but true. The food at least used to be ok. We won't be going back and it saddens me.

Battista's Hole in the Wall

Location/Parking: Battista's is a quick, easy walk from the Strip in a little strip mall across from Bally's. Look for the big sign. You can't miss it. But don't even think about driving there, because by the end of dinner you won't be able to drive home. 

Atmosphere:  Always crowded. Always a wait. Plan ahead. Seriously. Don't just show up when you're hungry on a Friday evening and think you're gonna waltz right in. Not even on a random Tuesday night. It's always packed with at least an hour wait. Call ahead. 

That said, it's totally worth the wait. Very friendly, cozy, warm atmosphere with a wandering accordion player. Nice touch, that. Not too loud, not too stuffy, no screaming brats. Nothing fancy and it probably hasn't been renovated since well, ever, but it's a nice place for dinner with friends or a long, relaxing date. Just maybe not a first date.

Cleanliness/Service: Decent enough service. No issues regarding cleanliness. I've been here half a dozen times and have never had a bad experience.

Food/Drinks: It's not authentic homemade Italian like your Grandma used to make, but it's not high school cafeteria crap either. Huge portions so don't fill up on the bread. Well, unless you're already on your second carafe of wine. Think Olive Garden or Carrabba's quality with unlimited wine. 

So far I've tried the Lasagna, Chicken Parmegiana, and Chicken Rio. They're all good but the Chicken Rio is my favorite. A friend of mine had the salmon (fresh fish of the day) and said it was very good. I keep meaning to try something different, you know, to give a more thorough review, but the Chicken Rio is just so good. Maybe next time. 

And the after dinner Cappuccino. Best. Cappuccino. Ever. Yum. I mean seriously. I would go there just for that. It's delicious. Very hot chocolate-y. Not sure if it's a legit cappuccino or not, but honestly, who cares?! 

Price: About $28 per person, but that includes your entre, unlimited hot garlic bread, salad or soup, and wine. Yes, wine. House red, house white, or both if you ask nicely. The unlimited wine makes the price much better. It's definitely a good value for the money. You'll never leave hungry. Or sober. 

I love this place and try to visit two or three times a year. It never gets old. Don't forget to tip the accordion player to play you a tune. He's old. He might not be there next time.

I had reservations for over 2 months and last night was the night finally to enjoy the most memorable Italian cuisine since my late mother made. Boy, was I disappointed, she would have rolled over in her grave!
First, I must say the atmosphere was very special with all the old pictures of the past stars and super stars that supposedly ventured into this establishment, but that was the ONLY thing that was enjoyable!
As soon as the four of us were seated, the fast train began! The wine and bread were on the table in seconds (which I thought was nice for quick service, but I had no idea how fast!)
Then the waiter came over to take our order within 5 minutes, not too shabby! 
Then the BEST part was the little old iconic man (36 years) came by too sing a song of someone's home town, but he was quickly told to move out of the way by another waiter bringing our food to us! This was within 10 minutes of receiving our salads, which were 5 minutes after our orders were placed. Stay with me now, the best is here!
Once we shoveled down our supposed great food prepared in 10 minutes or less with the most bland "homemade sauce", the plates were quickly scooped up and our overly sweet cappuccinos were brought (no chance to order anything different) which we tried to enjoy, but the waiter then came and politely told us "they needed the table and we had to leave!" 
The sad thing was we already paid the bill with a generous tip! If I had known that we would be told to leave because they needed the table and 3 other tables were also empty, I would have left them a tip equal to the quality of the service and food...$1.00!
I have been in many places on very busy nights and NEVER told we had to leave to make room! 
Maybe they should convert the place to "take-out" only, where one could go through the line, look at pictures of how they USED to treat customers, place your order, look at more pics while being serenaded by the gentle little old man in a cage high off the floor (so he's not in the way), pay and pick up our fast food and leave!
Now I know why it's called Battista's Hole in the Wall, but a little putty will fill any leak!

Another sub-par Italian restaurant at the strip. Food is ok, but not great. This is the equivalent of that $5.99 cheap all-you-can-eat Italian joint from where we come from, but with the Strip's prices. The best thing was the bread and salad. They do offer unlimited "grape juice' labeled as wine and hot chocolate labeled as "cappuccino."

Slipping...

Things continue to slip here & that makes me very sad. We've been here on a handful of occasions and really enjoyed it but the last few times haven't been up to par. 

Let's begin with the good stuff. Wine, wine & even more wine! This is how the conversation goes with the waiter ~

Waiter: White or red?
Me: Both please
Waiter: (laughs) So you've been here before...

You get wine with your meal & I'm happy to say that I've never once left here not tipsy :) 

Does the food taste better when you're tipsy? Sure it does...

We always order the same two meals; cheese ravioli with a marinara sauce and Chicken Rio (chicken breast smothered in a creamy white sauce over noodles and veggies on the side). Both are usually good but on this last trip both were barely warm and our chicken dish had hardly any sauce on it. Each meal comes with a soup or salad and we get one of each. My man gets the minestrone which was sent back this time because it was lukewarm & poorly seasoned and I get the salad which is really consistently great. This time I noticed they added croutons which is unnecessary and they were so hard that one of them left a little cut in my mouth :( 
Please get rid of these hard croutons....

The garlic bread is fantastic here and always comes out straight out of the oven and you also get sweet cappuccinos with whipped cream for dessert. I love the sweet ending! Let me also mention the old school ambiance that looks like a hoarders dream. I dig it and it's fun and on the dark side which is always extra romantic. 

Service has always been great and not sure what's going on in the kitchen but we hope they get it together. We might give it another chance but no more after the next try if things don't improve.

I thought the prices (22 - 39) we're high for simple Italian. The celebrators photos that cover the walls are so old I do not recognize the people and I am safely in senior citizen territory. It is near the strip and my date was impressed, so it so it ain't all bad.

A pleasant old-school diversion from the flash and glitz of the Strip. 

Great for large parties, but reserve them in advance. A fun and loud and boisterous place with unlimited (cheap) wine, Battista's has good food, good prices, and a very casual setting.

When I was 21, a group of my more straight-edge college friends decided they wanted to go to Las Vegas.  

A week before the trip, my dentist told me I absolutely had to go to Battista's.  Sure thing.  Then-boyfriend and I checked it out.  We thought it was great.

Fast forward four years... my brother is now living in Vegas, and my immediate family decided to meet there for Christmas.  Having remembered my wonderful experience at this restaurant, I decided we should all go.  BIG mistake.  The wine tasted like 2-buck Chuck that had been opened five days before.  The salad was comprised of iceberg lettuce and topped off with a hunk of salami.  I'm pretty sure the sauce was Ragu.  My brother, an erstwhile captain in the Army, said he'd rather have an MRE (meal ready to eat) than dine at Battista's again.

The little man playing the accordion knew the Ohio State fight song.  Battista's better hang onto that guy - it's the only reason they even get a star.

I like the atmosphere in this easy laid back hole in the wall.The food is average but the all you can drink wine helps.Garlic bread is great salad is nice.To me Gordie is the star of this place,Gordie walks from table to table with his accordion asks where your from or why your there and breaks into song,just tip him great entrainment .Keep in mind that Gordie once stood over 6ft tall but carrying around that accordion for over 40 years has caused him to shrink!

Located right behind the Flamingo.  Ambiance is great.  1950's old Vegas style complete with OLD pictures of dead celebrities who have eaten there.  

Dinner was $38 with tax and tip.  Included all you can drink red and white wine. (As E40 would say, "I think it was that top of the line wine, Carlo Rossi").

Veal parm was great. Included antipasta salad, garlic bread, and capachino (which tasted like Swiss Miss hot chocolate).

Bastista's is an excellent place to eat authentic Italian food. Love the atmosphere with a TRUE accordion player and the Italian decor. Love love love the well portioned food. I haven't had wine in a long time but loved it here. Service was great and nice people. Definitely recommend this place. REALLY appreciate great food and service.

It doesn't get any better than this!!! An iconic Italian ristorante across the street from Bally's. Step back into the 1950's, but don't think you can just mosey on over when the mood strikes!! If this is a couples dinner, call the night prior! If this is a special dinner, I would call for a reservation a day or two before you want to go.

We at at battista's for first time last week sunday 8/5/2012 and it was just so so. Got a recommendation from the bartender at Mesa grill the night before so figured it was a good bet.  Loved the old school vibe.  Watched the little accordion player leave while we were in the bar so didn't get to hear him play.  I'm a red wine drinker and love me a bottle on the table, but this stuff was not my favorite, but don't get me wrong unlimited is better than nothing.  I ordered the lasagna and my husband ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. He wad not impressed, mine was good. They don't have those thick homemade noodles I expect, and my German heritage sauce I make  at home is better than they served. Cappuccino provided would be ok for all kids as its like zero coffee and all sugar.  In the end a dinner with drinks included for $60 in Vegas is cheap, and it's filling. I would give this  place a try for what it is, and it's not: it's old school and been around, it's not in a casino, its a locals favorite. I think for what they offered for food (bread, drinks, wine) I would try it again and find what I really like nextbtime

I recently had my destination wedding in Las Vegas at the end of May and had about 40 guests fly in from Chicago with my husband and me. Of course we wanted to do something nice as a thank you for everyone, so we decided food would be the best thank you. We also didn't want to go into debt by having dinner at some place on the Strip with 40 people because let's be honest, we could spend a small fortune on drinks alone. Enter Battista's!

On a previous trip to Vegas, I convinced my now husband and another friend to try out Battista's Hole in the Wall. I had heard about this place for years, but never made it there and finally wanted to try it. Yes, it looks a bit sketchy from the outside (I think one of our guests who could see the building from their room in Bally's said, "it looks like a place where the prostitutes hang out"), but it is truly a fine, upstanding business. Live a little people!

Anyway, since we had been to Battista's and really enjoyed the food previously AND you get all the wine INCLUDED with the meal, we decided to have our wedding dinner here. And I will always be happy we did.

There was already a large(er?) group that had reservations at 7pm on that Saturday, but since we were only going to have 40 people they were able to get us in at the same time. We were not all at one table, but in a room with other diners where we basically were sitting in an L-shaped table configuration. I thought it was fun to have other diners in there as well, and I hope they enjoyed some of our speeches/toasts. 

Now, the important part - the food. We had one couple that is pretty much on the pulse of everything chic and cool tell us they were so happy that the dinner is at Battista's since it had been recommended several time to them. And for good reason - I thought the food was excellent. I had Eggplant Parm and wish we I could have taken the large portion I had leftover with me. Everyone I spoke to gushed about their food and especially the cappuccino. I don't drink coffee, so I opted out, but those who do said it was the best they ever had. 

In addition to the dinners and all the extras that come with them, we asked the servers to bring out dessert plates with assortments of what they had. Sadly, there was no cannoli, but they had tiramisu and spumoni. As mentioned, I'm not a coffee girl so I didn't try to tiramisu, but the spumoni was excellent! And they knew how much to bring out so there was nothing left! 
For those of you looking to have a large dinner at Battista's, I believe our total bill was about $1400 all in. That's not bad for 40 people who were somewhat sober when they came and left full and tipsy! We let everyone order whatever they wanted off the menu, so it wasn't like there was a condensed menu to keep the prices down. I highly recommend Battista's Hole in the wall for large and small groups!

PS - the accordion player visited us several times and was such a cute man! It's too bad our group didn't know more of the words to That's Amore!

Dined at Battista's this week.  For those who complain about the prices at Battista's, I think it is important to point out that you get a bottomless glass of red or white wine included in the price.  The red was certainly not fine wine, rather I'd call it an easy drinking wine.  The food is pretty darned good.  I'll pay $22 every day for a decent egg plant parm and all the wine I can stomach.  An added feature of note is the accordian player who makes his rounds serenading each table.  While I'm not a big fan of musicians performing at my table, this old dude is a real gem.

I came here for my 21st bday last year and it was so good! It's literally a hole in the wall place on the back side of all the hotels on the strip. Batista's is next to two liquor stores but this place is a hidden gem. 
The portions are pretty big so we all shared but the wind, garlic bread and pasta / eggplant and everything else made the perfect dinner! I plan on coming back real soon. 5 starts for batista's :)

So I came here on high recommendation. Food was about right for the atmosphere and reputation. Service was not.  Very impersonal and rushed. I was handed the check before service was even complete.  It wasn't overly busy on my visit.  I will rate the two stars because of the atmosphere and food charm.  But the place needs a reset on focus on experience and less focus on how fast they can turn tables.  Unfortunate, but I won't be back. $30 a person for dinner is a small ask for experience.  Not asking for much, just some decency.

Old time Vegas at its best. Great ambiance compared to ultra glitz and glamor of mega casino restaurants. Food was very good. Carafe of house wine, salad and garlic bread were all great. My true test of any Italian restaurant is the spaghetti and meatballs. Their meatballs were some of the best I've had. Spaghetti could have used a little more sauce? I like a lot of sauce. Asked the pleasant wait staff and they brought me a soup-bowl of extra sauce. I would definitely come back. Seems to be a locals favorite which is always a good sign.

Everything here was wonderful.  The atmosphere is unique, especially with the menu on the wall.  My wife had the alfredo sauce and loved it.  I had the sausage with penne which was great.  A carafe of wine comes with the meal.  I'd suggest the white wine, even for people that don't like wine.  The white wine has subtle taste that works well with the italian food.  The espresso at the end is much more like hot chocolate than a normal espresso. 

The only issue is the owner coming around with a accordion.  It's very awkward if you don't have anything to tip him with.

Parking (4/5):
Parking is easy to find right outside of the building and there are plenty of spots available. It's kind of dirty, but its not a big issue unless if you are planning to eat in the lot.

Ambiance (1/5):
Light is very dark. When I walked into the restaurant, I felt like a navy seal trying to break into Binladen's compound using night vision goggles. They seriously need to lighten up this joint. Noise level is average for your average Italian restaurant.

Service (2/5):
