Generous portion of shrimp and pasta, comes with mushrooms and lots of garlic, butter and fresh lemon which gave it a nice zip. I was surprised at how well seasoned and flavorful it was since other reviews  said it was bland. Would definitely order again. 

After dinner "cappuccino"- 4/5
I'm pretty sure there's no coffee in here, but it was damn good! Tasted like Mexican hot chocolate w/ cinnamon. I love the old school mugs they serve it in too. 

I'm so mad at myself that after living in Vegas for 12 years, this is the first time I've been to Battistas. Will definitely be back.

This place was recommended from a friend of a friend & it didn't disappoint. The place is dark on the inside but don't let that fool you. You're served unlimited house white & red wine. Garlic bread & salad were served with our meals as well & they were both excellent. I ordered the Sausage Cacciatore & it was delicious. The portions are huge so you will not leave hungry.

Wine included with your meal?  No cheesy casino 'rings' around it?  

Great Italian, family style cuisine...good ambience, and great for big groups...celebrated a fantastic birthday here with friends during a birthday debauchery weekend..and it was NICE to get the hell off the strip for a bit (how much strip can one person take at a time?)

There was this cute old man who played the accordion and serenaded me too..

Loved it.
GO!
Get the hell off the strip.

Ate here for a wedding rehearsal dinner. The fare was good, the portions were HUGE though. I flove eggplant parm but couldnt eat more than half of my plate. 

The most adorable old man on the planet was there playing the accordion and serenaded the bride and groom, it was good stuff. 

The cappuccino was PHENOMENAL. I regret not grabbing a second cup before leaving Vegas.

I have been coming here since I was little. A few years ago you couldn't pay me enough to go back, but a few nights ago we had a decent experience and I will continue giving it a try.

The best part of the meal is that it includes table wine, salad, bread and cappuccino. Even just off-strip you could expect to pay $20-30 for just an entree, not including any of the extras. The place feels very kitschy and has a lot more character than anywhere else you can go, if that is what you're looking for. 

This particular night I had the veal, which I can't say that I recommend due to its intense saltiness! However, I tried a bite of each other dish--fish ravioli, chicken alfredo, chicken rio, chicken parmesan--and they were all tasty.  I'll be back because it's a good deal and it's a fun piece of Vegas history, but no veal next time.

i came here a couple of years back and the truth was i wasnt to impressed with the food but what stood out to me was the capuccino. when i came back to vegas on this trip with my bro i made it a point to go back just for the capuccino and it was as good as the first time we also tried there tiramusu which was also very good. so for those 2 items i give them 5 stars but the food brought down the rating alittle bit

This place was recommended to me by a friend who comes to Vegas frequently, and I was not disappointed. It looks a little shady at first, right next door to a liquor store in a strip mall. But the staff were all very nice, and we were seated right away (at 7 pm on Friday night). 

You can't beat the value- there are tiers to the menu, depending on your entree. I got the ziti with pomodoro sauce, which was the lowest tier at $21.95. The pricier options include steak and veal and can go as high as $38.95. Whatever entree you choose, it comes with house wine, garlic bread, soup or salad, and cappuccino.

The garlic bread was delicious and plentiful (we went through two baskets...there were two of us). The salad was great, surprisingly large and had great leafy greens, not just a bag of iceberg dumped into a bowl. My pomodoro sauce wasn't amazing, but it wasn't bad either. The cappuccino WAS amazing. So, so good. My mom who doesn't ever drink coffee/espresso tried a sip and we ended up splitting it.

The real attraction is the ambience and the adorable accordion player, Gordy. He found out we were from Missouri and played the Missouri waltz for us! Very sweet and he gives the place a lot of character.

The food is nothing earth-shattering but it's all tasty and you get SO much for the money. Definitely check it out, if only to be serenaded by Gordy.

Phenomenal Experience!  The hubby and I split the lasagna, which is the best we have ever had. The garlic bread was amazing.  Another perk was the complimentary wine and you finish with a cappuccino.   Highly recommend this place.

This place was pretty good but I think it's overpriced. They give you all you can drink red and white wine and some delicious garlic bread. It tasted like every other Italian place I have been and nothing really stood out to me. I ordered the manicotti and it was very tasty.

I was hopeful.  I really was.  The pics looked pretty good.  I may be jaded having just returned from Italy for 10 days.  

The people next to me kept saying "this is DAMN GOOD bread!"  Over and over.  Did I have a different recipe?  It was hard and crusty and for the most part, cut the inside of my mouth.  

I ordered the soup.  A salad came out.  They fixed that right away.  

House wine was a C-.

Spaghetti and meatballs were gummy.  Portion was huge.  The noodles tasted like they had been cooked in stale water or something. No flavor at all 

The service was amazing, I must say.  They were quick and attentive and very nice to this gal dining alone. There was a long wait when I left.  Place was packed.  

I don't get it.

Have not been here for years.  Brought some friends from out of town here and had a BLAST.  Food was better than I remembered it to be and the staff was awesome.  Yes the old accordion player is still there (please let that guy retire) and he does not like it when you don't acknowledge him :).

I was excited to review this place because of the polar opposite reviews I had read and how old and famous the place is!  I went with a big group, so I had the chance to see many menu items plated and try more than one dish.

Ambience: Very kitschy and dark, lots of old photos and vintage cans, signs & baskets.  Equal parts fun and tacky.

Drinks: Free bottomless house wine.  Not a drinker, but apparently its passable but no memorable.

Service: not friendly, just efficient.  Not super helpful either.

Salad: (included with the meal) 2 stars, boring, lightly vinaigretted greens with a chunk of cheese and a slice of pastrami.

Garlic Bread: (included) Superb, 4 stars.  Warm, fresh, crispy and soft.

Chicken Alfredo (entree): 3 stars. The sauce was fine, the grilled chicken was good.

Filet Mignon: (entree) 1 star.  I eat steak all the time, this was awful: tasteless, under cooked, & dry.  It's hard to mess up a piece of meat but Battistas has done it.  Almost identical to the memorable time I ordered steak at an Applebee's in 2006.  That bad.

Manicotti: (entree) 2 stars, the cheese was fine, but not much taste, and the sauce was pretty boring, kinda sweet.  Just bland overall.

Cappuccino: (included) was really just hot chocolate with whipped cream.  Good, but not what you expect.

Spumoni Dessert: 3 stars, it was tasty layered ice cream.  Can't mess it up, delicious and recommended.

Tiramisu: overstrong flavor, but it looks pretty.  I can't rate it with justice because I don't like tiramisu.  Most at the table did not eat much of it.

I have been going to Battista's for over 30 years when the owners would come out and see how everything was . They used to serve more food than they do now believe it our not. it used to be soup and salad and a cannelloni before dinner, service was impeccable and the mother made every guest feel special. Now it is a assembly line, I have eaten at Battista's for the last time, the eggplant was tough, cold and not cooked properly and the soup was cold, the last three times I have had dinner their the soup was cold. The music is the same with the accordion player, I remember his first day.  Unfortunately my wife and myself will pass on this restaurant the next time we come to town.

We held our post-wedding dinner here in June for about 25 people, and after worrying a bit because we were planning this from across the country and had never been to Battista's, they knocked it out of the park!  

It was perfect!  We had a reservation from 6-8 and because of the photos taking longer than expected, the bride and groom did not arrive until almost 7.  The wedding party hung out in the bar until then (and were having a blast I might add), and they seated us and extended our reservation with no problem.

Service was perfect, the food was great, and the night could not have been better!  We even got a few songs by the guy on the accordian, and an ovation by the entire restaurant when my bride and I walked in!

Simply great, and we will DEFINITELY return on our next trip to Vegas!

Thank you to a few of the reviewers on here who I spoke with about this place!

Why have I not been here before???? This place is awesome!  The decor takes you back to the old Vegas mob days. Amazing food and great staff, priced just right.  And free wine!!!!! Can't go wrong with the amazing lasagna. The cappuccino at the end was the icing on the cake.  We 100% will be back.

They were surprisingly nice to us despite the fact that we rolled in 20 deep and were obnoxiously drunk.  The all you can drink house red and white were already in carafes on our table and we were ready for more merriment.  Fairly loud restaurant (or maybe we were the ones being loud) that can easily accommodate large groups such as ours.  I'm actually surprised that we weren't kicked out with all the f-bombs that we were dropping.

The food seemed well rehearsed, as the bread came out quickly, as well as, the standard single-serving sides of salad or soup.  Our pasta orders were placed fairly quickly and the meal arrived on room service carts.   The after dinner cappuccino, with a healthy dollop of "whipped cream", arrived just as quickly afterwards.  Food is not too spectacular (seemed fairly Costco-y if you know what I mean) but the service was quick and they have a doorman that can take care of your after dinner entertainment.   

Parking lot was right in front of the restaurant and fairly safe despite the look of the neighborhood.  They let me leave my car there, overnight, and it was alright the next day.  

Made reservations and had to put down 10% on a credit card due to our large party size.    ~$32.5 pp including autograt of 20%.  I probably won't go back for the food, but works for large groups, not interested in buffets but interested in drinking copious amounts of cheap wine in plastic cups.

(2* for food, 4* for service)

Cool atmosphere, complimentary house wine with your meal. Despite great reviews and a friends recommendation, I didn't think this was really anything special. Shrimp scampi was a bit bland and definitely not the best I've had. Might have been a better deal had I drank lots of wine with my meal.

Here's the thing.  You don't go for the food.  You go because it comes with.  Comes with soup.  Comes with garlic bread.  Comes with what is apparently Ovaltine dissolved in coffee.  

You go because there is a ton of fun crap to look at on the wall.  And because you can be loud and obnoxious.  

You go because Dobby the house elf from Harry Potter, who your grandma would find disturbing yet oddly charming, will come by and play you a 10 second song made up on the spot and demand immediate payment

But mostly, you go because it comes with UNLIMITED TABLE WINE.  Not good wine.  But drinkable wine with presumably some alcohol in it.

The food was not bad.  It just wasn't good.  The portions are large.  I won't go into detail because you will probably go anyway and find out for yourself.   Maybe go when you need to absorb fifteen martinis?

There is a TV or several in the bar area where you can stand with beers and yell "GO [MY FAVORITE SPORTS TEAM]."

Battista's will always have a special place in my heart. My boyfriend proposed to me here. The food is great (the garlic bread is the best hands down) I love the atmosphere, and the service is all done with a smile. The menu hangs on the wall at each booth, free wine, and hearty portions of food. You will not leave hungry. 

The parking is a mess and the strip mall is very questionable, but they have a posted guard which made me feel safe going to and from our car. 

LOVE THIS PLACE!! Just try it!!

The fake Italian drawl from the server, the crappy free house wine, the mushy lukewarm minestrone soup. 

The garlic bread that was more buttered than garlic....

The fettuccini Alfredo was creamy, but bland, the tastiest thing was the char grilled chicken breast slices. It was a decent amount.

However, for $27.95, I'm underwhelmed lol. Oh well!

We asked one of our Uber drivers for good hole in the wall type of place to eat I think you misunderstood and directed us to the hole in the wall.
He gave me some background story that the place used to be run and operated by the mafia and that the food was actually really good. My wife and I decided to go here for dinner and meet some of her friends that lived in the area they had never heard of the place once we got there we are very happy with the ambience and Amazed by the decoration and how every square inch of the place was covered with authentic stuff not manufactured or store-bought when we ordered the meals or very simple and the menu very clean and concise I decided to try the manicotti and my wife went with the muscles we are happily impressed that each meal came with a soup or salad you had two large bottles of both red and white wine your main course which had very large and feeling portions and a cappuccino to end the meal.
I I went with the mix salad because I'm not a huge fan of minestrone soup. For a salad being a salad it was kind of boring however the manicotti was absolutely amazing. THE Filling was very flavorful and the sauce on top was simple yet went well with the entire meal.
I sampled my wife's mussels and linguine and it also was very well seasoned and the flavor was amazing (sorry ma).
If you're in town and with a party of two or more I highly recommend this if you like Italian food probably one of the top places I've ever eaten for Italian.

Definitely a one-of-a-kind place -- atmosphere is campy but fun (lots of autographed pictures), space is unique with tables tucked in all around, table-service staff is authentically friendly and attentive, but the food. . . .  Very much below average.  Pastas were heavy, loaded with meat and cheese, flavors were indistinct.  The complimentary wine is vinegar-y, but the corkage is very reasonable -- we brought 2 bottles and the restaurant charged us $15 total.

Made a reservation and got in right on time. Classic Italian restaurant with good food, quick ticket times, and all you can drink house wine. Spaghetti and meatballs were very tasty. Don't forget to tip your accordion player!

well we had originally made reservations here on valentines because we thought it was a cool little place. the menu was on the wall.. and was it family style? single dishes? the waiter gave us a carafe of red wine while we waited. we figured out it was single dishes and for the price, it did not seem worth it at all. $20 for spaghetti and meatballs in this little dump?
 i chugged a glass of wine wine and we slipped out the door & went to ventuno at the flamingo and had one of the best meals ever.

Yummo!  Wine on the table upon arriving, a fun and casual atmosphere.  Great salad, soup and entrees.  We had chicken parm and lasagna-- excellent choices!!  We also noted that it was my fiance's birthday on the reservation, and without further prompting, they brought out a birthday brownie and sang him happy birthday!  
Great service, great food and great ambiance!

The ambience and the decor are good.  Classic and relaxing.  The complimentary bread and cappuccino are great.  The flavor are a little bit light.  With the complimentary red and White House wine is still a place worth to come for family and date.

This is a hidden gem. The food is very good. The atmosphere is nice . The service was pretty good. All meals come with all the wine you can drink. I don't drink , kind of a downer. You get either soup or salad and a cappuccino at the end.
Food very good. Service very good. Feels like old Vegas and like you are waiting for a gangster to walk in. Hint: make reservations.

The ambience of this restaurant is what makes it so unique. It is decorated with pictures throughout, things on every wall even on the ceiling. Reminds me of the rainbow room in California. Every meal comes with wine which is kind of neat except when your party of 4 includes two kids. If our party was all adults it would have been more worthwhile. This is the reason it gets three stars. If it were the food alone it would probably just get two. We paid $44 for 2 plates of spaghetti with butter? Damn! The sausage cacciatore was good not great but not bad just good. Same with the chicken parmigiana. Good not great not bad just good. Service was good.

WOW!

Eating here was an absolute waste of time and money.  How in the hell has this place survived for so long serving below average food?  Such a shame...is it that hard to make decent food?

I think the food deserves three stars, but really... unlimited wine?  How could I give it any less than 4 stars? (Disclaimer: Since they do offer unlimited wine here, please keep this in mind as you read this review.  Due to certain reasons, I may have somewhat of a selective memory.)

I've gone here with big groups on trips to Vegas before we go out.  Always make reservations if you have large groups!  The place is huge, but usually pretty crowded.  

They have their food menus written on the walls, and they have these meal combinations that include an entree, salad or soup, bread, a hot chocolate type drink, and of course... as much red and white wine as you want!  I believe they range $20-30.  But again I repeat... unlimited wine.

I usually go with the eggplant parmesan, which is delicious.  Cheesy goodness.  Probably a 3.5 star, but gets the job done for a dinner before a night of dancing and drinking.  Other things that friends have ordered just looked okay.

So I know I keep talking about the wine, but what really stands out to me about this place.... is the first time I went here, they gave us two giant to-go cups of wine!  I'm talking Big Gulp size!  That's the Vegas spirit!

Every time I go to Vegas, I look forward to eating at Battista's.

Every dish I've sampled here has been delicious.  It's all simple, good Italian cooking.  Meals range from like $18-30 depending on what you get, and that includes soup or salad, bread, wine, and a cappuccino for dessert.  Definitely a great deal, especially in this town.  Eat 'til you explode and drink yourself stupid on house wine...the Strip and all the tourists cramming it up get way more entertaining that way.

The decorations are kitschy, but that's part of the charm.  The tables are a little crammed together in some areas; this is more a homey, friendly atmosphere than a quiet, romantic restaurant.  Be sure to keep a few small bills handy to tip Gordy, the restaurant's accordionist.  He's an absolute trip.

Reservations are definitely recommended if your party is larger than two people and/or you don't like to wait over an hour for a table.

All the stars. Add another star to it. 
 Simple Italian perfection. 
The prices looked high on the menu. By the time you drink the wine, eat the bread, and have an excellent meal? I have no problem with the prices. Worth every dime. 

I had the Lasagna. My buddy had the linguini with clams.  
Both well fed. We are not small guys. Excellent!

Reasonably priced quality food is becoming a rarity in Vegas. Hole in the Wall gives you good Italian food at a nice price, including unlimited red and white wine during your meal. We had the veal with a side of sausages in marinara - and it was fantastic. We walked there and walked out, which was good - because we need the exercise afterward.

Service is good but not quick, just enjoy the wine and your company.

I don't understand why anyone would eat here. it's not Italian food. it's American crap that's one step below chef boyardee. if you ate here and like the food you need to come out from the rock you've been living under and try a real restaurant.

to be fair, the garlic bread is yummy

I read several reviews before coming here. I was a little apprehensive due to some of the negative comments but one of the girls I was traveling with kept raving about the place and wanted to stop by. 

I have to preface this with the fact that I wasn't expecting much since my expectations were so low it wasn't hard to exceed them. 

I thought the food was great! I had the fettucino alfredo and it was decent, flavorful and fresh. Was it the best alfredo? No. Was it good, yes. 

This place is more about the ambiance and history. It's an all inclusive price for each meal (ranging from $22 - $40). My dish included all you can drink red and white wine. The red wine was "meh" but it was free so no complaints here. Not a fan of white wine so I didn't really enjoy it. 

The salad was surprisingly simple and tasty. The garlic bread was fresh and tasted great. The after dinner cappuccino wasn't very good, super sweet and luke warm. 

All in all, I would recommend this place especially if you're with a group of people. If you want an amazing, fancy dinner this isn't your place. If you want to experience a local eatery with a lot of charm and decent food, then this is your place. Keep in mind that the dinner is somewhat pricey but you get a ton of food! 

As they promised - it's a "hole in the wall" and they delivered.

This is an amazing local restaurant. I love the menu style and the atmosphere. I have had the chicken parm on multiple occassions and it is wonderful.

This is not a high end restaurant it is local flair. Excellent value and good food.

Ok, I'll make this short.
Great location - across the street from Ballys, next to Flamingo, close to Bellagio, PH. 
Nice parking.
Complimentary red and white wine is awesome, but it doesn't taste very good. But hey, it's free.
Seating is really close together.
Food wasn't the best I've had. Bland marinara sauce. Good size portions, though.

The best thing about this place was the delicious bread and yummy cappuccino with each meal.

Value Value Value... and a little accordion music!  This place is hidden away, just a few steps off the strip across Flamingo from Bali's.  You will wait to be seated, and then you will read your dinner off blackboards on the wall.  That price includes everything for your dinner including the wine!  Go ahead, empty the carafe, they'll bring another.  
Want good food, funky atmosphere and NO PRETENSE, this is the place.

All you can drink red or white wine included!!  Carafes on the table throughout the meal. I don't drink, but the rest of my family does so this saved us probably at least 100 bucks in drink charges. 

A family of four, all of us got a full dinner, great salad, excellent minestrone, yummy, super buttery garlic bread and a "cappuccino" after. I had the manicotti which I couldn't finish. Took it home and had it for another 2 meals the next day!  Hubby and mom had lasagna. Dad had spaghetti meatballs. 

We will return!  Dark, romantic, little place with a ton of old school memorabilia. This is our second visit and I think we'll make it a staple for our Vegas trips. It offers a nice break from the flashy noise and exorbitant prices on the strip.

I have been to this place 4 times and I keep coming back, I love it. They start you off with a carafe of red and white wine and you can either choose one or drink them both, the salad is more than average with a house italian dressing along with some breadsticks. I choose lasagna this past time, which was excellent and a big portion, and my favorite part of the meal is the cappuccino at the end, you are SO full of food, but you must drink this, it is not your average drink, so good. While eating there is the cutest nicest older man strolling around and greeting you and playing his accordion for a tip (remember to tip him when he is done!) Old pictures on the wall to enjoy and cushion seats to sit on in your booth. The bathroom is interesting too, in the lady's room there is a picture on the wall that will make you laugh.  This place is a MUST GO when in Vegas.

It's like going way back in time. I felt at home because it reminded me of Italian restaurants growing up in the 70s back in NY. To be very honest the food was just okay but definitely nothing exciting. It's the atmosphere that truly makes it. The sad part is that the original owner has retired and Its now owned by a large corporation.

The food is bad. The wine is bad. The salad is wilted lettuce drenched in Italian dressing. The guy playing the accordion is not very good, although he is old and appears to be ill in some way, so i feel bad saying anything. I'm not sure when this place was considered cool, but it is not. Anyhow go if you want a bunch of tourist drunk on cheap wine screaming quotes from Goodfellows, and the Godfather. 

Your in Vegas for God sake live it up, and plunk down a few extra bucks for a good restaurant.

Another classic in homely Italian eateries. Not to pompous, not to flashy. Just good food, with good people. Just as I said before with my review of Volare back home in San Diego, just come to eat for a good time and don't expect a flashy scene and you'll have a blast with good food. And Hello, endless wine! 5 stars just for that. 

Great atmosphere, great food, great experience.

This place is the best kept secret of the Las Vegas strip. I a friend of mine recommended this place to me and I been coming here since then. Typically, go to Vegas for work now, but still make a point to stop in here. You can get a salad, entree and a jug of wine and you are not breaking the bank! Love all the flare in the bar waiting area. Definitely a great local place.

HID-DEN GEM!  HID-DEN GEM!

Well, maybe not so hidden since we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table even with a reservation, but this place really does look like a "hole in the wall".  I've been to Vegas several times and had never heard of this place even though it was steps from the strip.

The decor is kind of cheesy, but the service was impeccable and the food was absolutely delicious.  And seriously, all you can drink wine, garlic bread, soup/salad and side of pasta with every entree for under $30??   That's one of the best deals anywhere, let alone Vegas.

I got the sauteed salmon... the fish was really fresh and the sauce on it was delicious.  Tried bites of a lot of my friends pasta dishes.  Absolutely everything I tried was outstanding.  I really wasn't expecting much of the food... I kind of thought this was going to be more of a cool experience than anything else.  I was very pleasantly surprised.

The accordion player was absolutely adorable also.

We have been here for two years in a row as a post carb-up meal for the Las Vegas Rock n' Roll Half Marathon in December.  The food is fine, and the atmosphere is awesome, cheesey yes, but fun.  
Wine is included, and you can order from a variety of dishes off giant menus on the wall - and the best Accordian player makes his rounds and sings songs to you!  We love throwing bucks his way to hear him sing state-specific songs to us like "California Here I Come", and "New York, New York".  I think next time I am going to be from Oklahoma.
Its perfect for a big group - make sure you have a reservation because its been packed when we have been there.
You can either park in the lot or walk from the strip (its back behind Flamingo/etc.)

Fool me once, Battista's, shame on you.
Fool me twice....

I originally went to Battista's around 2006, when I first moved to Vegas and had heard about how it was this awesome old Italian joint. Ok, checked it out. But the food sucked. I'm no chef, and I remember walking out of there thinking, "I could have made better ravioli than that! And it wasn't even cheap!" I vowed never to go back.

Fast forward to 2015. I read a glowing review of Battista's from Rick Moonen in the LV Weekly, and thought, "maybe they've changed the food!" We were in the area a couple weeks ago and decided to return, give it another chance.

The inside still has that cool mob hangout feel and there's an old guy walking around playing an accordion. That's why they get the 2nd star.

Overview for those who haven't been: everybody orders a "dinner" which comes with entre, soup or salad, garlic bread, unlimited house wine, and coffee. If you choose not to order an entre, you still have to pay for a dinner: $19 since you could be cheating and drinking out of somebody else's baby wine glass of $3 wine (what they serve is on par with 2 buck chuck, no question).

I wouldn't even care about the weird setup if the food was actually good. The salad (a handful of lettuce with a piece of salami and shredded carrots on top) came out about the time the words "I'll have the salad" were coming out of my mouth. Soup was fine for minestrone. Where they really failed was the entre. I asked the waiter what was their signature dish, but he seemed baffled by the question, and instead asked, "you mean something you can't get anywhere else? That's the chicken rio." Ok fine, I'll take the chicken rio. It's chicken and pasta in a white sauce. Only the chicken is blobby and the white sauce isn't really sauce. More like straight heavy cream they poured on the plate. It seriously has no taste, just a fatty consistency. 

My original review stands: I could make better Italian food at home. Or purchase it at Fresh & Easy and heat it up. And it would be 10 times better. I honestly think they paid Rick Moonen to write that review. Or maybe he got some special food? 

Insult to injury: this meal cost me over $30!

The food here is about a 3.5 out of 5. It's not the best Italian food I have eaten but the ambiance and unlimited house wine included with your meal puts this place up near the top! I love Battistas and recommend this place for anyone visiting Vegas especially on a date night. My hot Sicilian wife loved this place and now I am King, lol.

I wish they served a full menu at the bar since I often come here on business and sip vino and catch up on the days events.  It's typical italian with all the charm of a old school restaurant.  Since I hate the strip and I'm forced to eat there enough I love little places sticking it to the big guys - and this is one of them.  I was debating between 3 and 4 starts and after reading some weird reviews (lowball) on this place I figured 4.  The food is solid, the place is usually packed and the staff has always treated me well.

The good: all-inclusive pricing, including house wine.

The bad: mediocre attempt at the dishes (veal piccata and eggplant parmesan) we ordered.

The meal began with a delicious bowl of garlic bread, accompanied by a poor choice of white wine (too sweet) and an adequate-but-uninteresting red. Soup or salad--one choice each and no other choices on dressing except the italian. Entrees were accompanied by a little plate of pasta (penne) and some underwhelming sauce. 

Because the pricing was inclusive (hers $28; mine $32), the hit wasn't bad. But the quality was middling, at best. If we return, I'll look for something (perhaps lasagne?) more in their wheelhouse. But we'll likely just skip this in the future.

Hole in the wall?  Basically there was a hole in the wall. I went in. They put me in a booth. Ordered lasagna. Not bad expensive. Not Italy lasagna but worth the price. All you can drink red or white wine l, Salad, garlic bread and Lasagna for $25.95. Not bad. Heck I would do it again.

This was absolutely a adorable restaurant! Busy yet you and youre date still feel secluded. For it to be a "hole in the wall" its actually pretty big and nice. You get complimentary, Wine, Bread/Soup, Salad and Cappuccino! Meal are pretty big portions! Especially after all the complimentary stuff! Did I mention the complimentary wine is unlimited...!!!!! Average meal 25-30 $ but absolutely worth it! Relaxing evening with the hubby, its a cute date night spot... or just nice friendly dinner with friend. Definitely some interesting decorations around. But this to be our first time, it wont be are last. BY THE WAY, the food was quite delicious, not over cooked, not frozen... FRESH, not flavorless but not over seasoned, and just overall tasty! I honestly cant wait for our next visit!

This is a regular place that I have to eat at every time my husband and I visit Vegas! You have to make reservations or it is very hard to get a table these days.You can easily make the reservation online.

I cannot tell you the amount of times that I have been here but every single time it has been amazing. The food is always great. The staff is friendly. And who can't love the old guy playing the accordion & making up silly songs about your home town? I was pleased to get another picture with him a couple months ago when we visited Vegas. 

This place is a Hole in the Wall & you need to try it!!!!!

No fun to have hostesses make you wait 15 min for a table for 4 when the place is half empty but who am I to say what right and wrong .


The food is decent. Not great just decent.  My soup was room temp and had to send it back The bread is the best part of the night.  I had the lasagna and it was just ok.   Yes you get a salad and feee cheap wine but it's $22-$45 a person.  We were $90 each couple just wish food was better. Prob woulda tasted better if I didn't have to wait in beginning.  I hate waiting when place is 1/2 full

THe best thing about this restaurant is the great sides.  I love the complimentary wine, garlic bread, salad, and cappucino.  OMG they were amazing.  The food was unfortunately ok.  But, I will definitely return for the garlic bread.  It was amazing!  Also, service was great as well!  OH, the spaghetti and meatballs were delicious.  Definitely get that.
I am literally sitting in here waiting for our order to b taken. The girl looked at us 3 times and did not stop and ask for our drinks or anything. This place is shit. Don't come here!

love this place, no trip to Vegas is complete without visiting here.  Go with 
a big group and be loud and fun, or go with an intimate date.

this is a special sort of place, one that's almost worthwhile visiting just to set the one star benchmark. on subsequent bad dining experiences elsewhere, you'll be saying "that place sucked, but not quite as awful as that hole in the wall italian place in vegas".

How do you not love Battista's? With its old-school Vegas charm, all you can drink wine, and awesome service, it's definitely as good as it gets. Each dinner comes with salad or soup, garlic bread, a carafe of wine, and cappuccino. Ever time I'm in Vegas, I make sure to eat here. Great Italian food, great atmosphere, and my Dad's picture on the wall (ok, I might be a little biased. ;-))

I wish it was open for lunch - the hours are short comparatively speaking (it *is* Vegas), so plan your dinner time accordingly and don't miss out on a great meal.
Food is basic Italian and comes with all you can drink wine, but it's around 30 bucks per person.  Not worth it...

One of the more affordable places to eat near the strip. We came here with a group of girls for a bachelorette party. Love that all entrees include wine and soup or salad. Not only is the food good, but I'm pretty sure it's the owner that walks around with his accordion and sings. Great food in a fun and relaxing environment. What more do you need than that?

As a vegetarian, I've tried lots of different Eggplant Parm dishes from many places. Batista's absolutely has the best, hands down. Everyone I sat with enjoyed their meals. The bread is good. Unlimited wine you can't beat. Enjoyed our server. The bar staff was a little bland with their customer service. And who doesn't love the man who plays accordion! He was my favorite part of the night. I would definitely go back again and again.

The place has a wonderful look inside but that is where the wonderful stops. We had a group of 10 and service was terrible. We were lucky to see the waiter 4 times the whole meal. The menu is limited and at $25-35 a plate less than stellar. The food was not good. Pastas was dry and not tasty. Then when one person at the table found a long hair in her food, the plate was taken away by the waiter that we had to request to see three times. And never talked about again until we got the bill and he quietly mentioned that it had been removed from the bill. No apology, no visit from the manager, nothing. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

This is old time Vegas. Italian foods done the American way. I heard great things from this place but had no real expectations as to what experience I would get.


The business  is clean from what I could tell with the dimmed lights. The menus are on the wall, all Food was well cooked.
Also unlimited red or white wine... So don't worry about going thirsty!!!

Overall
Service: 4-5
Food: 4-5
Drink: 5-5
Price: $$$
Come back: oh yes

I went here after I saw a show and it was recommended. Service was alright but the food was extremely bland! So much so that I only ate about half of it, paid and left. I ordered the eggplant parm because I usually like it. While the serving size was good and hot it lacked flavor. I paid around $45 for dinner but didn't even like it. I went somewhere else to eat dinner after that.#disappointed

I don't even know what to say about this place... I'm so glad we found it the first time we went to Vegas.  Every time we are in Vegas we go here.  I love the Chicken Parmesan.  The portions are huge and everything tastes so good.  Ambiance is nice, they get busy so be prepared to wait on a weekend but well worth the wait! They have earned their 5 stars

What's not to love? 

The food is classic American-Style Italian.. great little guy running around playing his music on an accordion..and most of the staff has been there a very long time.. 20-40 years in some cases. it is very inexpensive, filling, and always a good time. Please check it out and ask fr Luigi! He will take care of you and has been there almost as long as the restaurant itself!

Cool casual vibe, dimmed lights and awesome service. Place was a bit warm maybe because it's starting to get cold outside. Food was AMAZING! We went during dinner so it comes with complementary red and white wine for the entire table. At the end of dinner they give you cappuccino too which is the best I have ever had! Definitely will be back!

A group of girls and I went to Vegas for a bachelorette party...surprise! We put this place on our itinerary because it was convenient, took reservations, and seemed like a really good deal. 

The server was extremely nice and pretty attentive, especially for such a large group. The salad and garlic bread were both pretty good. I wish I had tried the minestrone soup, it looked yummy and my friend seemed to like it. Then my entree came and I was pretty disappointed. I chose the cannelloni with meat and definitely would have preferred something else. There was a weird cream sauce on half of it, luckily the other half had the normal red sauce. Still, the filling wasn't very good and I only ate a little bit of it, opting for more garlic bread to fill me up instead. 

Some of the girls did like their food. After trying some of their choices, it was better than mine, but I still wouldn't be likely to recommend Battista's based on the food. 

So what about the all you can drink wine? Well...along with everything else, it was mediocre. If we had visited our first night rather than our last, maybe we would have been more into the wine. 

Overall, if you're not expecting much, go for it. It doesn't hurt to try once, especially if you're up for drinking a lot of average wine and eating unremarkable Italian food for not a bad price. But if I were you, I'd probably skip it. Sorry Battista's.

Relax, let the noisy ambiance soothe your frayed nerves, enjoy a carafe or two of wine (it's free!), listen to the little old Italian accordian player (he takes requests as long as they come with a tip), and playfully flirt with your handsome young waiter. Fill up on the salad and garlic bread as the main course is only so-so. But the cappuccino dessert (another freebie!) is to die for. It's not expensive, by Vegas standards, and who wants to eat at fancy places EVERY day of the week?

I can't believe all this time I've been in Vegas and I've never been to Battista's. And all it took to get me here was a cousin visiting from another state who heard about it from her customers there. For shame. Nevertheless, we came here tonight to celebrate our birthdays. Our birthdays are just a couple of days (and 11 years) apart. So it was a mutual dinner celebration. She likes to make a bigger deal than I do so she wore a birthday sash. Almost as soon as we were seated the little old man who plays the accordion came by to play for us. He ended up playing Happy Birthday (twice throughout our dinner). That was a real treat.

The menu here is not extensive. And it is broken down by price. That is to say each price point has a handfull of options to choose from. There were five of us tonight. Three lasagnas were ordered. One chicken alfredo. I ordered eggplant parm. 

Aside from the entrees, we were also served our choice of soup or salad. Its hot out so most of us ordered salad. It was a good salad too. Basically an anitpasti salad with meats, cheese, olives and pepperoncinis with a tangy Italian dressing. Standard but good. The minestrone looked good too but I did not try that. 

Also on the table for our enjoyment was garlic bread and wine. Both red and white wines. They were both house wines and nothing spectacular but they come with the meal. I can live with that. I enjoyed the red more than the white. I usually do. The garlic bread was crisp and buttery. Garlic bread done right.

My eggplant parm was of a generous portion. Several slices of fried and layered goodness topped with sauce and a lot of cheese. It came served with a side of penne and marinara. The lasagnas and chicken alfredo looked good too. Again, generous portions. They all had left overs. Me, being the fatso I am, did not. 

Finally, to cap off our already fantastic dinner, we were brough capuccino. Really more of a rich hot chocolate. Its a bit warm in August to be drinking a hot beverage on top of a filling meal but it sure was good. We all agreed it was about the best hot chocolate we had ever had.

This place may be called Battista's Hole In The Wall but it really is not. The place is huge. Deceptively so. It is dimly lit and full of kitch. There is a certain amount of retro charm that just feels right. Now that I have been here I want to come back. I want to share this with other members of my family. It was more than just dinner. It was an experience.

This place was extremely good! Friendly service. With two of us, we got 2 carafes of wine: a red and white. The wine was actually good! We also got soup or salad, amazing garlic bread, our entree and cappachino with our meal! Everything was excellent! It was all for about $25 a person. 
Also a cute old guy came over and played the accordion and sang an individualized song to each table! 

Go there and you won't be sorry. :)

I went here because I heard it's famous and been around forever. I was not overly happy with my meal though. I ordered their famous meatballs and spaghetti. The food came out at most 5 minutes after i ordered it, which tells me it was not prepared freshly for me, but rather was either made en mass or sitting around. The spaghetti was sticky and old tasting. The meatballs were good. The same for the Salad, it came right after I ordered it, and it was a good salad but again, not fresh. I could tell by how the lettuce was wilting in the Salad dressing that it had been around for a while. Somewhat pricey for in fresh food too...
Great place especially to take clients. One of the coolest hidden locations in Vegas.

I love this place. If your looking for a spot that takes you out of vegas and into little Italy Come Here. The walls at littered with Pics from the last 50 Years.  This place has been here forever.  The ambiance is great and relaxing.  There is also a Very Old guy who comes around and plays an accordion on your request and never plays twice in the same area so that others are not annoyed. Super sweet guy.

Reservations are best and easily made with the Yelp App.

I come here ever 3-4 months with my GF.  Unlimited Wine with your filling meal. I have had most of them and all remind me of my mothers cooking when I grew Up. 

Just thinking about this place makes me smile.

Its about $30-$40 a Meal and its not super fancy that is the only reason I give it 4 stars but its so close to the strip thats understandable.

An adorable little place just off the strip.  I think it's a bargin compared to some of the other places we ate...about $25 for en entire meal (salad, bread, pasta, wine) w/generous portions.  The food was good, but nothing fancy.   I liked the little accordion player, and the service was decent.  It was a nice change of pace from the strip.  I definitely recommend it.  We actually went twice in the same week.

It's a joint off the strip, a bit-- that's points.

Bottomless house wine-- that's points.

They got an ol' timer with an accordion that runs around the joint serenading fools-- that's some next level action. My man wants to feel bad that I'm eating alone but I put that to rest quick with a request for something sappy an' let him know I wouldn't have it another way.

My man works for tips and it bums me out that a couple of old handbags in windbreaker jumpsuits want to take selfies with him but can't throw a five down on it. Them's chumps.

The old school Italian borders on absurd, but it's fun absurd.

Skip the dinner salad-- it's too depressing to think of someone in the kitchen counting out radishes and tomato slices, factory-makin' your greens.  Just get at that steak and drink deep straight from the carafe.

The prices are a little high, I think because they include the wine and dessert automatically. I didn't understand wine was included. My group and I were not interested in having the wine, so I feel like we paid for something we didn't want. The service was decent. There was a man playing the accordion and he came to our table - he was super sweet and definitely added to the ambiance. The restaurant was very dark.

One of my favorite Italian spots in Vegas!  My husband and I try to go whenever we are in town.  I love the location right behind the Flamingo and The Cromwell. They have never disappointed us and we try to get something different each time.  Never had a bad experiencel there.  We always recommend it to any friends going to Vegas.  There is an older gentleman that plays the accordian and serenades.  The cappuccino at the end of the meal is the absolute best!  I highly recommend this amazing place!

Nope!!! If I wanted a large portion of frozen Italian food and cheap warm wine I'd just go pick-up a Stouffer's family size, some Sutter Home at room temp and save myself the drive to Vegas. Only thing I'd be missing would be a rude hostess and a creepy waitress to make me uncomfortable.

I cannot believe it has taken us so long to eat here! The shrimp with garlic and butter is beyond fantastic. The sausage cacciatore was incredible. It has been a long time since Italian food was executed perfectly without being pretentious. Everything, EVERYTHING was amazing! I cannot wait to return.

Went here last night with a big group,  and it was my first time here. Our friends recommended it, and I'm sure as hell glad that they did. 

First and foremost, the ambiance is way cool. I love all the trinkets hanging from the ceiling, the showcase of all the mini-alcohol bottles, the signs on the walls, etc. It is a tad bit dark, but it is called a "hole in the wall", and I feel like it fits perfectly. Think Buca Di Beppo, but way more authentic and awesome looking. 

Second, the staff is/are really nice and helpful. Our waiter was very informative, patient, and efficient with his service. There's also a sweet older gentleman that walks around playing the accordian at each table--and he takes requests! 

Third, the food is amazing. We were informed by our waiter that it does take awhile to make and get your food because they do take their time and ensure that everything is done correctly and deliciously. The food was indeed awesome. We are big garlic lovers, so to us, even the (unlimited) garlic bread was pristine. What was very cool about this place is that literally everything is included in the price of your meal--unlimited red and white house wine (Burgundy and Chablis) carafes,  garlic bread, your choice of soup or salad, and a delicious cappucino to finish the meal. I was sold on the fact that I could essentially have my own personal carafe of red wine since no one else at our table drank.

It was an all around wonderful experience. I look forward to coming here again and again in the future. This place will definitely become a Vegas tradition for our group of friends.

Possibly the best meal I've ever had.  For my courses I had minestrone soup, garlic-butter shrimp on pasta, all the wine I could drink and the most amazing cappuccino.  Both the food and service were great.  There was even a cute old man walking around playing music. Next time in Vegas I will definitely be going here again.

On April 5th, 2017, my wife and I had dinner here. We made reservations the day previous and when we arrived, we were greeted warmly and immediately seated. Once seated the waiter, brought us wine and garlic bread. The bread was excellent, the red wine just "meh" (not great, not horrible). Wife had Eggplant Parmesan and I had the Lasagna. Both were served in a nice portion, fresh out of the over, and were tasty! We really enjoyed them but couldn't eat it all (We are looking forward to lunch today with the left overs!). Our only distraction at Battista's was the speed of the waiters; they are working so hard to get folks in and out they move like the wind! They provided great service, but we got tired just watching their frenetic pace! We highly recommend Battista's and we will go here again on our next visit!

I love the Hole-in-the-wall.  It is a go to dinner joint for me every trip to Vegas!  Consistently great food and at a good value when you throw in the salad, garlic bread and house wine!  The accordion player is an iconic figure in Vegas in my eyes.

This is one of me and my wife's absolute favorite places to eat I Vegas. We only found it when  we were at "Tickets for Tonight" getting tickets for Blue Man Group when the ticket agent asked where we planned to eat that night and if he could interest us in a discounted meal someplace. My wife was in the mood for Italian and none of their discounts were for an Italian restaurant. Instead, he told us we should go check out Battista's if we wanted a really great Italian meal. We went that night and have been going back every time were in town ever since. From the moment you step inside until the moment you leave it feels like you've entered a cozy restaurant in Italy.

The food is great! The all you can drink red or white house wine is pretty tasty. It's a multi-course meal finished off with a cappuccino. I highly recommend it to everyone who visits Vegas and wants a great meal experience.
Food is great and all but waaaaay expensive!!!! The all you can drink wine is great but not tasty. Definitely the right "date-place"!

Decent Italian food with good service and lots of complimentary wine.
Not the greatest, but the atmosphere is unique and .....did I say lots of complimentary wine?

I really liked it! Wine is included, as you may have read, it's not the best ,but very good for an included wine. We had to take our spaghetti back to our hotel, too much food! I thought it was a great value, good atmosphere and easy to walk to from the strip.

Imagine eating authentic Italian food nestled in a cozy restaurant. Large groups welcome. Sing-a-longs encouraged! All tables receive endless red and white wine and after dinner, served cappuccino. There is not a bad item on the menu (which is located on the wall), but try the lasagna. Also,  it allows an escape from the strip...
This place is a nice place to go very cool atmosphere and the food is delicious and authentic.

Never a bad experience.  I always make a reservation to make sure am not having to  wait. The food is always delicious. I was only  able to dine there once a year visiting but now that I moved to Vegas it sure is great to visit a couple times a month. A must go

Omg! This restaurant is amazing! It is a little on the pricey side but it is totally worth every penny! Plus you can never go wrong with all you can drink red and white wine. I tried the shrimp Alfredo, lasagna, spaghetti, as well as their salad with salami. It was soo delicious. If you are in Vegas you must try this!

One of our favorite spots in Vegas. The basic dishes arent amazing, but the steak Caruso, garlic shrimp scampi, and chicken rio are awesome. And you can't go wrong with unlimited wine and garlic bread. Plus I love the atmosphere - not fake like a lot of vegas.
Cool place. Food below average for price. Garlic bread and cappuccinos are the best part. Gordy, the accordion player, makes the place.

Its kind of like a buca de bepo.  Food is ok.  Nothing really taste fresh, but it doesnt taste that bad either.  Atmosphere is pretty coo but a litte pricey in my opinion.  The best part of my meal i would have to say is the garlic bread in the beginning.  Lasagna was ok and my wife had a chicken dish which was ok as well.   I would go somewhere else unless you have your heart set out on some OK Italian.

If you want to eat expensive but mediocre Italian food in Vegas, this is the place!

Good: 
- the garlic bread
- the waiter (Doug) was polite and nice 
- unlimited red and white wine 

Bad:
- the salad was terrible, way too much lime juice was added to it. It was inedible. 
- the vegetable minestrone soup is made from beef broth. The server didn't mention it until we specifically asked. Why call it vegetable soup if it isn't vegetarian?? 
- the capacino served at the end is diabetic inducing. It has way too much sugar. How about not adding sugar and giving it on the side?

Ugly:
- the clam pasta had 5 clams each the size of a dime. The pasta sauce (olive oil and garlic) had very little flavour and taste. 
- the vegetarian Pasta (Tomato based sauce) was bland and flavorless. I've had store bought pasta sauce that tasted better. 
-the lighting in the restaurant is horrid. It's a mix of dark yellow and orange. At first we didn't mind it, but as we spent more time in the restaurant, we started getting headaches. And we couldn't enjoy whatever little taste the food had. 
- With all the problems above, the food is very expensive and you are left with a big hole in your wallet. 

My experience at this restaurant has been a life changing one. I have decided that hence forth I shall never ever set foot inside a restaurant that has rating of less than 4 stars. 

Tl;dr: stay away from this place!

A fine place to take say, an 18 year old nephew. Not a good place to take your friends from milan. The food was mediocre at best. Very very very covered in sauce. Like whoa. Service was fine. Nothing amazing nothing horrific, a solid B-

The decor is amazing and the vibe is fun. The food is painfully missing the mark.

Vegas is know for being a "transient" city, not in a bad way, but that people move in and out and restaurants open and close literally over night. Seriously, living in Las Vegas, you could eat 3 meals, plus 2 snacks a day- everyday for a year and NOT even make a dent in the places available to you.

We lived in Summerlin for a couple of years and Battista's was really a restaurant I enjoyed, we ate here about once a month (maybe twice) and I preferred an early dinner seating. I could go on and on about the decor and cool stuff everywhere, but it's the food I am Yelping and decor is not something you eat. I was just crazy about the garlic bread here, not sure what they do, but I have not found a restaurant that makes it the same way as Battista's, it is delicious and perfect in it's simplicity. 

I know it sounds cheesy and all, but dunking this bread into my bowl of Minestrone soup just made me happy, I also asked for the salad because I love my crunchies and the salad here is crisp and tasty. Hubby likes the chicken parm dish and the NY Steak. I am about the veal dishes and the shrimp w/garlic butter, again, soppin' up the sauces with that garlic bread, I couldn't have been happier, except for that the red wine which is included in the meal and lets face it, wine and Italian food just go hand in hand. Service was quick, friendly and attentive and the many times we went when I was pregnant with our daughter (I didn't drink wine), the servers checked on us, but just let us be, to enjoy our dinner together.

I have sent many friends here to have dinner when they visit Vegas and it is definitely where I go for a first meal when I am visiting.

Don't change a thing Battista's you are perfect just as you are.
Well, the place is amazing. Like a history museum. The stuff was nice and there was 45 minute wait time. Here is the thing at least for me... IT IS Italian place HOW COME you don't have PIZZA.

Absolutely love the ambience, and the esteemed garlic bread was definitely living up to its reputation.   Quick service, delicious pasta dish bay I had (clams with white sauce) and the complimentary wine was not only a plus, but a delicious, quality one!   Strongly(!) recommend when looking for an Italian spot in Vegas!

Even though I live in Vegas, I didn't hear about Battista's until I was talking to a friend of my brother's who only comes to Vegas once in a blue moon. However, after his suggestion, the wife and I gave it a shot. First, its not the best Italian food in Las Vegas..but it has the best atmosphere by far. When you eat at BHIW you will be taken back to a time when the mafia had more control than the giant corporations. The pictures on the wall include all sorts of famous people, and each little dining area has a bit of a different feel. The menu is basic, and written up on the wall. Dinner is an all inclusive deal, with soup, salad, bread, entree, ALL YOU CARE TO DRINK HOUSE WINE and a cappuccino. The price is higher than other places, but you have to pay a little for the authenticity and proximity to the Strip...as well as the free wine. I've never had anything bad here, and it has become a favorite of my very picky family. The wine isn't the best, but its included! My favorite dish is the manicotti, but I don't dig the spinach that comes with it. 

The atmosphere is also improved by a little old Italian man who plays the accordion. For a few dollars he will play you a tune. Some people may think this is creepy, but I think its charming.
Nice little place. Very good meatballs and yummy bread. I'll come back. Wine selection is decent for what the place is like.

Food was way overpriced for what it was. Unlimited wine, not the best quality. You also get a free cappuccino. Atmosphere was pleasant, went to celebrate my friends birthday. 
Wouldn't come back, but it was nice to try it.

Food was average. Service was bad. Glasses and plates dropped on to the table. Waiter and busboy were almost rude.
weird, aweful place for dinner.  spend the $$ elsewhere.

We had our wedding reception at Battista's and couldn't have had a better time! We had a party of 20, and the accommodations were perfect! The food selections were great, from seafood to traditional ravioli, and the flavors were right on the money. 
Unlimited wine was a hit with our crew, and our waiter Gerson kept it flowing. He was such a professional with all of our special request, hopefully he waits on you when you visit!
Can't say enough about Gordy the accordion player! Most of the family is from Ohio, and he rocked out the Ohio State fight song for an impromptu sing along! 
This is a must visit when in Las Vegas!
Fantastic time with friendly staff and terrific food!

Pros:
* all the wine you can drink
*"cappuccino" chocolate, hazelnut flavored coffee  with whipped cream is yummy.
*meatballs were tender and tasty
* cannolis were super sweet but yummy 
* garlic bread was actual garlic bread 
Cons:
* salad was drowning in italian dressing
* spaghetti tasted like noodles in tomato catsup.
A great break from Casino joints.  Always good and consistent but occasionally a little slow on service.

Great atmosphere, you tend to forget you are in the very loud city. Unique decorations. Surprize - the price includes good table wine, soup or salad, and a cappuccino (which is really more of hot coco) or ice cream for kids. Tried 3 pasta dished - chicken cacciatore, meatballs and cheese ravioli - liked them all.

I NEED MORE ACCORDION!

I also need more wine too!!!

Yes if you are looking for that in Vegas, then you will find both here. And honestly we do need more of thesr things in the shadow of Sin City to have a good time. 

The name here is cute but it is not really a whole in the wall.  It's not a dive restaurant. It just happens to be a restaurant off the strip and hidden behind the Flamingo Hilton/Barbary Coast Casinos. 

You will find a wait here. In fact, make a reservation if you can.  This place is simple.  Order a meal and for a fixed price you get salad, main course, cappuccino and all you can drink wine. It is a deal. 

I've had many memorable dinners here.  One of my favorites was with my wife, who happened to be my girlfriend at the time. We had a great meal and the carafe's of wine were flying off the table. Honestly by the time we left here, I'm not even sure we ate food. That was the wine talking. Long story short we ended up at the Bellagio with a private concert with Wyclef John. I am going to give Battista's and there bottomless wine the credit here. We must have looked like a fun couple standing in front of the dancing waters.  My words of advice...fun things happen to people having fun!

Okay back to Battista's...the food is not going to win any awards.  It is just basic old school Vegas Italian. If your looking for a 5 star reality show winner chef experience then go somewhere else. This place is about having fun. 

I've also had a few work dinners here too and we've had some great times. I attribute that to the wine again. The wine sitting on the table is hard for anyone to resist it. So people who normally don't drink will pour themselves a few wines and why not because its on the house. 

I want to mention the accordion player because it is big part of this place.  He is so cute but all he wants is that dollar or two.  He walks from table to table working the whole room. He probably makes a $100,000 per year. I remember once he walked up to our table.  Asked me, "Where you from kid?". I said, "Chicago". And he jumped in and started playing the song, Chicago by Sinatra.  And when he finished the song he threw out his hand like gimme 5 but he didn't want my hand slapping his unless there was a green bill in it.  This is a novelty here and I think it keeps people coming back for more. 

So if your looking for something different from the usual Vegas Strip drama, then I highly recommend you check this place out. It is a fun time and if your not having fun, then have some more wine!

Mixed reviews for this place. We actually gave up reservations at Giada to come here, as the reviews were pretty great. 
Came in about 545 pm and checked in with the hostess. She advised us of an hour wait since we didn't have a reservation so we decided to put our names on the list and have a drink at the bar. 
The place was not busy, in my opinion. A few people at the bar and what looked like several open tables. I decided to check OpenTable.com just for kicks. I was super surprised to see 6:00pm available as accepting reservations. 
What the heck, why not? I filled out the reservation request and it confirmed us as having a reservation for 2 @ 6pm. 
My husband approached the hostess at 550 to "check in" for our reservation. Immediately, they brought us to "our table". Seriously? The hostess was beyond annoyed. I've got a hungry husband, don't think I'm beyond using my OpenTable expertise to our advantage. 
Our server Ryan was very sweet and efficient, even when his section was bustling. 
Husband ordered spaghetti with meat sauce. Holy herbs and spices! A little overboard but still edible, I suppose.
I ordered cheese manicotti. It was definitely only "okay". Very bland- a vast difference from the overwhelming flavor (and not in a great way) of the spaghetti. 
So what was good? Can't go wrong with three free wine!  In all seriousness, the bread was delicious, as was Husband's salad and the to-die-for cappuccino. 
Will we be back? Sure. But we'll make reservations first :)

I had expected more from this place. Food was decent but not the best,I had the chicken Parmesan. We enjoyed the salad and bread. Our families had hyped up the place too much and my expectations were not meet but the cappuccinos were amazing. Service was fair.

I came here with my girlfriend who grew up in Vegas and told me how much she liked coming here as a child, I live not too far from the restaurant so we made it a date night. I am very picky when it comes to Italian and Mexican food as I am both and was raised on authentic Mexican and Italian food and also lived in Italy and Mexico but I always give new places a shot. So here it goes, 

I was very disappointed in the food as well as the lay out of the seating, when they seat you you are basically sitting with the table next to you in like a small room, I didn't get to witness the little hi who goes around playing music but I doubt that would of change my opinion about the place, the food was ok, nothing impressive, I had a steak that I honestly felt like I could of cooked it in my back yard and thrown some sauce on it. You get complimentary house wine but trust me no one is going there for the wine, my girlfriend who loves wine had to have her wine with water after every drink she took ( never seen anyone do that before ) so yeah the wine, not good. The coffee at the end was ok but again no one is going there just for that, I also felt everything was over priced but it makes sense because they really are charging you for their " complimentary " wine and coffee, at the end of the night I was disappointed but was happy I tried it because it's one of those Las Vegas things you have to do, I wouldn't go back or recommend it but if you are one those people who just has to cross it off your things to do in Las Vegas list then go for it.

This is truly a hole in the wall AND a perfect place to come hang when you want a nice environment with a quiet ambience. They supposedly have an accordion player. Cure place, I'll definitely make it  one of my "locals" getaway.
I've been told that the food here "aint' bad", I'll get back with you when I know more about that, but for now, it's such a great place for groups of friends to hang out together, be NEAR the Strip but not on it,  have a great bar, drinks that aren't overpriced, Cider (which I love) and, at some point...some dude on accordion. 
Where, in Vega$$, can you get all that???

Prices are between $20-$40 with free garlic bread, soup and unlimited white/red wine.   The house wine was all but undrinkable and was compared a friend to cheap Chinese wine. And we hoped that at least the food would be authentic or good but it isn't even as good as olive garden.  Gave 2 stars for some sort of nostalgia that some will enjoy but I just found it hokey.

Loved it every single time we went there! Food is great, wine is good and the atmosphere is unbelievable. 
The steak was cooked to perfection. It was tender and rich flavored. The alfredo sauce was the one you only get in a places where it is homemade. 
We will be back again!

Hole in the Wall is a misnomer. Usually, you expect a low key greatness but I guess when they put that in the name, we should have known better. This place was....terrible. I've had better Italian food at Olive Garden (yikes!). #sorrynotsorry. We all ordered different meals, Chicken Alfredo, Lasagna, Penne with Cacciatore, and Eggplant. All entrees come with salad or soup, garlic bread and wine. Let's start with the wine. It's watered down and blah. The garlic bread was ok but it's more Parmesan than garlic. The entrees were bland and tasteless. The chicken in my chicken Alfredo was tender but bland. The Alfredo sauce itself didn't taste like anything. The other person who got it said his was bland. My friend's meatball was more like a meat clump and the sauce was a disgrace. The salad was the only part of the meal I enjoyed. Those that got the soup were not terribly disappointed but not impressed. Service was a bit slow but the staff was nice. For Vegas, the prices were not bad but because the food was so disappointing, we all felt cheated out of $40/person for crappy food. You can skip this place.
Hole in the wall all around fun dinner with friends that is very different from the Vegas norm.

This is not my first time to Battistas. Always a favorite. One low price, you get garlic toast, soup or salad, your entree, cappuccino and all the wine you can drink. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere - down to the accordion player serenading your table. Check out all the pictures of celebrities who have eaten there!

If you have never ate pasta or Italian food on the east coast, you may not know the difference between good Italian and just another restaurant serving pasta. 

This place looks like it may have had potential or even may have been good at some point in history. The fact is they over cooked the pasta! In a restaurant thats supposed to be authentic Italian. 

The service is good and its reasonable but I dont recommend it. Go Across the street to the Italian place at Bally's. Its actually better.

This place is only one block off the strip, behind the Flamingo.  Mr Man and I love this place for their unlimited house wine with your meal.  I love their Seafood pasta, Eggplant Parmigiana, and their Linguine with Clam.  Mr Man recently tried their Special of the Day - a huge 16oz steak with mashed potatoes.  All the guys' jaws dropped when that big ol' hunk of meat came out.  All the guys tried it and instantly regretted not ordering the steak. hahahah Regardless, we all loved the food and had such good service from our waiter.

1 star taken due to being a bit pricey.  But hey, it's only 1 block away from the strip so you can't expect it to be cheap!

In anywhere but Las Vegas it would get 1 star, however given Las Vegas is so ridiculously overpriced and overrated (nope, NOT a fan, won't be going back ugh) this place gets an extra star simply as it was less ridiculous than most of its neighbours. And as the service was great.

Aside from that the menu was annoying (set menus only so you're forced to buy all sorts of stuff you may not want). The food was pretty awful, except the steak was really good for the price. The garlic bread was weird and lukewarm, we had no idea what the lump of fried carb stuff even was on the plate, and the wine was basically undrinkable. Seriously could they just give you one glass of drinkable wine rather than a carafe of awful wine cordial?! Ick.

The staff were nice.

This place is so over rated, it's not even funny. 
  First of all, way to expensive. 20 plus dollars for everything. Any type of pasta dish is over 20 bucks. 
  Secondly the food. I ordered the veal parma. It was not fresh, it tasted frozen and reheated. Not mention it was over thirty dollars. They serve it with a side of some green stuff I couldn't make out what is was. Maybe spinach. Tasted like dirt. It also came with a side of pasta. Under cooked. I tried my wives pasta, it to was under cooked. 
  It's a bottomless house wine place. I think the price of this place is trying to make up for this free house wine.
  I was celebrating my return to work and my wife's vacation. A friend of mine joined us. He has been here at this restaurant fifteen years ago. He warned us it isn't all that. I never have been here before.I should of took his advise and went to my favorite Italian restaurant down the street. Bucca di Beppo (it would of been a lot cheaper also). Did I mention I know the ex-chef. I'll be sending him a personal note also.
 The other reviews I have read talks a lot about the ambience. It seemed old. It looked like it needed a good cleaning threw out the dinning area. I didn't feel like home. I'm Italian and this is not 'authentic' italian food. I know authentic and the difference of re-heated.
  All in all I will not be returning to this place ever....

A group of us had dinner here at the end of April 2011 and the food was better than the previous visits, a step up from their usual pretty good.  Service was fast, staff was very friendly and Gordy was rockin' (so to speak).  Great evening out for a group!

This is a late review. Never really tried the food, it was raining about a year ago. The people had the place so secured to keep in the heat. We were seated in the side room. I started to feel the effects of carbon dioxide poisoning. I alerted the staff and they did nothing, had to stand outside for 20 minutes to feel better. But only 5 minutes for the symptoms to come back. 

Paid the according guy $10 for the table. He pushed the accordion together once and spoke the first two lines that's amore.

Delicious. Interesting ambiance. Low-lighting is nice. Leafy green house salad is very good, garlic bread is fantastic. I had spaghetti with meat sauce, Hubby had manicotti with a side of meatballs. All were delicious. Generous servings and red or White House wine includes. We will definitely be back. Hubby says "it's the beat meal I've ever had."

I love this place so much! The interior is unique and old school and funky with fairly dim lighting. You should make a reservation cuz this place is very popular. The food was outstanding and free wine with your meal!

While this place does provide large portions of food the quality of it seemed subpar. My favorite part of the meal was the breadsticks and the salad, they were actually very tasty. The unlimited wine tasted watered down, but it's free so I didn't expect much out of it. 

In conclusion the food was pretty pricy considering how bland it was. The service was good, although, when I made a reservation the night before, they had no recollection of my reservation when I arrived :/

2.5/5 would not go again.

Apparently u need to go with a group of 4 or 3 vs 2 as we got there about 20 min earlier than a group of 4 and had to wait an extra 20 min after they got sat. I complained and they explained that they only have so many 2 man seats. That's complete bullshit. It's completely diff if it's a table that sits 8-10. Obv they don't want to sit 2 but to say 3/4 gets priority is crazy. Also, they have way to much bar seating that u can order from the bar the whole menu but not get the wine along with it. Makes no sense. I haven't even eaten and I hate this place but I'm too hungry to leave. Better be good!

This is the equivalent to what you will find in New Jersey . We are talking old-school American Pasta restaurant with over cooked egg plant Parmesan and mediocre steaks

Las Vegas institution it maybe. but I will  not be back as this is not the Las Vegas experience I am hoping for. I don't need to have this kind of food outside Of New Jersey.

This place has food that is just out of this world with flavor. We went here because it had 'hole in the wall' in the description. Usually, those places are pretty good. This was no exception to that rule. The place was a little dim as far as lighting is concerned. We actually thought about using our cell phone as a light but there was no need because the menu was in huge lettering on the wall. When the food came, the portions were large so we did have some to take home. I think the best part though is that wine pairing was included in the meal! And to top things off, an accordion player came along to play some notes for us while we ate.

This place is such a trip man. If you need a break from the flash and glitz of the strip take a short walk behind ballys and you will find this little nugget tucked into a strip mall. Don't go here for the food. Go for the history, the atmosphere and the free wine :). 
Food actually isn't too bad. Not great. Don't plan on going out and fist pumping in the club afterwards. You will be too full to walk.

I can honestly say this was the worst restaurant I have ever been to in my entire life. And I don't even have high standards. All I need is mildly decent service and pretty good, inexpensive food. This place didn't even come close to that. It was seriously laughable. 

For starters, there isn't a normal menu. It's this weird small menu stuck to the wall that is crazy overpriced and the food wasn't even mildly decent to justify it. You have to order an entree dish and it comes with garlic bread, soup or salad, some pasta dish, a coffee, and a complimentary glass of red or white wine. No a la carte or appetizers possible. 

Our waiter was the most socially awkward person ever. He didn't make eye contact and would walk away from our table as we were placing our orders. We would start talking to him and he'd start walking away from the table every time mid-conversation like he had somewhere else really important to be and he couldn't be bothered with us.

I kind of feel like we were on the show boiling point from
MTV. We kept expecting someone to pop out with a camera telling us it was all a huge joke. It was that uncomfortable. When we finally got our food, our waiter forgot our complimentary wine and when we asked if he was going to bring it he stared aimlessly over our heads and responded saying yeah, like he was really confused and then finally brought it over. We also asked for bottled water and he brought us a carafe of tap water when we specifically asked for bottled water.  Also, even if you aren't eating, if you have a bite of someone else's food they charge you $13.... Wtf is that?

There was a 70 year old man who came to each table serenading you with his accordion hoping for a tip which was just so sad and awkward. It made us feel so uncomfortable especially when he finished and none of us had cash. So weird. We just wanted to eat real quick, no serenade needed. The food was nothing special either. My boyfriend ordered the meatball dish and asked our waiter to have his meatballs cut into smaller pieces and they came in full form. So clearly the waiter didn't listen to his request at all. Also, we never received any side pasta dish like the menu said you would get with your entree. (Not like we wanted it anyways with how horrible the food quality was). But still, you expect to get what you pay for. 

All in all this place had horrible food, extremely unprofessional staff and made us very uncomfortable. Do yourself a solid and go elsewhere.
