Came in after looking for an Italian place.  I had the chicken Alfredo and friend had the lasagna. Both came out luke warm. The chicken seemed to be precooked and heated up for the dish. The wine was all you can drink for a reason.  But for the price you pay you don't really get that great of a deal, especially there in Vegas. However, it is the old world atmosphere that I find charming.

If you're looking for something tastey on the strip but not at outrageous strip prices, stop in at Battista's Hole in the Wall.  Red/white house wine is included, the menu is simple and even picky eaters can find something to eat.

this place, is straight up the jam. 

if you're hungry, and like getting drunk. wow. jam. 

all you can drink white and/or red wine!?!?! included?!?!?!! whaaat?????...jam.

complimentary cappuccino offered at meal end, nice. jam. 

old timey accordion guy?!?!?!!?!? whaaaat??? 

i'm sleepy now, naps. 

five stars.

Service good. Food is really bad. Soup from a can. Salad from a bag. Pre prepped meals. Over priced. Didn't try the "free" wine.

 I've lived out here five years and heard this place was a legend. Maybe once it was a good place to eat but you really gotta hate money and food to go here. Overpriced. Tasted like tv dinner but worse. Can't stress how bad it is. "Cappicuino" is actually some powdered sugar coffee drink like nescafe with whip cream. The bring like 20 on a cart and just let them sit until people are done eating. Salad had sliced up lunch meat, flavorless shredded cheese and some sour dressing.

Meal took turn for the worse when a scary old man the size of a child with accordion comes uncomfortably close to us, party of three. Says creepily "I have the perfect song for 3 guys." Proceeds to play "take me out to the ball game" and replaces the word peanuts with penis. Super weird. Just not the right time at all for that kind of humor. Wanted to leave right there. Should have; we were there to eat not have some creepy old dude talk about penis while we eat. I am not offended by it specifically it's just in really poor taste. Kids within earshot. He made sure to get really close in to our space when he said penis; as if we didn't get it.  He ends the song obviously expecting a tip. Says "thank you guys so much" three or four times but in an insincere way. I have a tip; stop making sexually awkward jokes like that with strangers in your place of business so they don't out you on the internet. I have seen other posters say he is the owner. 

If so you're put on notice; your restaurant sucks. Your food sucks. You suck. Your wait staff is solid; that's about it. Didn't even try your garbage wine. Your restaurant is selling nostalgia and a lot of crap on the walls. 

Hostess and server were both attentive and polite. Swear they both knew the food was crap and were embarrassed for us. Fat tip left for staff. Other than that please do not support this business. They are ripping people off with their low quality food and that old guy is a creep.  

I'll never understand all these positive reviews. Spend the $$ and go to maggiano's. Or just go the grocery store and get some Stouffer's. Both are better options especially since you won't have some strange old goon pretending to play the accordion and making bad jokes while you eat. 

Just can't possibly imagine how low someone's standards have to be to give this place a positive food review. It's terrible especially at the price point of about  minimum of 40 per person after tip. Really some of the worst food I have ever eaten in my life. Could not finish anything served from the salad to the "cappicuino."

Anyone giving this 5 stars for food quality is either lying for some reason or is absolutely unqualified to judge the quality of food. Just absolutely shocking to me than anyone with $40 dollars to spend on dinner could possibly find this acceptable. It's terrible. Do not go here.

This place used to get a lot of hype, stopped in for dinner, waiter Anthony was very nice. You get a bang for your buck here, dinners all come with bread, salad, entree, and unlimited red or white wine, as well as a cappuccino drink afterwards. The food is just ok though, had the chicken parm, was not crazy about the sauce, or the pasta side. I might give them another try.

Been here before.  It is a hidden gem-great place to escape to with the family for an "ok" pasta meal and recharge.
Staff is always hit or miss especially the hostess stand that snarls at you.  Kinda too bad.
May not go back if that attitude continues. My teenage kids even noticed the sad attitude from the hostess stand and mentioned it to me.

Battista's Hole in the Wall first caught my attention when I heard it served unlimited house wines... Free wine? Count me in!

As a fan of Italian food and wine, I wanted to see if it was any good here. I went with a group of 6 or so on a Friday night and there was a wait of 45 minutes. Once seated, we were offered house white and red wine. Average wine of course, nothing special. Since it was busy, it took a while for our food to come out but we didn't mind as we had wine to preoccupy us.

The ambiance is warm and cozy, the place pretty dimly lit (view pictures to see).

I got the lasagna and it wasn't anything to rave about. I didn't finish it nor take the leftovers home. The free wine is great, but the food is important too. I would most likely check out other Italian restaurants before returning here.

AMBIANCE:

Eclectic, casual and fun. It starts with the stuffed moose head over the receptionist's station dubbed, "Moose-olini" and spreads to the walls filled with tiny airline-sized bottles of booze, pictures of celebrities and anything else one can think of except the kitchen sink. Who knows everything that is stuck in the ceiling. I was almost afraid to look. One thing I am sure of--it's all been there for a very long time.

ENTERTAINMENT:

A tiny, wizened, ancient little man who is seemingly dwarfed by his big accordion. He comes around every half hour for about two minutes, plays very badly (in a "it's so bad it's great" sort of way), panders shamelessly for tips and then disappears (probably to get oxygen and rebuild his strength for another two minute appearance a half hour later).

Ref: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNVcnSaMSrTmjJBMrHTy9w?select=jJQ-WqpZTRkjYGSqFF-nyQ

CONCEPT:

Charge double the value for run-of-the-mill Italian meals that are posted on a board and then try to compensate with free vino by the carafe. In a similar vein to Olive Garden, you can stuff yourself with unlimited garlic bread too. If you drink enough wine and chow down on the garlic bread, you'll enjoy the accordion serenades, go away full, and really not care about the quality of the meal and the price tag. If you're with good friends, it probably will be an enjoyable experience.

OUR EXPERIENCE:

We walked over to this little hole in the wall before a Penn and Teller show based on our concierge's recommendation. We drank the "free" wine, ate a lot of garlic bread, sang a lot of "Happy Birthday's" to various folks in the room, listened to the little old man butcher "O Sole Mio", and ate pasta dishes. I ordered linguini chopped clams in a white sauce for $26.95. The other dishes were all priced in the mid-twenties. My clams and linguini were of the $11.95 caliber. The wine was simply bad.

In summary, Battista's must have a very good working concept to stay in business for over 3 decades. That concept just doesn't work for me. I'd even recommend the place for those in a Monty Pythonish mood and looking for "something completely different." If this is the case, just go in with the right expectations which shouldn't be centered around their culinary excellence.

Battista's was the only recommendation by our excellent concierge that I don't heartily endorse.

We had a great time at this restaurant. Old school and fun atmosphere. The food was truly plentiful and pleasing. The all inclusive menu makes it a pretty good deal. Will return to try the linguine with clams!
Must try if your in Vegas. Great Italian food and free wine. You may have to wait so make a reservation

Definitely not the highest quality of Italian cuisine that I have experienced, however the atmosphere has a strange appeal.... I really wanted to like this place.... 
We had reservations and despite the extreme amount of people at the door we were seated right away, which I loved. Thank you for observing a reservation!!

As the other reviews mention, you get for the price of your dinner, unlimited wine, bread, a dinner salad or soup, entre, and cappuccino. 

The wine was of course cheap and not anything close to what you would get at another restaurant that charges by the glass or bottle.... but seriously, its unlimited and free???
if you expected a good quality free wine in Las Vegas.... You also thought you were going to win at the casino, right??

The garlic bread was good... Salad was okay (no choice of dressing, house dressing or nothing)
I had the spaghetti and meatballs.... ugh.... pick something else... this was so bland and tasteless. 
I really wish I had tried another entre!!

My husband had the eggplant parmesan and he said his was pretty good. Prepared well and good flavor and portion. 

We passed on the cappuccino... I wasn't feeling so good after drinking all that cheap wine........

I would give it 3 stars for food, 4 for atmosphere,  and 5 for wine. Wife and I shared the lasagne. Comes with a nice salad and bread. $13 extra for sharing. Which is ok because you get an extra salad, bread, cappuccino and of course wine. All the food was fair. Nothing great nothing bad. Atmosphere was old school Italian,  very inviting.  Menus were on the wall.  You get red and/or white a bottle of wine on your table. Cappuccino was definitely Americanized,  very sweet with whipped cream on top. Good but not Italian (breakfast drink in Italy). Accordion player worked a tip out of us. Pretty old guy, didn't really play well but was nice.
I would go back for atmosphere and wine.

This place is amazing. The atmosphere is fun. The place is packed with tables, old photographs of stars and mobsters and decor. The meals come with complimentary all you can drink house red or white wine, which makes the prices very affordable if you're a wine drinker. At the end of the meal, they serve complimentary espresso, which is to die for! On top of it all, there is this adorable little old Italian man that walks around and serenades for tips, of course. This place has been around for years for a reason! It's a must on the Vegas list.

We picked this restaurant because the reviews were superb. We were unimpressed. The staff was friendly, but not as attentive as the reviews said. We weren't sure if it's because we were a large party and the gratuity was already included. We had to ask for checks several times. It was our friends 30th birthday and they brought out a cold brownie that no staff member would've eaten themselves. Lastly, the food in general was not amazing. I could've had the same quality by buying boxed pasta and sauce in a bottle from a local store. Wouldn't recommend.

Old school Italian restaurant that you can find one block off the strip. 

Menu is located on the wall. Dishes come with soup or salad and an amazing cappuccino after dinner that taste like an amazing chocolate chip cookie. All you can drink house wine?? Yes please. Meals come with white or red and all you can drink. 

Food is better than Olive Garden but it isn't the best high end either. I will say you will love it and the atmosphere. 

Many popular athletes and celebrities eat here so be ready to run into someone. 

On a date with the one you love?? Make sure the little old guy who has to be close to 90 comes by and plays a song on the accordion for you!! Tip him a few bucks and you will make his day.

Love coming here when I stop in Vegas.
The food is amazing! I would go in right when it opens so you won't have to wait that long or make reservations because it is ALWAYS packed.

On a recent girls trip to Vegas we dined at Battista. We wanted to try a restaurant off the strip and noticed this place on an Uber ride. It's one block away from the strip so we decided to check it out. The atmosphere and old Italian feel is wonderful and feels as if other restaurants have tried to recreate it and have failed. 

As for the the food, the menu is very traditional and includes salad/soup and tasty garlic bread plus all you can drink white and red wine, yes please!! I stuck with spaghetti and meatballs and thought it was tasty but not the best I've ever had. My friends felt the same about their meals. I will say the after dinner cappuccino was delightful. The perfect dessert! 

Lastly, the accordion player was a very nice touch! He played "Back home again in Indiana" for us Indiana girls!

Been wanting to eat here since I was a kid so when I saw they had a groupon I was like let's try it! Well I wish I hadn't lol it was pretty terrible! 

Service, Garlic bread and salad all were great but our dinners not good. I had steak piziolla and the steak was way to thick and very rare! There sauce has no flavor just very bland. My boyfriend had spaghetti and meat sauce and he also said the sauce had no flavor. For the quality of food u get here it's way overpriced. Can now say I tried it and I am sure it was probably way better back in the day and just gone down hill now
This place. It's like a step back in time. Do yourself a favor and enjoy some amazing Italian food. We thoroughly enjoyed it.
Good price. But everything taste like candy. Way too sweet wine, marinara sauce, and the cappuccino tastes like hot cocoa.

WOW!! Finally made it here !
Great setting, nothing too upscale, however, just the place you always wanted to be at!!
Great service, great food, tasty and the right portion size. Minestrone soup was tasty and seasoned perfectly, veal picante excellent, tiramisu hit the spot with the cappuccino!
Our server Eric was attentive and explained the meals and answered our questions. 
Will be back !! Maybe as the accordion player !!

I was so disappointed with Battista's Italian restaurant.

Yes, you get free wine with your dinner but it is nothing special. 

You get your choice or soup or salad, main course of your choice and hey cappuccino at the end.

The Decour is from the 1950s old outdated all I could think of is this place is a fire trap waiting to happen.

The food was so-so more on the bland side definitely nothing to write home about. 

I would not recommend this place. Needs a major overhaul.

When I first moved to Las Vegas, I walked by this place every day on my way to work, and never stopped in, thinking it was a tourist trap.  Now I wish I had taken the risk..

I would call this "meat and potatoes" Italian.   If you are looking for high end, delicate/innovative italian, this isn't it. This is old school italian.   It reminds me of what my grandmother used to make.  Stated another way, this isn't the  high end italian you would find in New York or San Francisco but it is eons above what you would find at Olive Garden.

I can tell a lot about a restaurant by the salad and dressing they serve.  So many restaurants in Las Vegas serve iceberg and drown it in gloppy dressing.   This restaurant  used a variety of greens and didn't drown the lettuce with an inch of dressing - good first start.

Service was friendly and prompt.   Server recommended the lasagna, and it was excellent..  They don't use cheap cheese here either.  And, unlike some of the other reviewers, I enjoyed their red sauce.  

Wine was fine - reminded me of some hole in the wall italian restaurants in Rome I found myself in a couple of decades ago.   If you are a wine connoisseur and belong to three wine clubs in Sonoma, you are going to have issues, but for standard table wine, it was fine.  

In sum, I would say good value for the money.   Efficient and friendly service, solid food, with quality ingredients.  For a strip restaurant, I didn't feel it was over priced, nor did I feel like I was eating at a chain restaurant.  We'll be back.

Do make a reservation.  I was shocked to see how many people were there on a dead Sunday nite in Las Vegas.

Gordy is still alive...barely!  He's a funny old guy and barely plays anymore but it was still a treat to see him. My husband and I both got the lasagna. It was delicious and huge (you can easily split one) It's average Italian food so don't expect super fancy food, but we enjoyed it. The free wine was actually not that bad. We took half of each lasagna to go and gave to the homeless guy outside. Holy cow, was he happy. Made me want to go buy more food to give to him.

I've always notice this little hole in the whole spot every time my friend talks about stage door and was craving Italian food so I chose Battisa's. It's very old school Italian you feel like home. The dcor looked fun first think I spotted out was the wall of tiny liquor bottles from all over the world. It was pretty cool. Then when they seat you it's not one big open restaurant it's kinda sectional stations kind interesting but seems not private. They give you free house red or white wine which was decent I mean come on its free. The over all experience was nice I'd recommend it to anyone.

No.  We went here, since we had a group of 8 and it was late on our first night in Vegas, and it was close.  What a mistake.  This place is so overpriced it is laughable.  Paid $23 for cheese tortellini with "meat sauce".  With that you get a salad, garlic bread, and their house wine (red wine vinegar, perhaps?).  My pasta had clearly been sitting in a vat too long, and there was no meat to be found in the sauce.  I could have done better with a bag of frozen pasta and a jar of Ragu, and I hate Ragu.

Seriously, I don't know why anyone who reads these reviews would come here.  Dining in Vegas can be pricey and it can be bad, but at Battista's you get both in one visit.

It was simply OK.  We ate about 9:00 and service was very slow.  I'm not sure if that had anything to do with them closing a section of the place, but it was still busy in the section we ate.  Salad was odd but good; main course not so much.  Decor was old Vegas which was nice.  Wine and coffee is included in meal.  Overall, OK to eat at once but wouldn't go back again.

It was a VERY slow Tuesday night at the restaurant.
I made a reservation for 6:30 p.m.. The hostess who took the reservation was apathetic at best. She didn't repeat back the information on the telephone to ensure that the time and name were correct, she just said, "Yup."

Upon arrival to the restaurant the hostess who showed us to her seat just motioned for us to go to our seat  and did not specify which seat. She should have just walked us to  a row, containing six different tables to show which table specifically, but instead she rudely pointed and had us guess which table she referenced. Seriously? ! 

 We waited 15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us, and when I asked whether or not a worker who walked by was our server, he simply replied, "NOPE! " in the most apathetic fashion possible.

At this point in time, my better half went to speak to the manager regarding the atrocious service we'd received thusly. The manager simply stated, "Well, I've never had any complaints about him before, all I don't know what to tell you." 

I continued to wait for water/acknowledgement from our server who had already walked by me 3 times without so much as a "hello, I'll be right with you." 

At that time I requested to speak with the manager "Doug" myself. I explained the situation that no one at the restaurant seemed to have any interest in providing any level of satisfactory service, and he simply shrugged it off and said, "Well, I hope it gets better." Instead of taking ownership of the problem and asking how he could MAKE things better, he apathetically walked away and did nothing.

At this point in time we had lost our appetites and our desire to dine at a restaurant who simply didn't care about the quality of service they provide. This is level of laziness is  usually reflected in the food as well.

"Doug" watched us walk out without any concern for losing our business, and I guarantee that I will NOT be back. As a professionally trained chef, I do not go out for the great food as much as the service, as I can create any dish I desire in my own gourmet kitchen.

This place is completely unacceptable any longer. This was my 6th and final visit to this restaurant. I used to recommend this place time and again to all of my friends who visit this fine city. I am flabbergasted that a city built on hospitality could have an entire restaurant full of staff who just simply doesn't care about their customers. Obviously they learned it from their manager Doug. These things always start at the top. 


NEVER AGAIN

I am a chef and I also take my Italian food very seriously and this is suppose to be authentic? We attended a wedding reception my family is Italian and we had the Alfredo in was flavorless, marinara was bland and the ravioli was dry. The beef however was very tender. To me it's no better than Olive Garden atleast when I go there my expectations are set pretty low. My family didn't really finish any of their food we ended up taking everyone's left overs home so I could give it to my dogs. There's cheaper and higher quality Italian restaurants around or go to the Olive Garden it tastes no different to me.

No no no - this place is not good.  Food is not good (worst veal parm I have ever had), service sucked (dude was trying to fake an Italian accent, really demeaning) and the wine was horrible (it doesn't matter if its free).  When you are in Vegas you should treat yourself to a quality meal.  Do not come to Battista's because it seems like a great deal (its not).  The money you save on the all-inclusive option just isn't worth it.  There are only a handful of places worth leaving the strip for and this isn't one of the them.  Please do not trust the positive reviews and stay away.
AUTHENTIC old "Mafioso" feel! Very good food, with wine included! Huge portions and charming ambiance!! Great for large or small groups!

Food was amazing! You get complementary wine, soup or salad, cappuccino at the end of this your meal, AND garlic bread ! Can't beat that anywhere... Literally !!!! I ordered chicken parm which the chicken was a huge portion and you get a little side of pasta which I didn't mind because I'm not a pasta fan. My boyfriend ordered the chicken Marsala which isn't on the menu but they made it for him and he ate the whole thing. I ate most of mine but couldn't take it back to the hotel because we don't have a fridge or microwave. The service was great only issue we had was waiting for more bread but it was busy so I'm not going to complain. 

The only issue I had was the stupid old ladies behind us who honestly complained the whole time for no reason !!!! They were so rude about it I almost got up to tell them to shut up. They even said something to a couple that just sat down about how they couldn't get a wine glass for the free wine, they give you a little shot glass to drink from but that's fine ! Not something to complain about. They were being so long about how they were never coming back which is fine but keep it down and to yourself!!! We had a great experience thank you !

A great off-strip dining experience. A dive-bar atmosphere, but huge portions or delicious Italian food. 

Unlimited bread and wine. 

Need I say more...

Service was great... Cocktails okay.. Food mediocre.. Bar area.. Wait for table an hour.. Big portions.. I would not go out if my way to return.. But wouldn't avoid it if that's where the group wanted to go..

Tried this place for the first time. Must say...not impressed at all.  Over priced for so so food. The server had no personality and pretty much was a robot.  
Ambience was fantastic! But our table was to close to each other and the lady next to us was extremely loud and could not talk over her voice.  Church voice please!  Taking a pass on this place.

Overrated.
Everything was decent except for the main!
Soup, salad and wine were pretty 
standard, but appreciated as complimentary touches. The garlic bread was probably our favorite part of the whole meal but that may have just been because we were starving.
I went for the lasagna whilst hubby opted for the linguine chopped clam.
Lasagna was rather tasteless and way too tomato-ey, whist the linguine was extremely salty and just too overpowering on the fish side.
Cappuccino - delicious but basically a cup of sugar.
Cannot complain about the service. However, I do feel let down after having looked forward to trying the place out following recommendations from friends.
Shall not be returning here but glad I tried it.

My first trip to Battista's came some 12 years ago, and then again a couple years after that for the wedding of a friend.  On both of these visits, I am pretty sure that I did a whole lot more drinking than eating, and my memory is that the food was good, if not downright tasty.

When we went back to Las Vegas, I figured that we had to visit Battista's again, so we stopped by - with the same friend who was married on our last visit.  As it turned out, none of us really drank (other than to taste the wine that still flows freely).  We found out that it's really pretty bad.  Sure, it is included, but the reason for that is that it's just not very good.

The food portions don't seem to be as large as I remember, though the prices haven't really changed that much.  All-in-all, it brings to mind that old saying "you can't go back again".

I wish we lived closer to this hole in the wall but it's OK, we'll drive here and not complain! This restaurant is so unique and the ambiance cannot be compared to no other establishment in Vegas.

The menu is very limited but it has such a variation that you can definitely choose something to eat. The menu is also placed on the wall. Did I mention free house wine all night? Red and white? Does it taste great? Not really. Could a vineyard survive with this vino product? Hell no. But it's free! Drink up!!

I ate the cannelloni the other night. It has pork in it and it was so good. The waitress set my plate down and red, white, and green were screaming back at me. My food looked like the frickin Italian flag. It was the goddamn Olympics on my plate with that flag waving in my face. I ate an Italian burrito and I loved it!

The boyfriend and I vacationed in Vegas and this place was a must, since it was a usual spot he and his family would dine at while visiting. I couldn't have been more impressed with this place. It took me less than a minute to make reservations online, which came handy later because of their long wait for others once we got there. The atmosphere is great, with a really cool and cute interior. The food here is absolutely delicious, from their salads and garlic bread (best ever), to their entrees, and to their wine and homemade cappuccinos! I will definitely be coming here again.
My favorite italian restaurant I ever ate at! With great company paul kosco. Chicken cacciatore and steak pizziola was to die for and i had to have the meatballs

If you enjoy old school Italian places, this is it. A throw back to the days of the Rat Pack, this place excels at food, service, and atmosphere. The dimly lit atmosphere, accordion player, and true Italian recipes make this place a winner.

I wish I could give negative stars. Had been there multiple times before and had a decent experience but this time it was just BAD.

BAD SERVICE. BAD FOOD. BAD MANAGEMENT.  

So, we order the chicken parm and spaghetti with meatballs. It comes out and my chicken is dry and sauce tastes like they put all the garlic they could find in it so they could cover the can taste. My bfs  meatball was  ice cold in the middle. We both ate about 2 bites then stopped eating and waited for our server. 

And we waited... 
 
And we waited ...

And we waited...

Finally 15 mins later he comes over and brings the check. Didn't even notice that we didn't eat our food until I spoke up and asked for a manager.  He got kind of insulted when I said we had been there multiple times  before and have never had such a bad experience. He got loud and said "Oh so what, the food is just horrible?!" So I responded "well I wouldn't say it that way.. but yes". 

He scoops our $100 off the table with the check then comes back 5 mins later and says "The manager took off your entrees but charged you the cover charge of $13 each. So you got more than half off." Throws down the change and walks away. 

No apology from the server and Manager never even came over. 

We paid $28 (after tax) for food we didn't eat. Which comes down to us basically paying $28 for water and bread since we don't drink alcohol so we don't drink the "free wine"
The food was pretty good, and the prices seemed decent for Vegas.  I had the soup and the seafood pasta.  The best part was the never ending wine and the to-go cups at the end :)

I can't believe I've been missing out on this place for so many years when in town. The staff was incredible and very accommodating. Our party grew just before our reservation time and they still sat us on time with no problem. The garlic bread was quite possibly the greatest garlic bread I've had in my life.. I can't wait to come back!

I went here 03/12/16 I really liked he decor I liked the location which was close to the strip. The menu was really creative which included re and white wine. The food wasn't amazing I had the chicken Alfredo and the sauce wasn't the best. The wine was regular but it went well it's the food. I would go again for the experience but the food wasn't the greatest

Have been coming to this hidden Italian gem of Vegas since I was 15 years old.  Every trip to Vegas includes a dinner at Batista's.  Always enjoy introducing new people to this old school landmark.  Delicious food, good service, quaint entertainment being serenaded table side by accordion.  But this establishment gets 5 stars for ambience, can't be beat.  Closest thing to being at my Grandmas table I can still get.  Manjia!

The ribeye had the smell of  burnt salmon skin, i asked for a rare medium rare, it was medium & dense like a New York steak. Judi ordered the steak pizzaiola, it was more tender and rarer than my ribeye! Judi liked the sauce , I didn't. Cheesecake with strawberries , good.

This is an old time Vegas haunt. The food is great and the decorations are awesome. While I love the food my favorite part is the accordion player who has been there for 22 years. It's convenient to the strip so make the trip!

This is the BEST cappuccino I've ever had. Everything was absolutely delicious!! I had ravioli and he haD lasagna. We shared the soup and salad and both were amazing, ( I loved the salami and cheese in the salad!) wine was house so it was alright but was definitely good enough to not pay extra for! The garlic bread was soaked in garlic-absolutely amaZing! We heard about this place from a local and thankful we did! Soup,salad,  BOTTLE of wine, garlic bread, two entrees and two cappuccinos... $66..nothing better than that.. we are stuffed and have a whole meal basically to take back with us!! 
P.s. There is a little man with an accordion and he's the cutest thing ever, such a nice fun little touch!

Have been to this place many times in the past and it was wonderful. This time we took ten people and it was the worst restaurant I've ever ate at in my life. But sauce was burnt and the veal parmesan  was as thin as cardboard and as hard as a brick. Everyone at our table was very unhappy with their meal. The service was horrible. The only thing that was good was the garlic bread and minestrone soup. Would not recommend this to anyone and will never go back. Oh, the accordion player was awesome.

This place is really good. One of the  best Italian food I've tried. I had the eggplant Parmigiana lasagna and my bf had the chicken fettucini. Both were flavorful.  It comes w/two free house wines (white and red)  and garlic bread! 

My co-worker and his girlfriend recommended this place to me a while ago.  So now,  every time i'm in Vegas with just my boyfriend, this place is a MUST go to place because i'm a fan!

Garlic read had weird texture. I usually LOVE garlic bread, but this was just not good. The menu says NOTHING about the dish, just the name. You have to ask. What the heck is a chicken rio? I was not born knowing this. $13 split plate charge. Super dark to hide the dirt.
We were visiting from Florida and the tour guide recommended this place. We are glad we went because the food was great and ambiance too.

I hate you, Battista. 

Your food is watery and mushy and it made me sick within my first few hours being in Vegas and I had to spend my Friday night in my hotel room. Let me say that again; I was in bed by midnight on a Friday in VEGAS because I felt like an ewok was clawing its way out of my stomach. Blasphemy! I should have been sick from drinking too much tequila out of a stripper's bellybutton but no! You ruined that, Battista. There was no bellybutton tequila for me that night.

I hope you liked the taste of the tears you made me shed. I'm sure they were better than your ravioli and wine that tasted like homeless children had been washing their feet in it.

It was an hour wait so the two of us sat in the bar and Amanda was our server! She gave the best customer service. Definitely coming back here again for our next visit to Vegas! 

Food was great! Cappuccino is a must. Sweet and Delish!

To start we waited almost 10 minutes before our server greeted us... it went downhill from there.  We had a side of meatballs, chicken parm and linguine with chopped clams. The meatballs tasted store bought, chicken was drowning  in a acidic marinara and the linguine with clams was tasteless. The highlight of the meal was was a mediocre minestrone soup and garlic bread. We opted out of the cappuccino since the table next to us said it tasted like hot chocolate. To top it off our server (Rick I think) was preoccupied with everything other than his tables.  It is completely overpriced for the quality....Won't be back

Told i HAVE to try this place from my cousin, I just wish he had suggested reservations.  Got there Sunday night at 7:00 pm and was told by the hostess 25 minutes, my boyfriend, Rick and I both looked at the time and figured 7:25 wont be bad, so we went into the bar for a cocktail.  The hostess said it might even be sooner so when we were called 15 minutes later we were impressed.  
Only to find it wasnt our name and the guy who seats people said "Oh your wayyyyyy down the list"  we went back to the bar area and sipped our cocktails, after 30 minutes they called a party of 3 that came in AFTER us so my boyfriend went up and asked "whats up with that?"  he was told the tables for 3 are different then the tables for 2 so they got to take cuts. REALLY ???    AND she said, you were told it would be 45 minutes for dinner, we both had that deer in the headlights look and said NO we werent, we were told 25 minutes, she said no you werent... I wrote it down,  Let me guess, she is someones daughter or wife that works there because she would not have her job if she wasnt.    
We went back to the bar and attempted to order another drink and after sitting there 10 to 15 minutes, we had to get up to get another one.   
Paid the bar tab ($45.00 for 2 drinks each) and was finally called to our table (after 55 minutes)

We were seated at a table the size for  6 (what happened to the party of 3? I didnt ask)  
Ordered spaghetti and my boyfriend had veal,   Comeone folks - $50 dinner tab for that?  
Save your money - we didnt need the attitude, wait nor food at this place, we wont go there again , nor suggest it ...

Service was great! Had reservations for 5 PM but half of our group was a little late so they accommodated us. They sat us down right away, unlimited wine was amazing!! I ordered the chicken alfredo and it was so delicious including their garlic bread.... omg to die for! Their cappuccino for desert was so good definitely recommend this place in vegas.

Let's start off with the good:

Ambiance and service was good.

The bad:

We had the linguini chopped clams, sausage cacciatore and meat lasagna 

Linguini chopped clams:
Bland bland bland. You can barely taste the clam and it's also very soggy. The serving bowl was also unappealing. It was placed on a stainless steel bowl

Sausage cacciatore:
The sauce itself was ok. A little on the bland side. The sausage was a different story. It has a weird taste. It tasted like they tossed a whole bunch or herbs and hoped for the best. 

Meat lasagna:
Pretty average. Nothing special. Taste like lasagna from other Italian restaurant

The "free" wine is a NO for me. 
It taste like red wine as if it was bought from the dollar store.

Cappuccino was ok I guess. A little on the sweet side.

The price didnt reflect the quality of the food. 
$30 + for overpriced cafeteria tasting Italian food.

I suggest going to bucca di beppo instead.
Where the price justifies the quality of the food.
Amazing restaurant. I had the fettuccine mussels. Mussels were perfectly cooked. I reccomend coming here when you visit Vegas!

I went here for a birthday dinner. The waiter was very helpful and prompt to bring us our endless wine. We quickly ordered and were given our delicious garlic bread and salads (can also get soup). The atmosphere was great but a little too dark making it hard to read the menu and really take in the surroundings. Our food came very quickly and wasn't bad. I expected the food to be a little more than it was but it was tasty. I would have to say that the best part of the meal was the homemade cappuccino you get at the end of the meal. If I could drink that daily I would! Heaven in a cup!

While I cannot complain about the wait staff , this is possibly the worst restaurant in Las Vegas. I ordered the Chicken Rio.  Included was a salad and good garlic bread. The Chicken Rio, not seasoned at all; tasteless, and the vegetables were not warm. Robert Irvine would send it back!  The FREE red wine that is offered is a cheap burgundy, that no one in their right mind would drink.  A regular glass of Pinot Noir was ordered and sent back since it was about 2 shots of horrible wine.  The included cappuccino was not even coffee.  It was obviously the powdered International Coffees from Kraft, with added whipped cream to mask the falseness of the drink. A very unpleasant experience. With the hundreds of restaurants in Las Vegas, this is a major failure.

The food honestly underwhelming. The decorations makes it look like a former Buca Di Beppos turned new restaurant - whether that's true or not...

They offer "free" house wine but, I think it's to make up for the lack of quality in food. If you're used to Olive Garden and you think that's good, then this place might pass your test. BUT if you're looking for good Italian food, skip this one. Food definitely lacked favor!

This used to be my favorite italian restaurant in Las Vegas.  "Used to be" are the key words! 

First off we had to wait for a table for 30 minutes in a half empty restaurant! 

What's that about? Some sort of marketing ploy to make people think they were doing better then they are?

They winded up giving us a tiny booth in the back of the place in a dark corner where we could not even read the menu! Super depressing.

Now, Let's start with the food. 

First off, the bread. YUCK! The place used to give you really good italian bread and now you get cheap supermarket italian bread that is called "garlic bread. It's looks to be greased up with cheap margarine and topped with way too much parmesan cheese to disguise the cheapness of the bread! We had to send it back! It was gross! As the saying goes, you can always tell a meal by the bread!

The next course was the salad. It looked and tasted like it had been sitting for a week. The lettuce was all wilted and brown and they tried to disguise it with extra croutons and (again) that same parmesan cheese. It was one of the worse salads I have had in my life!

For the main course I had eggplant parmesan!  It looked and tasted like 3 day old fried eggplant, and was chewy and flavorless. I wonder if it was fried in canola oil, which is a GMO.
That would explain why it tasted so bad! 

My partner had the chicken parm. It was barely cooked and tasted like cheap fake plastic chicken that you would get in some fast food joint. Definitely not quality food.

We left most of our dinner, paid the $75 bill and walked out. 

It had to be the worse meal we both ever had! And will never return!  

When we got home we both got so sick from the little that we did eat. We believe it may have been food poisoning or way too many GMO's being used in the cheap food!  

The place is not the same!  Something happened to it! Maybe new management, maybe new ownership! They are cutting corners big time! And in the end, it will be this restaurant's demise!

It's a darn shame, because this place is part of Las Vegas nostalgia. They just want to be a tourist trap now. Forget the locals! They want to get them in and don't care if they come back!
Well guess what, not on my dime!
A must stop in Vegas.  The food is very good and comes with a salad and unlimited house wine.  Gordy the according player is entertaining.

I was worried when my party was first seated at Battista's. I was recommended to the place by a co-worker and brought my girlfriend and her parents for dinner after seeing a show. The decor is nice, and clearly vintage. There are dozens of pictures of celebrities on the walls. We were seated in a back room near he kitchen, and quickly started thinking we were forgotten. It took a good 10 or 12 minutes before a waiter approached our table again. I was worried the service would be terrible and we would be there for hours.

I was proven very wrong. As soon as a waiter came to our table we had our bread in seconds, salads and soup maybe 2 minutes later, main course within 10 minutes, and coffee as soon as dinner was done.

The service was so fast I was stunned. Now the food:

I ordered the Chicken Parm, which came with free unlimited house wine (red and white, both quite good), soup or salad (I got the salad, kind of a cross between a regular Italian salad and antipasto; it had lettuce and dressing and olives and also salami and pepperoncini), a pasta side, garlic bread, and cappuccino.

Everything was delicious, and the price was very cheap for being so close to the Strip. I will not go to Vegas again without a stop at Battista's.
The food is absolutely amazing. The environment is charming. Service was great. I recommend making reservations!

This is a great out of the way place, prices are right and you will have leftovers! Plenty of others have left more detail reviews, so I won't go into much more than to say, you simply have to get there and have a little slice of the "non tourist" Vegas life.

old-school italian spot, just off the strip. love it! i always get the lasagna cuz its bomb! every meal comes with a good salad, bomb garlic bread, tasty cappuccino and bottomless wine!!!!

tip for people gettin your drink on ... ask for to-go cups for your water, pour in your leftover wine!! ... your welcome.

Battistas was a lot log fun! All you can drink wine comes with every entree. Must I say more? 

I went there with a large group of friends, however the staff were very attentive and got our food out to is quickly. This is a very interesting restaurant. The menu is on the wall and you get to select the entre you would like. Your entre will come with wine, salad and the entre you've chosen. I decided to go with the eggplant Parmesan.  I hate to say it was just okay, but it was. I was starving so I literally slammed it down. It was just sort of soggy unfortunately. It really wasn't anything special. 

Everyone else seemed to really like their food though. I also think that the ambience and the fact that Battistas is off the strip is for sure a draw. It is also affordable and a nice change of pace of you are visiting the LV strip!

We have been coming to Battista's during every trip to Vegas since we accidentally stumbled upon this place. We took a chance our first trip and waited the 20 minutes to be sat and we are so glad we did. We always make a reservation now but this place is worth waiting if you need to. We LOVE the older gentleman that comes around to play music and every single bite is delicious!! The atmosphere is authentic and their walls are covered in things to look at! 

The ladies who run the front could be a little more pleasant to those who come in with no reservation (or just in general, since they also couldn't seem to be bothered to answer where the restroom was) however, even their attitudes doesn't make this place worth any less than 5 stars. 

A hole in the wall but a treasure!!

I took my first trip to this restaurant a couple of weeks ago and thought it was great. It is a classic place that has been doing things the same way since it has opened. If you are looking for a diet-friendly place, this is probably not the place for you (no gluten free or whole wheat pasta) but if you are just looking for a classic Italian place this is the perfect place. Each meal comes with unlimited wine- red and white, soup or salad, garlic bread, and a cappuccino. The environment is really fun and eclectic and the garlic bread was some of the best I've had. The chicken cacciatore I got was just okay but the sausage pasta my step dad ordered was really delicious as well as the eggplant parmesan. Service is really fast, friendly, efficient, and the prices are reasonable for what you get. You will probably have to wait to get a table but it is a Vegas staple and somewhat hidden secret from what I understand. It is a fun and novel place with classic Italian food. It was a fun night! I would give it 3 stars based on the meal I ordered but the overall spirit of the place gives it an extra star.

Food honestly was mediocre.  I didn't enjoy my meat ravioli. It lacked taste. My bf didn't like his cannoli. The house wine says it's complementary but it honestly wasn't great and probably included in the price of your meal. I would have rather gone to Oliver Garden (which is saying a lot ).
Honestly my favorite Italian food ever!!!! Great quality and the bread and salad is terrific!!! Free wine and reasonable prices!   It's my go to spot every time I come to vegas

I grew up in Las Vegas and have heard about this place for many years. My brother is a huge fan. We had so much hope and expectations. There was an hour wait but it was Saturday so that's expected and we anticipated the food being great so we stuck it out. We were really really disappointed.

Pros: Old school style, big portions, very cool (but busy/tacky) decor, real mob family type motif which was cool. Menu was on the wall and very simple, which is convenient.

Cons: Food. We didn't have a single good dish. Mozz sticks were not hot, and the outside crust was "homemade" but tasted like stale cardboard. The salads were Hurricane Katrina flooded with dressing, I like dressing, but dang the lettuce was floating! The free wine was very watered down, but what do you expect for free? We had Lasagna, one of my favorite dishes at every Italian restaurant, and Ravioli. The sauce is absolutely gross; It tasted like canned tomato paste, and not even the good kind. The sauce was so bad, I only ate about 1/4 of the Lasagna and that was a struggle. The raviolis weren't bad if you scraped off all the tomato paste. A good sauce is like one of the main guarantees you can expect at a good Italian place. For the sauce to be THAT bad, it was just utterly shocking.

We will not be eating here again or giving them another chance. Unless they come out with some sort of press release saying they've completely overhauled their sauce recipe.

Perhaps the WORST "Italian" restaurant in which I've ever eaten.
* Dark and noisy.
* Ridiculously expensive - the cheapest dish was in the neighborhood of $30 AND there's something like a $15 fee for sharing
* Portions are small
* Food is tasteless and uninspiring
* "Wine" that was probably watered down - we joked that it was either a) old grape juice that had fermented slightly, or b) colored water that they showed a picture of a wine bottle to and told it "you're not the wine they want...you're the wine they need"

On the + side:
* the little dude wandering around and playing accordion was hilarious.
* the bread was good

Never going back there again.  This is a hole in the wall that should be spackled over, sanded, painted, and then set on fire to collect the insurance money.  Because that kind of thing NEVER happens in Italian restaurants.

OMG it upsets me that there's not a chain of these restaurants. And unfortunately, I live in the opposite side of the country.

An hour wait on a Wednesday night at 8pm. That shows you how hoppin it is. I had Chicken Parmesan with spaghetti - $28.00 (That came with a side of spinach). The chicken was HUGE!  And for me to carry food home, it must have been big. Before your meal, they serve you you get a choice of soup or salad (I got the salad, yes it was amazing), including the most delicious garlic bread ever (puts olive garden to SHAME), and for dessert included a cappuccino. I'm not a fan of cappuccino's but it tasted just like chocolate milk, I couldn't even taste the coffee-ness.

Like I said, it's unfortunate I live a 5-hour plane ride away. But when I'm back.. I'll be sure to spend money there, again! Next time I'll be smart enough to call in for a reservation.

I guess I should tell you about my service as well, GREAT.

Great food! It's cute and fun. Bottomless wine, too! The only complaint I had was that you couldn't just get something a la carte. You had to get a ton of food in order to get an entree. Otherwise, we had a wonderful time!

I had the server order for me.  He ordered the lasagna.  It was unbelievable.  I loved all the cheese. The sauce had just the sweetness but not too much.

The meal came with soup (minestrone) or an Italian salad (my choice), the garlic bread was nummy, and a cappuccino (which I declined but was made to try).  To top that off, you can have all the wine you can drink.

What did I like the most?  Being serenaded by an 80 something year old accordion player.

I'll definitely come here again.

I have to give it to Battista's. Service outstanding for a party of 28. They were on their A game and everyone had a great time. Food good, all you can eat garlic bread and wine. Oh did I mention wine is Included with the meal? Yep, good deal for our crowd.

This place is pretty good. I went here the 19th. I recommend the ravioli. We ordered a side of meatballs which I didn't care for. The menu is on the wall. If you want to split a plate, be prepared to pay a $14 up-charge. They start you off with either soup or salad and you end the meal with a cuppachino (sp?) which was pretty good. The waitstaff were not overly friendly and a little snippy. It also comes with red and white wine which no one in our party of 4 cared for.

Abundant portions of good food and never ending supply of red and white wine and garlic bread. Can't go wrong. Also this place has got character in excess; an adorable old man plays the accordion and chats with you as he did once with Elvis Presley, Frank Sinatra, and Dean Martin.

If I had to sum up this restaurant in one sentence, it would be...traditional Italian fare in an eclectic setting featuring old time Vegas memorabilia and charm.

But don't come here if you aren't hungry. You will be getting a lot of food!  You will also be leaving with garlic breath.  You have been warned.

 Their all inclusive menu features:

    Minestrone Soup or Italian Salad
    Complimentary House Wine
    Garlic Bread
    Pasta Side
    Homemade Cappuccino

My favorite dish (and only dish I have tried) is the eggplant parmigiana.  It's gooey, garlicy and tasty!

This place is more about its ambiance than the quality of food. We made a reservation and were promptly seated. The restaurant is loud.  The meals include soup or salad, entree, garlic bread, and cappuccino.  Entrees range $23-35. They start you with a soup or salad. The salad is made with romaine and fresh ingredients. They serve it with a creamy Italian dressing. The soup is pasta fagoili and is fresh. 
They bring you warm toasted Italian bread with garlic butter on it. 

I had the lasagna. It is a large portion. It did not taste fresh. I did not like the sauce flavor. The mozzarella cheese on top looked like melted plastic. 

Other people at the table ordered chicken Parmesan and were not impressed by it. 

The cappuccino tasted more like hot chocolate with cinnamon. It was topped with whipped cream. I liked it. 

Each table has privacy. Overall, it is a fun ambiance but not the highest quality food. It's a good place to try at least once. It is next to Bally's and by the high roller ferris wheel.

The worse place I've eve visited in my life l. It was old and dirty inside and the food tasted horrible. Ordered the meet lasagna tasted so acidic and there was about 5 % meet I sent it back. And won't be coming back here and wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

This place was fun.  We were seated a bit later than our reservation after a screw up with their list (which they apologized for).  Food isn't anything to write home about but the value is sure there.  The wine isn't the best but... they give you lots of it.  Overall, it felt like something out of another time and we couldn't help but have a good time with it.  Not fine dining by any stretch of the imagination but lighting fast service, good portions and I certainly ate my portion up so have to say the food was enjoyable too.

Battista's Hole is a tourist trap of the highest order: kitschy and overpriced. 

Prepare to be accosted by an accordion-wielding septuagenarian -- whose limited oeuvre means you'll suffer through the same tunes several times -- while feasting on mediocre food served by a less-than-attentive waiter.

AHHHHHHmazing. Have visited here twice (each time I've been to Vegas) never has disappointed. We all got different meals, lasagna, veal parm and ziti with meat sauce. We all left with happy tummy's. Especially the free wine and cappuccino at the end of the meal

We love Italian food and we were here 8 years and loved the food so we were coming back for seconds. What happened?!? The place was sold to Ceasar's.  Food was bland and dry. The free wine was obviously cheap. 5 dinners cost $155 with no extras. The help was nice but a little unpolished. The old guy playing accordion will wait after he's done playing at your table until you feel uncomfortable so you give him a tip. We noticed we were the only people in there at 6pm. I wonder why. I do not recommend.
Great food, white and red wine included with your dinner. Authentic Italian food. Prices are veru good amout of food is healthy. We are going  back tonight.

This place was 5 stars a few years back, but with the economy in Vegas, there is nothing in this town that is priced right, and while Battista's held out longer than most, their prices have risen with Vegas.  I hate Vegas, but I love Battista's.  Gordy serenades you with his accordion stylings, not as late as he used to, but then again, he's about 90 now.  Anyone complaining about the wine on here can always buy a bottle of what they want, but when a place gives you free table wine, I put away my wine snob nose and drink it, and it's not bad at all.  I've paid decent money for wines I've liked less.  The vibe is old Vegas, pictures of celebrities from the Rat Pack days and beyond.  The food is good, very good.  Not Food Channel Celebrity Chef Italian, which most pretentious Vegas posers desire, but good italian food.  You do not leave here hungry.  The garlic bread, soup, salad, all the free sides are good, once again, if you are going to criticize the comps, don't eat them, get something else.  It used to be perfectly priced but the prices have gone up or they would get 5 stars.  This is a place to go if you happen to find yourself in the city of posers and wannabe's.

We recently got married in Las Vegas and we were looking all over for the perfect place to bring our guests.  My fianc saw Bautista's and I told her that I had eaten there before. and it was amazing. Well they did not disappoint.  I believe Kerry was the head server there and the staff was absolutely spectacular!  I couldn't believe how  together they kept everything in spite of the fact that the restaurant was completely packed beyond belief.  

Kudos to Bautista's and their professionalism, quality food and environment! Thank you for the wonderful wedding dinner!

Highly recommend Battista's for big parties.

A side note:

The man who played the Italian wedding song on accordion for us at our table, made our experience so lovely.

Well it is average at best do you get a ton of food and unlimited liquor yes if that's what your looking for this is the place for you.  I personally would rather have one good glass of wine over a gallon of the cheapest watered down wine I have ever had. The food was ok for the price I guess it was good but I would rather spend s little more and get great food

Man this place was awesome. It's cliche but sometimes you want to get away from the facade of the strip and enjoy a good family meal and Battista's nailed it. They made substitutions without a hesitation, they were quick and attentive with their service and the food was great. I could come here every week if I didn't live 2000 miles away, I'd weigh a metric ton from all the food but I'd be happy and well taken care of. Bravo! Battista's, BRAVO!

Yes, it's "all-you-can drink."  But $28 for pasta?  Really?  The food is decent at best, atmosphere is cool though.  Personally I'd rather buy a $2 bottle of wine and head to Fazoli's before eating here again.

Free wine, bread and a cappuccino with ANY meal here. Had the ziti with meat sauce which was a larger portion than what I needed since they're start you off with your choice of salad and soup so I took left overs home. The ambiance is great. The service was awesome. Happy we explored and found this gem :)

It's a true hole in the wall, that's for sure, but you must check it out!
Really great Italian dinners with all you can drink wines, and it even includes dessert and a cappuccino. How are they even making money on that kind of deal! If you go, prepare to stuff yourself with great food and a great time!
We have been coming to BHIW for years. Love the portion size, unlimited wine, and especially the atmosphere. Just a great place to experience, especially as a family.

I swore I wouldn't overeat tonight!  And I managed to pull it off, thanks to the clam linguine.  We love this place.  Just remember to make reservations....you'll be glad you did.  Dinner is a production, so allow plenty of time.

I can't even give this place one star. But need to in order to post. Their Italian salad consist of one tomato, one olive, one slice of salami it only filled the bowl 1/2 way. The garlic bread was soggy. The manicotti was so so and the red sauce was like opening a jar of Prego   And their cappuccino tasted like hot chocolate with a little bit of coffee. Don't waste your time and money on this place.
My father  brought me here when I was a little girl. Loved it then love it more now. I can appreciate the endless wine.... food a little salty but oh so good... the Italian servers are to funny..
This place is the bomb!  I also got bonus points in a scavenger hunt for writing this amazing review!

The first time I went I was very satisfied. The second time I went it seemed that the prices had been raised and it just wasn't as good as I remembered it being. The atmosphere is cool, but the menu is kind of pricey considering the service and the food. The best part about it all is the wine carafe that is 'free with dinner' so I don't know if you can really call it free or not. The old guy with the accordion is a really great scam, he pretends he's going to play a whole song for you but never actually finishes one and the proceeds to linger for his tip. The second time I used the 'no eye contact' strategy so that he wouldn't come bothering my table for money. Everyone pretended to be busy or on the phone!

This is a classic piece of Old Vegas history. It is Old family style Italian restaurant . The food is very good. THEY MAY NEED A NO PRUDES ALLOWED sign but, it is a can't miss place to eat The Sausage Cacciatore is to die for. When Gordy is singing and playing the Accordion,  he takes it to a NEW LEVEL!! 
 Save your money and avoid the overpriced hype of a Guy place. Relax with family and friends at Battistas.  You'll be glad you did.

It's ok. I was referred by a local.  The unlimited wine was nice but the food was ok.  I don't care about how much free stuff I get but the food has to be good.  The cappuccino was excellent but the food was mediocre.

It is hard to review this restaurant without shedding a tear.   I first visited Battista's around 1978.  It was fantastic experience.  Deserved six stars.  That was "before" it became a tourist attraction.  In the early days only the "locals" knew and supported Bassista's.  Battista himself was there as well as some of his family.  An entertainer would come by and tell "very naughty" and also very funny jokes with an Italian flair.  Unlimited wine was also served for one price per person.  The last time I visited was back around 2003.  I was with a very savvy business woman and we ended up in one of the back unused rooms and spoke to several of the original (or close to original) employees.  While Battista's remains an over good place for many - unless you visited them before they expanded decades ago, you'll never know what you are missing.  It wasn't just a good meal, it was an experience.
Always a family favorite and can't visit Vegas without grabbing dinner. Service, atmosphere and food always on point. The wine, bread and extra added cuppacino for dessert are delicious.

Very traditional Italian place with limited parking outside of the strip. I felt like Al Capone was dining somewhere in a private room making illicit Vegas type deals. We were sold by the unlimited house wine (red and white and very good for cheap wine).  Overall, I am not into this type of food because big heavy portions don't do it for me. Each meal comes with a minestrone soup (so good) or a salad; your entree; and a cappuccino (tasted like watered down hot chocolate) for dessert.  Like I said, this is not my cup of tea but if you like to eat A LOT and enjoy Buca Di Beppo style dining this is for you.
Amazing! Best Italian food ever. Great service and ambiance too. I highly recommend everyone try it when they come to Vegas. It has been my family's tradition for years.

This is a great restaurant to go to with a big group of people and have a good time. I recently went to Battista's with my family while we were all visiting Vegas. My step-dad loves this place and always raves about it. The food is good, but nothing amazing. The only thing I don't like are the massive portions and the $20+ per dish pricing. The free wine and bread is nice. Also, Love the little old man playing accordian. Funny guy and he can probably play anything you ask on the accordian. For us, since we are all from Indiana, he played "Back home again in Indiana" which if you know anything about the Indy 500 or Indiana, is a little piece of Hoosier tradition. Cracks me up that my step dad said he has been coming to Vegas for probably 25-30 years and it is the same little old guy playing accordian.

One of the places I have to go to whenever we're in Vegas.  I've been telling everyone how much we like coming here.  The atmosphere, food, wine and the acordian dude.  OMG always a fun night.  This time had the shrimp scampi. Fantastic!!!  Finish with the BATTISTAS Cappuccino and what great dinner.

We are locals and had some family in town. We took them to Battista's and our guests haven't stopped talking about it. The food was AMAZING!!!! The chef personally came out to go over the menu and even checked on us afterwards. The staff was friendly and so helpful! Definitely made a lasting impression on us. Amazing!!!!! Thank you!!!!!!

I've been here a half dozen times over the past decade. I don't know if it's my nostalgia, but I seem to remember this place having standard Italian fare. Now it is just plain bad. The red sauce they use on everything is uninspired, the pasta is cold by the time it gets to you, and the quality of meats is low. I am not a wine snob, but it is not even at 3 Buck Chuck level. I don't see myself returning again.

Vegas sucks in 2015.. it really does. I love vegas, but its changed. Battista's still gives me that old vegas feeling. I feel young again everytime i walk through the doors. I've been to this restaurant at least 10 times and every time i'm there it makes me feel so awesome. The Veal Parm is freaking amazing.

Great place to look around and see all the autographed pictures, but that is it. They had the heat cranked up so I high I was sweating. The food was subpar and a big let down for the amount of money you are spending. The Italian salad was over saturated with dressing and the lettuce was drowning. The lasagna was a nice size portion but was not anything special. The cappuccino tasted like nestquick out of powdered mix. I would not dine here again.

We were looking for a place to go for a large group of about 11-12 people, and something different. This is a cool little place with a really unique decor and vibe. We sat in a back room next to another large group, but it wasn't cramped. 
The menu and ordering system is a little confusing. Supposedly it's family style, with large plates, but then we were told the plates would really only feed about 2 people so we should order one thing for every two people in the group. But there was something about a minimum order charge or split plate charge -- I can't remember but it wasn't explained to us very well. 
Either way, the salads and soups were good (each person gets their choice of one or the other), and the food was good too. Nothing spectacular and nothing stood out enough for me to remember specifically, but it was good enough to please a crowd. Probably the best part was the "Cappucino," which was really more like a hot chocolate than anything else. If you're looking for a unique experience, this is a good, "different" place to go that's not typical Vegas.

Skip it skip it skip it!!!!  The decor is frightening. There was literally a bus tub and bucket attached to the ceiling right above our table clearly not part of the decor but there to catch leaks in the ceiling. Salad was a soggy pre-made mess, garlic bread was meh and the wine was warm and absolutely not drinkable!  The manicotti was dry and flavorless. We overheard the waiter tell the table beside us that the cappuccino was not really cappuccino. When we received ours I ask him how it was made. He told me it was coffee syrup, powdered milk and water and they boil it all day. Delicious... NOT!!!!  And what is up with the plastic plates, cups and mugs??  It was like I was dining in a cafeteria. Waaaaayyyyyy over priced!!!  Tourist trap for sure.  Never ever recommend!

Casual setting with good homestyle Italian. I'm a huge Italian food lover, and this place is good. I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever had. I had the veal parmesan with the usual bread, salad and wine. The wine wasn't very tasty. The meals in my opinion are a little over priced, but they do give you a large sized portion. It's a great place for large groups of people or just for a good Italian atmosphere. There is an 90yr old man that walks around entertaining people for about 30 seconds with an accordion and he sings. If he's done, he's expecting a tip.

Highlight of my Vegas trip! I've been trying to get here for a long time! Sorry it took so long! This place was amazingly! The atmosphere was incredible! Loved the service and the menu and the food was delicious! Portions are huge and wine and cappuccino served with all meals (even though I don't drink either) fun place to go! And there was an accordion player who played for us at our table who has been there for over 35 years! He was great!!!!

Loved the little older gentleman with the accordion! He went around each table and did a little diddy. White and red wine come with your meal automatically. Menus are on the wall. It's a cute nostalgic place. I was kind of disappointed with my linguine and white clam dinner. Too much green spice (parsley?) and definitely lacking garlic. The soup also could've been hotter as it was just warm. Good time, not great food.

This place is a step back to 1977 and for a really good meal at very reasonable prices it rocks. Very attentive and very knowledgable service. The prix fixe menu that includes highly drinkable red or white wine is great. If you want to see 70's celeb pics EVERYWHERE (99% of whom are deceased) and feel like it's the 70's again go check it out. A very professionally and well run spot. And fun. ***Great for large parties at the last minute!!*** as that's what we did and it was a blast.

I love this place! Old world Italian food. Try the fettuccini Alfredo. It's one of the best. All you can eat homemade garlic bread, soup or salad, house wine abs cappuccino included with every meal. Plus the cute accordion player is a hoot!

I was skeptical when my husband chose this place for dinner on our recent trip to Vegas.  The free salad, bread, cappuccino and wine struck me as a quantity-over-quality gimmick.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The wine isn't winning any contests, but is drinkable.  The salad was lightly dressed and crisp.  The bread was fresh-baked and tasted of yeast and garlic.  The lasagna I ordered wasn't the best I've ever had--noodles were overlooked, but the filling was delightful.  We loved the dark, dusky atmosphere, and appreciated the attentive service.  We would certainly go back.
One of the best restaurants in Vegas. You can't beat delicious Italian food, all you can drink wine and the best cappuccinos. It gets really busy so earlier is better.

Seriously, I'm not sure how anyone could give this restaurant anything higher then 2 stars. If they did, they should get out more often. Here's the thing, if this place was in a little town in the middle of nowhere, I'd say okay but it's just off the strip in Vegas. The culinary capital of the world people. There are at least 100 superb restaurants within a mile radius, so WHY would you ever go here??? lol but people do and my guess is, they're tourists and they don't know any better. I can pretty much guarantee if you are a local you would never ever choose to go here! 
The place was packed! We had to wait over an hour, which didn't bother me because there was plenty of seating. The atmosphere is kinda cool but there are plenty of restaurants with that type of atmosphere/decor. The service was not very good. My friends raviolis came out ice cold. I had the chicken parmigiana, it was okay, kinda bland - nothing special. The "free wine" (I use the term free very loosely since I paid $28 for a piece of chicken - I'm sure the price of that nasty free wine was compensated for with the overpriced piece of chicken) was disgusting....the red smelled and tasted like red wine vinegar and the white wine was warm - yes white wine warm!? There was spinach that accompanied my chicken that as soon as I took a bite I wanted to spit out....but of course didn't. It was the most disgusting thing I've ever tasted. I sat and tried to figure out this distinct (overwhelming) flavor in the spinach and when the server came over I asked her if anise was in the spinach. She looked at me in surprise and said you're the only person that has ever guessed what's in that. She said people either love it or they tell her to get it off their plate. I'm guessing the former group is a small group, so I'm wondering why they serve it? Oh gawd it was gross. Black licorice flavored mushy over cooked spinach.....not my idea of good food. Sorry but if you're planning on going, I'd say go across the street to McDonald's and save yourself some money......seriously! 
BTW - there were a group of Italian speaking guys behind us that got their food as we were leaving......gawd I wish I could have seen their face when they bit into that "Italian" food!!

We went here for my friends bachelor party. We were all very unimpressed. If you are from the east coast or from an Italian family you will not like this place. We all liked our salds and soup but after that it was all down hill. The meals were very plain and one step below an Oliver Garden. They give you free wine but it was super watered down. You also get a cappuccino which is nothing more then a hot chocolate. Also the place itself has a very old and  smells  like an old attic. The meal is very over price for what you get.

Not recommended. Noodles under cooked and stuck together. For $27 per plate your better off going to Olive Garden and Olive Garden will taste better and cheaper. 

Kids said food tasted like store bought frozen food, not authentic. Not enough of the free wine is worth the experience.

Just.... not great. Tired classics. The food tasted like it had been sitting out for awhile- the bread/soup/salad. White wine- Warm. Just.... nothing I'd come back again for. So disappointed. :( 

Casa di amore is way better.

Amazing is all I can say! From the wine served with the meal, the cappachino for dessert and the quality of the food.  Not to forget the entertainment provided by Gordy and his accordion.  He knows every college fight song out there, just ask him!

The food lacked flavor! I had lasagna and honestly, Trader Joes frozen lasagna is much much better. My companion had spaghetti and meatballs and said it was lacking flavor as well. The garlic bread was quite tasty! The service was excellent and the staff was very nice. If you need pre-drinking carbs for a reasonable price it's ok, but don't go here for flavorful food.

Love it. Been coming to the Hole in the Wall for years!. The free flowing house wine is great!

This great local spot is so comfortable in its skin, no pretense, no bravado .... Just a great atmosphere, solid service and good comfortable food. 

Expect a wait most nites, but grab a seat in the bar and get some wine and great starters. 

Oh..... Come hungry!
Amazing food. Recommend the chicken rio. Best thing on menu. Free wine wasn't great...but hey! It was free! Will return every time I visit vegas.

Fantastic food and good times sums up our experience at Hole in the Wall. I can see myself returning here when we come to Vegas in the future.  Prices are good for what you get so a thumbs up for value and the free wine is a win and nice bonus.  Kids options are good here and I was a fan of their main dishes, ordered spaghetti with Cacciatore sauce (a little spicy), wife got the pomodoro, kid got the spaghetti with meatballs. The add ons were wonderful. The garlic bread was great, the minestrone was solid, and salad was fantastic as well. Their salad dressing is tasty and we'll balanced.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The cappuccino was a nice touch and ending to a very delicious and wonderful experience overall.

Parking was easy enough, and their staff was great and kind. Right next to The High Roller which is also a highly recommended attraction in Vegas.

4.777 stars rounded down which can easily become a solid 5 with another visit.  Thanks guys!

This place is absolutely fabulous! Old school Italian eatery with excellent old school ambiance. The food and service are equally impressive. The food portions are very generous so be prepared to leave with leftovers. I have already been there three times in the past month and look forward to going there again soon.

I would give this place an extra half star for the memorabilia if I could.

This place is classic old Italian.  It has a half barrel for a front door and no windows that I could see.  It is a little dark and all the walls are lined with classic photos of mid-century movie stars, movers and shakers, et cetera..
I didn't know who everybody was but these walls are definitely preserving unique Vegas history.

The food is solid Italian with four prix fixed menus to choose from that all offer all you can drink wine, soup or salad, and a cappuccino to end your meal properly.  

The service was excellent and I thought the 20-30 dollar a person price with all that it included was a good value.

In many of my reviews I say I am always looking for a great "hole in the wall" place... well, this is the first time I have actually found one with that in the name! I was not disappointed to say the least, upon entering two things hit me; the amazing aroma that made my stomach say "oh yeah" and the cool atmosphere with all of the "stuff" everywhere.

I grabbed a drink at the bar while waiting for the rest of my dinner party and kept looking for someone from the old "rat pack" to sit next to me... The energy inside this place was upbeat and energetic, the evening was starting well.

When the rest of my dinner attendees arrived we were seated and great service followed the entire night.  The food was good and if you are hungry this is the place to go as the portions were a very good size. The table receives house wine at no charge along with bread, the menu is on the wall and it's seems to be a pretty good value for the service, atmosphere and quality of food.

They finish your meal off by bringing you a coffee on the house as well. I had a great time and would recommend if you are in Vegas to definitely swing by for a meal.

Nice and dark, old school, with the smell of garlic bread, 
and a mishmash kitschy decor of a Chotchkie's apron with flair, 
the place is oddly perfect for a romantic date night, 
a family dinner that pleases everyone, 
or a raucous party (the endless wine helps). 

The portions are huge and yummy.  
My lasagna was so cheesy it was like queso fundino with sauce.  
My wife's cannelloni was a bucket of fresh ricotta wrapped in a pasta blanket. 
 My sister's sausage (wasn't that a CBS show?) was yum.  
We ate for a long time and it looked like we never started.  
Make sure your room has a fridge.  
And we ended up with uneaten garlic bread.  
Who doesn't finish off a basket of garlic bread?  
I mean, besides the Lost Boys. 

Oh, and personally I'm glad the endless wine isn't super awesome wine. 
I don't like wine, but this stuff was slightly watery and slightly flat 
so I was able to throw it down.

Hey, here comes Gordy, the accordion player!  
He's like a mariachi band only it's one guy, I understand the words, 
and I don't shrink in my seat when he comes by.  
Keep a fiver in your pocket to give him - 
the guy will need a second hip soon.

The service is great, too.  I didn't like much my minestrone soup. 
 It had, like, every vegetable in it.  
I could point out so many it was like a Richard Scarry book.  
So I asked if I could get the salad (mmm with a slice of salami) instead.  
"No problem!"   
Can we get more garlic bread?  
"Sure, please make room for a shoebox size basket of garlic bread".  
Hey, since this wine is endless, can I leave my car here?  
"Please do.  Would you like us to fill it with garlic bread?"
