Anybody under 30 should probably forget about coming to this place they don't know too much. I am not an elite yelper so I don't meet the criteria for kissing butt. But I know good food.

Night of visit: November 23, 2013- I MUST CONFESS, I AM NOT A BIG FAN OF ITALIAN FOOD-BUT, WITH THAT SAID, I KNOW THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN GOOD, BAD AND UGLY.  I am a local looking for favorite little places to put on a 'go to' list when I want a night off the Strip.
ATMOSPHERE: Great, Old Vegas Feel....had me with eager hopes for good food to match....SIGH....
SERVICE: average - with many 'points to the MENU on the wall'.
FOOD: Ok, the menu on the wall brags of 'Free wine (white or red)', 'free soup or salad', 'free garlic bread', 'free sugar/syrup cappuccino' -ALL of this "free with your meal".  
The Lowest meal is $21.00 --this for a plate of pasta, sauce and two hard little meatballs.  Humm,  think we are really paying for all this crap.  I'm blonde but not stupid.
OK, IF the food was GOOD-I would pay twice the price for all that 'free stuff'.  But, I think I could get better pasta at one of the cheapest Buffets in town.  The spaghetti and meatball dinner was bad, but the eggplant parm was like a Banquet frozen dinner and I think $24.  hahaha   How do you spell RAGU?  
The wine is watered down cheap red, which I expected.
The garlic bread, was not toasted, but warm and dried out like it sat around in the oven and turned to hard crumbs.
Soup, canned.  Salad, blah. 
I am  totally shocked to see the high stars and great ratings for food.  I guess pasta lovers ...just plain love pasta, no matter how crappy?
Another place X'd off my 'restaurants to try list'.

This place is awesome, some of the best hearty Italian food I have ever had and I love the ambiance of this little old place next to the big, glitzy strip.  Definitely a change of pace with a lot of cool memorabilia.  It is Reasonably priced.  Although it may not look like a five star restaurant, it reminds us of a simpler, smaller Las Vegas.  It is one of the few remaining remnants of the old days.  I'm not a wine connoisseur so I'm really happy with the free, all you can drink, take some home with you, wine that they offer with your meal.  We stop there any time we stay in Vegas ever since the first time we tried Battista's.

Brought my girl here and we were impressed. It is a hole in the wall and it has a good vibe. Food was delicious. They don't make pretty on your plate. They make flavorful food and figure you can go to a casino if you want presentation. House wine was good and all you can drink. Nice!

old Vegas dining experience, love this place for Italian. had the chicken par and creamed spinach, great as usual. great service, complimentary wine and garlic bread. flying fingers comes by and takes request, played The Tango.

The food is pretty average italian, but good.

The all you can drink wine is what makes it worth the price, so I'd pass if you're not planning on drinking.

The old accordian player is pretty sweet as well.

Wanting to carbo load before the night on the strip ? Stop here, you will definitely get your carbs for the weekend! The bread was amazing and the portions are massive! The wine was just bad, you get unlimited wine so maybe that's why its so awful? I would just recommend staying away from that. 

It was great not having to make a reservation and getting seated fairly quickly. The atmosphere is cool, the staff was all very friendly and the food came out quickly. Don't come here for very authentic 5 star food but if your just looking for decent pasta and great service, you'll enjoy it.

It's nice to know that places like this still exist. It's really a throwback experience and an original one at that. Set aside the food and the menu for a second and you still have a terrific vibe. I haven't seen a live polka with accordion since hector was a pup! I could walk around this place for hours just admiring the photos and history. I imagine that this place has stories that would make the Vegas Stories Hall Of Fame!
   We came in with a party of 8 and I think this is THE place for a group. The menu is all inclusive. The price on the board includes a main course, an appetizer, a side salad or soup, dessert and red or white wine. You're not going to leave with an empty stomach! Once your seated and comfortable, I suggest you start looking around. There's local memorabilia from floor to ceiling. It's worth walking around the halls, just to catch a couple "oohs" and "aahs"!
   We eventually put in our order and the meal started to unfold course by course. The carafe of wine and garlic bread came first and the table got instantly happy. The bread was warm and delicious and with the red wine flowing, the mood started to really lighten up. The salad came out and we started to nosh even more and talk less. It was a standard Italian salad with big chunks of salami. It tasted great and to have garlic bread with Italian salad is an amazing start to a meal. The bread, salad and wine and company were all part of a joyful experience. This polka guy came by and gave us a happy medley to lift our spirits even higher. 
  I order the chicken parm and when it arrived it was cooked through with the texture remaining crisply while the cheese and sauce was still sizzling from the oven. The side of pasta was standard with a simple red sauce. I'm really happy with my choice and even happier with the location and the experience we had. I was treated like family by all the wonderful people at Battista's. If you want an original or non cookie cutter meal, this is it! It's truly one of a kind!

Despite showing up on Valentine's Day without a reservation, we were seated promptly.  Very cheerful staff and always excellent food!  One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas!!!!   Pricey, but worth it!

I feel so sorry for people that come here as a tourist or with out of town guests.  Folks, this is as bad as it gets.  

Living in Las Vegas I can deal with having a crappy restaurant experience and paying too much because sometimes you just don't know or have a choice.  Unfortunately, I had never been here and had a couple of out of town guests who googled Italian food on their phone and this one popped up and was close to their hotel.

I tried to steer them away from this place as restaurants on or near the strip are usually incredibly overpriced and the food is usually at best mediocre.   Well my attempt at steering them to a known commodity did not work.

Battista's it was.

I'm not going to get into details on this place as they have been discussed ad nauseum on Yelp.

The food in this place is not only unpalatable but is probably dangerous.  Chemical tasting food that I can picture being cooked up in large tubs in the back is what this place serves.

The 'wine' they serve is not quite up to the same quality someone on food stamps would buy to use as cooking wine.  Don't get me wrong I don't mind cheap wine but this stuff was not fit to be consumed by humans.

To top it all off they serve a Nescafe Corn Syrupy type chocolate drink at the end.

This place has a cozy ambiance according to other review but that's where the positives end.  This place preys on unsuspecting tourists who don't know any better until it's too late.  I can't imagine anyone ever going back to this place.

This place treats its customers like cattle, well, maybe worse actually.  They could care less about your experience and possible return business since they are located in a spot that see's a few million new visitors each year.  This restaurant wouldn't last 3 months in another city that must rely on return customers and positive word of mouth.

Please people do not go to this awful place with these awful people.  This restaurant represents everything that is wrong with the Las Vegas dining scene.

I liked it Free unlimited wine with dinner, great garlic bread,salad was very good,entree (chicken parm) was good not the best but not bad. Dark inside,comfortable atmosphere.Decent price.Will go back.

I have been wanting to try this place for years.  Each time we visit Vegas. It did not disappoint.  The food was amazing.  You will not leave hungry at all.  One the wine is included and is completely unlimited.  The salad was a really nice salad. Not the lettuce tomato cucumber you get in most places.  This thing was loaded. We were full from that and wine.  Luckily this is not a place that rushes you.  They encourage you to relax and enjoy your meal. I had the veal picante and he had the lasagna.  Boy was it authentic and amazing! And the cappuccino at the end was just what I needed! I highly recommend this place for any Italian food lovers. We will be back.

*** spoiled New Yorkers review*** were used to affordable delicious Italian food where we're from. This place is horrendous. The prices are obscene for the quality of food. Our table of 5 unanimously did not eat our entrees and decided it was the worst Italian we have ever had. We told the waitress we didn't enjoy our food and she ignored us. No apology or any acknowledgement. Highlights= "free" wine and cappuccino. The cappuccino taste like hot chocolate with a hint of coffee. Best thing we had all night.
Food was Great! Really tasted like old school Italian.

Love. Love. Love this place! Been to Vegas plenty of times and this was our first time to try. We had the Lasagna, awesome!!! Wine is included with dinner (Red AND White), so be prepared to drink! The bread was so hot, delicious and homemade. We had soup and salad, also delicious! The cappuccino, which is also included with dinner was the best I have ever had! Don't let the name fool you, this is a very authentic Italian place with a great old school personality. Reminds me of "old Vegas", a place The Rat Pack probably frequented. We will be back!!! As I can't wait to try other dishes.

Walked back in time when we entered this place. Obviously it was the go-to place back in its heyday. Nostalgia galore with prominent and proud photos of many of the stars through the years. 

I'm not sure you're really coming here for the food but it's all in all decent and not too hard on the pocketbook for a night out in Vegas. 

We had Chicken Rio, lasagna and cannelloni. No one could finish our meals. The table wine that comes with your meal isn't 90point wine but decent enough with dinner.

Seriously, awesome find. If you ride the monorail at all, you've probably passed the huge Battista's sign next to the Westin Casuarina. Follow the sign and find your way into a charming and romantic side of old Vegas. 

The food is decent. I've had better. I've had worse. The wine is what you would expect unlimited house wine to taste like. Having said that, for twenty something dollars, you can have garlic bread, salad (or Minestrone if you're not into the greens), a heaping bowl of pasta, and cappuccino that sort of tastes like maple syrup infused with chocolate (in an absolutely incredible way). Did I mention the unlimited wine part? You can drink loads and loads of wine here - it's light, and refreshing, and though it's not the best tasting, you get used to it. This place is about an incredible experience. It's about taking a breath of fresh air and enjoying a slow and luxurious dinner, filled with wine and a musician who will come to your table and play you a song (he did a rendition of California - like the older song, not the one from the O.C.). It's not just a dinner - it's an experience - one you'll come away loving. And as a bonus, you may not need to pay for food for another 24 hours because you will be stuffed!

Bonus - two separate people told us we were a cute couple. That's right, people went out of there way to be very nice for absolutely no reason other than to be nice. People are warm, the place is warm, with a decorated ceiling that makes you feel like you're in a real Italian home.

I've lived in Las Vegas since 1990. This was my first time going to this restaurant tonight.  The place was nice on the inside but the quality of the food for the price was terrible. You only got one choice of soup which came to me luke warm. Then the main course steak pasta meal was very bland. Steak wasn't seasoned and the meal itself tasted like nothing. Then they give you a cappochino that has no espresso or coffee content.  To rub it in my face in the end it came to over $70. Olive garden isn't authentic Italian but if you want better quality food I suggest going there or any other Italian place. I wasn't the only one that complained that night. A couple across from us asked to speak to the chef about the food. Don't understand how they lasted for so long but they have definitely lost there way since it first opened. You know the celebrities wouldn't eat this garbage.

Worst Italian food ever. Sauces were bland and overcooked. Same for vegetables in pasta dishes. Salad ok. Garlic bread was so oily. High point is cappuccino. Sent back uneaten sausage cacciatore. No offer by restaurant to deduct or substitute meal.

Reasonably priced fare delivered quick and hot. Plenty of food - not the best Italian I've ever had but still delicious. Atmosphere is worth the visit alone. Menu on the wall, lots of decorations and plenty of entertainment.

This restaurant is the epitome of a hole in the wall, a place you would never think to stop by but is quite a find. To keep it simple, the food is amazing, the prices are right, and the service is excellent. We stepped in, as it was a minute walk from our hotel, and we were all glad we did. As a family of five and knowing their portions were large we got three dinners and passed them around. The lasagna, ravioli, and sausage and peppers were all delicious. Along with the meal you get bottomless red and white wine, salad or soup, and homemade cappuccinos. 
The environment is very homey and the service topped it off to make the experience memorable. If you're in the mood for some traditional Italian food, I would definitely recommend you check out this hole in the wall.

The big draw here is the cheap unlimited free wine!  The food was panned food sitting around for a long time. 

It's a one hit wonder. Don't expect anything too flavorful. If you're a Foodie, don't expect you'll make a second trip here. This is a place where you'd find your frugal grandparents at.

The seating flow at this restaurant is unexplained like Area 51, place looks empty but there's a long wait. I suspect it's the people lounging around drinking the free wine after dinner. Move along folks, people are waiting!

This is one of those real hole in the wall places where you see it and think I wonder if it is any good. Well we have gone here for years! Even when on vacation, not far off the strip just behind flamingo or right across the street from Bally's side of their casino just off flamingo.

I bet back in the day this place was the place to go, you will see  old pictures on the walls. 

When seated you will see The menu is posted up on the wall and is pretty straightforward and  easy to understand. Now how neat is that?
You get unlimited red or white wine. Plus a house salad or minestrone soup and garlic bread. When you choose your entree there are about 5 different price levels ranging from $22 to $40 ~  example spaghetti and meatballs to a steak.One thing nice if you don't order a pasta dish you get a side of penne with marinara sauce. 
You also will get a cup of cappuccino. For the amount of food and drink involved and the quality, it's a pretty good deal for your money. Especially unlimited wine!

Funny story took a friend there and he loves Italian food. Well he also loves wine and loves good Italian bread. He kept drinking and eating tons of bread(The bread is so good!). By the time we were done eating he was so full could barely walk, I think the bread expanded with the wine making him even fuller! He went back to the room and had to lay down for hours! 

Over all this place has been here for years that tells you something! If you like Italian food try this place out. Or if you want to see a piece of old classic Vegas which is disappearing go here

And as a added plus a elderly man walks around with the accordion and serenades the tables. He plays some things by request.  Its a nice added touch ~ if you see him make sure to tip..
Overall its a old favorite of ours ~ One of the first restaurants we ate at when we first came to Vegas! Check it out we highly recommend it! 
And before going  make reservations just to guarantee to get a seat they get pretty busy sometimes. 
I hope this restaurant is here for many more years!!

This was recommended by our PinkJeep tour guide as we went past the restaurant on the way out to Red Rock. He told us about the neat interior and the history behind the restaurant. We decided to make reservations for our last night in Las Vegas. He was spot on in his recommendation. It was a good thing we made reservations as they were solidly booked and had people waiting. The interior walls are filled with pictures of famous people, some signed and some not. Menu was  on a board by the table. Included in the meal is garlic bread(fantastic), soup or salad, white and/or red wine(a carafe of each), the main entree and a cappuccino at the end. Portions were enormous, but authentic. We were so glad we checked it out. I think it will be one of our must dos when we visit Vegas!

Great food.  For the price that you're paying and the quality of presentation, as well as the taste... Maaaan it is worth coming to at least try this place out.   

If you're a Las Vegas native, then you've probably eaten at this place at least once.  If you haven't and you are a LV-native, the "what the hell are you waiting for?!"  It's been around for a long time and usually when an establishment lasts a long time, especially a restaurant, it's because people actually care about the establishment.  

My wife had the Seafood Fettuccine and I had the Sausage Cacciatore with an order of meatballs (we love Meatballs).  All was great.  We were welcomed with the house White and Red wine (it was free by the way).  Garlic bread was good and we both chose the salad.  

The main course took a while to prepare and the waiter was not very friendly.  Hence I gave the place a 4 star, instead of 5.  If this place had a drive-thru, then I'd probably give it a 5 star.

I love this place the service is great and the food is amazing and you cant beat unlimited house wine with your meal. I have almost tried everything on the menu now and so far have not found something i didnt like.

Beware humans the food served at this place is not meant to be digested! The wine is rubbing alcohol w food colorant.  The pasta tasted like something canned and mass produced in order to exterminate the human race.  I dont think they even dust and sweep!  Save the $27 and ur intestines!!

Overall we found the place economical but the food and service were lacking.  And the accordian guy who comes around we first thought was charming until he harassed us repeatedly for a tip (even tough we didn't ask him to play)

Contrary to popular belief, there are actually 8 deadly sins.  What is the 8th deadly sin, you may ask?  Coming to Vegas without popping into Hole in the Wall.  You go to Vegas without coming here and it might as well be a wash.  I don't care how much money you won or what show you went to.  You have to come here for dinner.

Hole in the Wall is a Vegas staple.  Been here for years.  How many?  Not sure, look it up.

Comfy intimate Italian restaurant close to everything, serving up pasta and meat classics.  The menu is on the wall, and there is nothing I could not recommend.  Anything will fill your belly up with love and comfort.  Although, the veal is phenomenal.  Poor little baby cow is a tasty little bugger.

All meals come with the famous unlimited white and red wine, bread, and soup or salad.  I switch it up between soup and salad.  I'm a gambler.

And when you are done gorging on your Italian feast, complimentary cappuccino.  SUPER sweet, piled high with fresh whipped cream to wash away the red sauce and pasta and cheese (so much cheese), and whatever else you may have stuffed in your  mouth.

And the cherry on top? GORDY the accordion player.  Sweet man who comes around to each table, asks you where you're from, and then plays a song for you while waiting for his tip.  He is adorable.  i want to put him in my pocket.

Remember: 8 deadly sins.  You gotta come here.

20 min wait to get greeted. Yes complementary cheap wine, had wait an extra 20 min just for water when it super hot outside! And we asked 4 times. Food is no where near worth the price of what you pay for it. Basic pasta with canned tomatoe sauce the bread was stale and hard and we could never find our server for anything. The table next to us never got greeted so they it up and left. They give you complementary cappuccino from this machine that taste like hot coco. All and all it's a tourist trap.

This place is everything if you know what's good for you. The food is good, absolutely, but you really come here for the old Vegas vibe. I would only hope there was a place like this back home. A 20-40 dollar meal gets you a soup or salad, crazy good garlic bread, an Italian entree, unlimited wine throughout your meal, and a cappuccino to finish it off. I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE. Thank you to the returning visitors that told us about this place.

Wonderful atmosphere, great owners and amazing Italian food. You order a full course dinner: wine, soup or salad, main course, most delicious French bread and the best coffee at one price!! All around great meal at great prices! Definitely will do again!
all you can drink wine and a little old man enthusiastically playing the accordion while giving you and your girlfriend little winks??  sold.

Honestly, the food itself is a 3/5. But the service, atmosphere, and wine/garlic bread/ cappuccino that is included with each dinner is what will keep me coming back. This was, hands down, the best service I experienced while staying in Vegas over Labor Day weekend (2014). This includes a premier steak house and night club we visited. 

Overall, best service and best value.

Seriously you can find hundreds of places to eat better than here. I lived in Chicago for 28 years so I can say this Italian food was terrible.  We had the STEAK PIZZAIOLA and decided to share it. We were charged an extra $13 for sharing even though we only wanted 1 of everything:(  the pasta was over cooked and the sauce was bland and terrible.  The steak was the worst we have ever had. It tasted like it was made the day before and microwaved before serving it to us.  The wine is cheap crap but even if the best wine was served, it wouldn't make up for the terrible food.  The garlic butter on the bread tasted spoiled.  The ice water that they gave us tasted like sewage water. Needless to say,  I suffered a bad stomach ache.

In many ways the uniqueness of this restaurant merits a visit, "endless" wine with quaint nostalgia on the walls. But for some this can be a trip to one of Dante's levels; to start, by sitting at the table you become part of a factory-style service with explanations coming at you like an auctioneer, the food is served with efficient repetition and the quality is on par with chain Italian restaurants. That is you can understand and taste the concept of the dish made long ago, but the shortcuts have eviscerated the essence. If you are lactose intolerant--sucks for you. The included wine, garlic bread and cappuccino while nice for some make it too expensive to buy a nice bottle of wine or other sides. Love the pics of the famous on the wall.

This place is a bit overrated. The garlic bread is delicious but basic dishes, like the chicken parmigiana, isn't spectacular like I hoped it would be. For the price you pay, I would expect the food to be flavorful. 

Overall, if you're looking for nice atmosphere in Vegas with good sized portion dishes and "free" wine with your meal, this place is for you.

It is what it is, kitschy.  While Buca Di Beppo has the market on that keyword, there something nostalgic about coming to the real McCoy.

It's not really a "hole in the wall".  It's pretty large with varies rooms.  A block off the strip, its great for a large party get-together (wedding rehearsal, sweet 16, etc), because it won't set you back.  Reasonable prices, huge food, and somewhat delish.

Specials rule the nest, but there is a 25 item list will get your mouth watering.  Slurp.

It's fun.

The food was plentiful and tasty (but not amazing) and the staff was great.  The restaurant is dim and has a 70s feel to it.  The house wine is unlimited and complimentary and the after-dinner cappuccino is to-die-for.   

It was fine for the kids, but probably wouldn't be my first choice.  It was a little too quiet and "boring" for them.  As a date-night stop, I think it would be a great break from the craze of the strip.

Wife and I showed up without a reservation @ 8:15 p.m. Battistas's was very busy on this Wednesday night. Signed in prepared to wait (1 hr) , sat @ table in the bar. 
"Super"cocktail waitress Kayla took our drink order and served us from the bar menu, our request. Which consisted of Chianti (me), Moscato (wife). She had the Calamari frit appetizer, I had lasagna (best ever). This was as much food as we could handle Along with some garlic bread and salad, we were very full & happy campers. We've gotta get back soon to listen to the roving accordion player, as we dine Italian style. 
Battistas food is very good, and reasonable. We also loved the old school vibe. 
Viva la Italia & Battista's, molto grazie!

Yelp lists 2 stars as Meh, I've experienced better and that's the most fitting for Battista's.  

Walking into the "Old Vegas" institution I thought this might be a great find, or a mistake, you can say that about many things in Vegas.  I had a glass of wine at the bar before sitting down to get the feel of the place, lots of folks had reservations.  I should have stayed in the bar and ordered there instead of venturing into the dinner fixed price menu.

Service is great, the wait staff is the normal drink and food, union deal you find in Vegas.  Both servers were attentive.

The fixed price menu offers normal Italian fare, which is OK, the salad was OK, the pasta and meatballs were OK, the garlic bread was OK.  I've had better salads, spaghetti, meatballs, and sauce in many places.  Got - it's OK, just OK, not great, or good, just OK.  

The dinner menu includes "wine", you get to choose red or white, the waiter said their house wine is a burgundy, I'm thinking something between a drier malbec and a chianti, then I noticed it was refrigerated like a white.  It didn't taste like wine, it tasted more like a MD red, watered down with grape juice and water with a dash of vinegar thrown in for acidity.  I like wine, I'm not a wine snob, but I do know some, this was bad stuff, impressively bad.  I sipped through a full glass of this swill, attempting to determine if it was indeed that bad, and then what one would mix to make such an abomination.  

I don't see how the hole in the wall maintains a 4 star rating on most websites, they must have a small army of very dedicated folks entering great reviews to counter the actual reviews.

If you must eat here, stay at the bar and order a la carte, unless you really want to experience the house wine, if you do venture in to sample this liquid darkness, please post a response and tell me what you think is mixed together to make such a concoction. 

So to summarize - Great service, OK Food, old Vegas atmosphere, incredibly bad house wine.

My husband and I have been coming to Vegas for years, and have always been intrigued by this restaurant, but have never ventured inside. We chose to eat here on this trip, and were not as sold on it as some reviewers have been. The ambiance is cozy, with celebrity photos adorning the walls, but we had to use the flashlight on our phones to read the menu. The food was good, but not extraordinary enough to warrant the inflated prices of the entrees. Checked this off of our bucket list, but we don't feel the need to visit again ...

Mixed bag that gives what you put into it

I've been here a few times with large groups and it always come down to the group on how I enjoy my visit. 

The food is ok at best. it's simple, not fancy and does come as a full meal with house wine. Let me restate this is nothing fancy, including the wine. What Battista is good for is delivering a good deal. On all of my visits the service was middle of the road. There's nothing special in that area. It's slow but does deliver.

If you have a large party of friends and family who want a deal on mediocre Italian and cheap wine, this is your Hole In The Wall. If you're looking for something more, stick closer to the strip.

This is as close to can't miss as I know in Vegas. I usually sit at the bar where there is a limited menu but that's fine with me.  

Tonight I got the lasagna and garlic bread for $15.95.  It was fantastic with a capital "F".  Quick service sitting at the bar, I was in and out fast and had a great meal (more than I could eat) at a very reasonable price.  

Love Battista's - I'll be back again. And again, and again.....

This is my favorite Italian restaurant. The marinara sauce is so good it's better than most we had in Italy.  Very good food, nice staff, and excellent service.  My only complaint is they won't share their marinara sauce recipe

LOVED IT! How can you beat unlimited wine at your table? Food was really good, old school, heavy sauce.... dark lighting, funny old guy with accordion that plays all of a minute, odd decorations. 
I'm sorry if it isn't your style, but we will be back, WITH RESERVATIONS MADE, and our friends!

We just went to Battista's last night, 10/2/17 and we were really impressed. The service was awesome and the different dishes were brought out to us at just the right times. The portions were great and everything tastes awesome.

I had the veal parmigiana and my wife had the chicken parmigiana. I had the salad and my wife had the soup. Both came with garlic bread, house wine, a side of pasta and a capacino. I didn't realize it came with the side of pasta and wanted to order a side of spaghetti, so I was really happy that it came with the meal.

Both dishes and all of the sides tasted great. I don't like wine, but my wife said it was pretty good. Kind of about what you'd expect for a house wine that is included with your meal.

The side to the main course was spinach. I personally don't like spinach, but I did try it. It had good flavors, but I couldn't get past the texture. My wife thought it was good though.

Overall, I was very impressed with Battista's and would happily go back again and will be sure to tell my friends to go there.
